title: Blackwater
synopsis:
['Stannis's ships outnumber them 10:1 and his army outnumbers them 5:1. The people don't want Joffrey as their King. If Stannis breaches the King's Landing, he will kill every Lannister he can find and that scares Tyrion. Tyrion asks Shae to leave for safety, but she refuses. They make love as if this was Tyrion's last day on this Earth.
Maester Pycelle gives Cersei the essence of Nightshade, a dangerous poison. 10 drops in a cup of wine will bring painless death. Bronn and Sandor are about to engage in a vicious fight at the local tavern, when the bells toll, signaling the arrival of the enemy fleet.
Varys shares a map of all the tunnels under the city with Tyrion. Targaryens built the King's Landing to withstand a siege.Stannis' fleet arrives in black-water bay and assaults King's Landing. Joffrey is full of bluster and promises Sansa that he will return with Stannis's blood on his blade. The Targaryen fleet isn't in black-water bay and this makes Joffrey furious. Davos is mindful as he thinks this is a trap (and maybe Varys plans to bring in the fleet to attack them from behind). Cersei and the other Lady (including Sansa) of the castle are locked behind a strong-door for safety.
Cersei hates that Sansa is calm and composed under imminent danger. Sansa prays to the Gods and Cersei berates her for that, as praying is useless. Cersei indicates that Sansa may never be married to Joffrey, if they survive. If the city falls, Cersei would have to publicly beg for her life, as she has no chance of seducing Stannis in private. If the city falls, all the women will be raped.
Cersei says that Stannis may take the city, but he will not take the women alive. Cersei has a soldier inside the strong room, to kill them all when the city falls.Leading the defense, Tyrion destroys many of the attacking ships with an exploding ship (This was the reason that Tyrion and Varys had kept their own fleet away from black-water bay) full of wildfire, forcing the former to attack on land. On land, Stannis's forces are under direct attack from the fire, rocks and arrows of King's Landing army. Thousands die in the front on attack. Sandor leads the defense outside the mud gate, but is defeated (Half his men are killed and the enemy has overwhelming numbers) and returns inside, denouncing Joffrey (when he commands Sandor to go out and fight) and leaving.Soon, Stannis's forces erect ladders and start scaling the castle walls. Joffrey also escapes, giving the excuse that Cersei has called him back for some "urgent business". Tyrion convinces the Gold Cloaks to fight with him.Stannis' forces make it inside the castle, but Tyrion leads his men behind the Stannis' forces via underground tunnels and mounts a rearguard attack. But the enemy numbers are just too many. Tyrion and his men cannot hold them back.
Cersei goes to the throne room with Tommen, intending to kill him. Shae convinces Sansa to go to her chamber, where Sandor offers to take her back to Winterfell, but she decides to stay.As Tyrion lies wounded (after being hit by the sword of a Golden Cloak) and Cersei is about to poison Tommen, Tywin's forces, joined by Loras, arrive and defeat Stannis' forces, forcing the latter to retreat.']
plot outline: Confident of victory, Stannis Baratheon's fleet and army arrive at King's Landing and the battle for the city begins. The Lannisters are badly outnumbered but Tyrion has made sensible preparations and strikes a blow. When no one else will lead the troops beyond the city wall, Tyrion decides he will do so himself. Cersei plans for her and her children's future. It appears they are all headed for certain death but help suddenly arrives.
plot: Stannis Baratheon's fleet and army arrive at King's Landing and the battle for the city begins. Cersei plans for her and her children's future. Confident of victory, Stannis Baratheon's fleet and army arrive at King's Landing and the battle for the city begins. The Lannisters are badly outnumbered but Tyrion has made sensible preparations and strikes a blow. When no one else will lead the troops beyond the city wall, Tyrion decides he will do so himself. Cersei plans for her and her children's future. It appears they are all headed for certain death but help suddenly arrives.—garykmcd As Joffrey Baratheon prepares to face his uncle Stannis with his new weapon, Sansa plays the game, trying to get the young king killed. Tyrion leads his his men against the the Baratheon invaders in the climatic battle of the war, but is vastly outnumbered by Stannis. Cersei prepares for the worst. The War of the Five Kings reaches its climax, when Stannis Baratheon invades King's Landing, to overthrow his nephew Joffrey. The young ruler is soon unnerved and Tyrion has to rally the remaining Lannister troops in order to save his family from doom. Sansa plays tha game of thrones, and Cersei prepares for the worst. Stannis' fleet arrives to assault King's Landing. Sansa tries to manipulate Joffrey into leading the attack, hoping he gets killed, but Joffrey rather returns to Cersei's quarters as his mother requested, refusing to realize the royal castle may fall the first time in centuries, blinded by her lust for revenge on hand-brother Tyrion for marrying of her daughter. Leading the defense, Tyrion destroys many attacking ships with wildfire he had grand maester Pycelle prepare, forcing Stannis to attack on land with the survivors. Sandor Clegane's valiant defense outside the gate is defeated and he retreats 'tactically', denouncing his king. Joffrey retreats in fear as Tyrion rallies the Gold Cloaks into fighting with him. Stannis' forces enter the castle, but Tyrion leads his men behind Stannis' forces via sewage tunnels for a rearguard attack. Cersei goes to the throne room with Tommen, intending to kill him to save him from being captured. Shae convinces Sansa to hide in her chamber. Sandor Clegane offers to take Sansa to Winterfell, but she refuses to leave. With Tyrion wounded and Cersei about to poison Tommen, Tywin's army, joined by Loras, arrives and chases Stannis.—KGF Vissers

title: Valar Morghulis
synopsis:
['Pyrell visits Tyrion and tells him that he no longer the King's hand. Tyrion's face is heavily bandaged from a cut he received in battle. Joffrey appoints Tywin as the new Hand of the King.Joffrey sets Sansa aside in favor of marrying Margaery Tyrell (who had supported Tywin Lannister in their attack on the King's Landing and repel Stannis). This was done upon the request of Loras in response to Joffrey's favor granted to the house of Tyrell. Margaery says that she has come to love Joffrey from afar and agrees to the union as well. Cersei supports this in open court saying that Sansa's father was a traitor and her brother still rebels against the throne. Pycelle also says that the vow between Joffrey and Sansa was made before Ned and Robb betrayed the crown, so the vow is no longer valid.
For Petyr's collaboration, Joffrey assigns him the castle of Harrenhall. Sansa is happy, but Petyr warns Sansa that she is not free of Joffrey even if he is not marrying her. He will still enjoy beating and raping her.Varys visits Ros and tries to recruit her into his spy network saying that neither Petyr nor Tyrion were able to protect her.
Varys then tells Tyrion that it was a Gold Cloak, working on Cersei's orders, who attacked Tyrion in battle and tried to kill him. It was Tyrion's squire who saved him. Varys knows that it was Tyrion who saved the city and delivers Shae safely to him.
Tyrion fears for his and Shae's safety now that Tywin has replaced him as Hand and relieved Bronn from his command. Shae wants Tyrion to leave the King's landing and go with her to a quaint place, but he refuses as he belongs with his scheming and plotting family.Melisandre gives Stannis a new hope. Stannis is livid that he lost King's Landing to the attack from Twying and the Tyrells, and yet Melisandre had no clue (when she claims to speak for the Gods). Stannis murdered Renly on her advise. She says that the war has only just begun. She shows him a vision in the flames.
Brienne and Jaime are spotted by three Stark soldiers, whom she kills. Catelyn fails to dissuade Robb from marrying Talisa as she believes Walder Frey is a dangerous man to cross and make enemies with. But Robb doesn't listen to Catelyn since he is pissed with her for releasing Jamie.In Qarth, Daenerys ventures into the House of the Undying (the doors of the house lead Daenerys to her deepest dreams and wishes. She is distracted from her mission, but regains her mind in time) and successfully retrieves her dragons, who kill Pree. She then seals Daxos inside his own vault and claims his wealth for herself. She asks Jorah to get her a ship so she can travel to King's Landing and claim her throne.In Winterfell, Theon tries to convince his men to fight Robb's army (a section of which has surrounded Winterfell) (He cannot send word to Balon, as he killed all the ravens.. He cannot run as he will called coward for the rest of his life. Luwin advises Theon to join the Night's watch as then he will beyond the reach of the law), but they knock him unconscious, bag him up and leave for Iron Islands. A dying Maester Luwin (Donald Sumpter) (stabbed by one of the Iron Islanders) convinces Brandon's party to go to the Wall, to Jon. The Iron Islanders had burned Winterfell before they left and hence there was nothing when Brandon and Rickon emerged from hiding (with Osha and Hodor)..Arya, having escaped Harrenhal with Hot Pie and Gendry, wants Jaqen to train her in the killing arts. Jaqen says for that she will need to travel with him to Bravos, to become a faceless man. she cant go right then, as she needs to find Catelyn and Robb, and Sansa. She receives the gift of a valuable coin from H'Ghar, who magically changes his face. He tells Arya that if she ever needs him again, she should come to Bravos (across the narrow straight) and whisper the words "Valar Morghulis".North of the Wall, Halfhand forces Jon to kill him to prove his loyalty to the Wildlings. The Wildlings take him to their city to meet their king.
An army of White Walkers surrounds the Fist of the First Men, including Sam, who hides and watches them in horror.']
plot outline: With the battle won, King Joffrey names his grandfather, Tywin Lannister, as the Hand of the King. It has an immediate impact on Tyrion, who awakens in new and much smaller quarters wounded from the battle . Petyr Baelish is rewarded for his loyalty. The King takes an interest in Lady Margaery Tyrell and decides to marry her. Lord Varys recruits a new spy. Arya has managed to escape from Harrenhal with Jaqen H'ghar's help. He shows her something of himself. Theon and his men are surrounded at Winterfell and are forced to abandon their position. They don't leave much behind. North of the wall, Jon impresses his captor in a fight with one of his own. King Robb and Talisa are married despite the promise he had previously made. Brienne and Jaime Lannister continue their journey but not without difficulty. In Qarth, Daenerys enters the House of the Undying to retrieve her dragons.
plot: Joffrey puts Sansa aside for Margaery Tyrell. Robb marries Talisa Maegyr. Jon prepares to meet Mance Rayder. Arya says farewell to Jaqen H'ghar. Daenerys tries to rescue her dragons. With the battle won, King Joffrey names his grandfather, Tywin Lannister, as the Hand of the King. It has an immediate impact on Tyrion, who awakens in new and much smaller quarters wounded from the battle . Petyr Baelish is rewarded for his loyalty. The King takes an interest in Lady Margaery Tyrell and decides to marry her. Lord Varys recruits a new spy. Arya has managed to escape from Harrenhal with Jaqen H'ghar's help. He shows her something of himself. Theon and his men are surrounded at Winterfell and are forced to abandon their position. They don't leave much behind. North of the wall, Jon impresses his captor in a fight with one of his own. King Robb and Talisa are married despite the promise he had previously made. Brienne and Jaime Lannister continue their journey but not without difficulty. In Qarth, Daenerys enters the House of the Undying to retrieve her dragons.—garykmcd Sansa is released from marriage to Joffrey. Bran and Rickon escape Winterfell. Robb marries Talisa Maegyr. To get her dragons back, Daenerys must face the House of the Undead. Jon joins the wildlings as a spy. Arya says goodbye to Jaqen H'ghar.—Chris Green Tyrion is not rewarded but ostracized instead. Joffrey rewards Lord Tywin, Littlefinger and Loras Tyrell that asks Joffrey to marry his sister Margaery and he puts Sansa aside. Sansa is happy for his decision, but Littlefinger advises her that Joffrey will not stop bothering her and offers to help her to escape from King's Landing. Robb marries Talisa despite the advice of Catelyn that is against. Brienne saves Jaime from three Stark men that have recognized him on the road. Theon and his men are under siege in Winterfell and Dagmer stabs Luwin with a spear; hits Theon and they flee, burning Winterfell to the ground. Arya, Gendry and Hot Pie cross paths with Jaqen. He tells to Arya that he is going to Braavos and invites her to go with him. The say farewell to each other and Jaqen calls Arya Stark by her name and changes his face. Daenerys enters in the House of the Undying and is tempted by the Iron Throne; by Drago and her son; and she finally finds her three dragons that burn Pyat Pree to ashes. Then Daenerys finds that Xaro is a liar and does not have a fortune and she locks him and his lover Doreah in the safe. Jon and Halfhand have a sword fight provoked by Halfhand and Jon kills him, earning the confidence of the Lord of Bones. Sam is left behind and sees an army of wights and White Walkers heading to the Fist.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Tywin's Lannister army having beaten off Stannis, Joffrey rewards him, Littlefinger and the Tyrells, by marrying Loras's sister Margaery instead of Sansa, who is discarded on the premise any Stark engagement promise was already 'treason-taunted'. Varys explains to Tyrion his part in saving the crown won't be rewarded except by 'popular gratitude', he's dismissed as hand and left to recover in a petty room, with squire Podrickn who saved his life, and equally loyal Shae as only comfort. Theon holds a great speech to motivate his men to die fighting Robb's hugely superior siege forces, but after acclamation is knocked down and carried away on sneaky retreat while Winterfell burns and master Luwin, who failed to convince him to flee and join he Nightwatch, is mortally stabbed but gets to see Bran and Rickon return safely. Robb weds Talisa Maegyr, waving Catelyn's warning that breaking his engagement promise to lord Frey will compromise his royal credibility and vassal loyalty. Jon suffers endless taunting from Ygrette and is forced to kill in a sword duel Halfhand, who scolded him a traitor. Daenerys buries her dubious benefactor Xaro alive with his mistress with Jorah and enters alone the magical Iron Tower of Qarth to retrieve her dragons, who burn the magicians who chained her up. Stannis bitterly blames the red witch Melisandre for his failed siege and nearly strangles her, but by fire vision she convinces him to embrace a dire fate as king betraying all he loves. Arya, Gendry and Hot Pie a surprised to see death angel Jaqen, who invites Arya in vain to join him to Braavos and chances face. Cuffed Jamie keeps taunting Brienne, who insists serving only Catelyn, not the Starks, and fights off three of Robb's men who recognized the Kingslayer.—KGF Vissers

title: Valar Dohaeris
synopsis:
['Some of the Night's Watchmen, including Samwell Tarly (John Bradley) (who was saved by Jon's dire-wolf, who kills the white walkers who attack Sam) and Joer Mormont (James Cosmo), survive the White Walkers' attack and pledge to return to the Wall to warn the Seven Kingdoms. Joer knows that if they fail, every one they know and love will be dead before the winter is done.
Jon Snow (Kit Harington) is brought before Mance Rayder (Ciarán Hinds), the "King beyond the Wall", and pledges his loyalty to the Wildlings. Tormund (Kristofer Hivju) is Rayder's 2nd in command. Jon tells Rayder that he wants to join the Wildlings because he saw what happened at Caster's keep and the thing that took the boy. when he told his Lord commander, he already knew, but did nothing.
Mance has giants fighting for him in his army.Tyrion asks Bronn to return to his service. Bronn demands double his usual payment. Cersei (Lena Headey) is nervous about Tyrion's meeting with Tywin, as she fears that Tyrion knows that it was Gold cloak working on her orders who tried to kill him in battle.
A scarred Tyrion Lannister (Peter Dinklage) tries to get Casterly Rock from Tywin (Charles Dance). Tywin is angry that Tyrion defied him and brought a whore into his bed. Tyrion says that he organized the defense of the city, he bled in the mud, all while Joffrey cowered behind the castle walls. He demands gratitude in the form of Casterly Rock. Tywin agrees to give Tyrion a better room to stay, a suitable position with time, and even a wife if he manages to behave. But he will not give Tyrion Casterly Rock, as Tyrion killed his mother coming into the world. Tywin calls Tyrion spiteful creature, full of envy, with a low cunning. Tywin will not let Tyrion turn their family castle into a whorehouse.Margaery Tyrell (Natalie Dormer) engages in charity work with the orphans of King's Landing (the orphan children of all the soldiers who died in the Stannis invasion, while defending the city). Joffrey overrules Cersei (who wants Margaery to stop her work with the lower classes of the city, as that put Joffrey's life in danger) in allowing Margaery to continue with the work, especially now that the Tyrells are helping the capital with 100 wagons of food a day to prevent mass starvation.
Petyr Baelish (Aidan Gillen) offers to help Sansa Stark (Sophie Turner) escape King's Landing. Sansa is ready, and Petyr tells her to be ready to leave at a moments notice. Ros (Esmé Bianco) advises Shae (Sibel Kekilli) not to trust him.Davos Seaworth (Liam Cunningham) (was stranded on a rock after the wildfire explosion in the invasion of King's Landing) is rescued by Salladhor Saan (Lucian Msamati), the pirate. Davos's son Matthos was killed in the explosion. Salladhor does not want any more connections with Stannis Baratheon as he was promised riches and glory in exchange for 30 ships. Salladhor says that Stannis is a broken man and only see Melisandre. Davos returns to Dragonstone (Stannis's castle), where he unsuccessfully tries to kill Melisandre (Carice van Houten), who blames him for convincing Stannis (Stephen Dillane) not to let her join the battle (which led to death of thousands of men by wildfire explosion), and is imprisoned.Robb (Richard Madden) attacks Harrenhall castle (assigned to Petyr for his loyalty), but finds no resistance as the Lannisters had already abandoned the castle after pillaging it and killing all the Northerners living there. Robb inherits a ghost town.In Essos, Daenerys Targaryen (Emilia Clarke) arrives in the city of Astapor (A Valyrian town) to buy an army of brutally-trained slave soldiers (only 1 in 4 survive the brutal training), the "Unsullied" from their master Karznys. Missandei (Nathalie Emmanuel) is Daenerys's translator when she lands in Astapor. There are 8000 unsullied soldiers.
The warlocks of Qarth attempt to assassinate her, but she is saved by Barristan Selmy (Ian McElhinney) (the Gold Cloak who was fired by Cersei and Joffrey when they ascended to the throne), the former Kingsguard commander, who pledges his loyalty. Barristan says he was sworn to protect her family, but he failed. He begs her forgiveness.']
plot outline: Beyond the wall, those of the Night's Watch that have survived try to go south to warn everyone of what is coming. Samwell is taken to task for not having sent the ravens. Jon Snow meets Mance Rayder, the King beyond the Wall and is accepted among them. In King's Landing, Tyrion's face has healed and Cersei pays him a visit worried about what he might say about her to their father. Tyrion enlists Bronn, now a knight, to protect him. He doesn't get much satisfaction from his father who promises him better living quarters but not much else. Lady Margaery is cementing her place at court. Sansa meanwhile may have a way out of King's Landing courtesy of Lord Baelish. Davos Seaworth has survived and is rescued. He returns to Dragonstone intent on stopping Melisandre but soon finds himself in the dungeons. Robb Stark arrives at Harrenhal to find all of its occupants dead. Daenerys arrives in Astapor looking for an army. Ser Jorah tells her the Unsullied are the best fighters in the world.
plot: Jon is brought before Mance Rayder, the King Beyond the Wall, while the Night's Watch survivors retreat south. In King's Landing, Tyrion asks for his reward. Littlefinger offers Sansa a way out. Beyond the wall, those of the Night's Watch that have survived try to go south to warn everyone of what is coming. Samwell is taken to task for not having sent the ravens. Jon Snow meets Mance Rayder, the King beyond the Wall and is accepted among them. In King's Landing, Tyrion's face has healed and Cersei pays him a visit worried about what he might say about her to their father. Tyrion enlists Bronn, now a knight, to protect him. He doesn't get much satisfaction from his father who promises him better living quarters but not much else. Lady Margaery is cementing her place at court. Sansa meanwhile may have a way out of King's Landing courtesy of Lord Baelish. Davos Seaworth has survived and is rescued. He returns to Dragonstone intent on stopping Melisandre but soon finds himself in the dungeons. Robb Stark arrives at Harrenhal to find all of its occupants dead. Daenerys arrives in Astapor looking for an army. Ser Jorah tells her the Unsullied are the best fighters in the world.—garykmcd In the aftermath of a decisive battle, the newly formed Lannister-Tyrell alliance rules from the battered capital of the Seven Kingdoms. Elsewhere the tables have turned; Robb Stark makes his way across a bloodstained landscape while his captive runs free and his seat of power sits in ruin; Stannis Baratheon lies broken and defeated while unseen forces gather Beyond the Wall and Across the sea.—GibsonExplorer1976 Sam is saved from a wight by Ghost first and then by Mormont and a few survivors and Mormont tells that they need to return to The Wall to warn people that danger is coming to Westeros. Jon Snow meets Mance Rayder and he questions why Snow wants to join them and Mance is satisfied with his explanation. Tyrion has a meeting with his father that does not believe that he saved King's Landing from Stannis. Littlefinger offers to help Sansa to Leave King's Landing with him while Ros advises Shae to take care of Sansa and to not trust in Littlefinger. Davos is rescued from an island by Salladhor and he asks to be bought to Dragonstone with the intention of killing Melisandre. Robb and his army arrive at Harrenhal and find all prisoners murdered and only one survivor. Daenerys arrives at Astapor and she negotiates slave-soldiers known as Unsullied with the trader Kraznys mo Nakloz. She is also saved from an attempt of murder from a magician by Barristan Salmy.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil After a disrespectful visit from Cersei, probing what he'll tell their father about her and Joffrey, new Hand Tywin haughtily laughs away 'unfortunately not proven' bastard son and predecessor Tyrion's appeal for gratitude and reward with the ancestral castle for his part in the defense of the capital. While king and regent hide, Maergery's charitable military orphanage visit completes the Tyrell presence as prominent courtiers. Newly knighted Bron becomes Tyrion's guard again, for a raise. Anxiously Jon appeals to Wildling king Mance Rayder, an amused but suspicious fellow human, his bid to join their fight against the Undead winter monsters. The other Night Watch survivors realize, no raven having been sent by Samwell, they must rush back to warn the Wall it's time to prepare all for the ultimate defense. Salladhor's pirate ship rescues Davos Seaworth from a desert rock island and drops him at beaten king Stannis's castle Dragonstone, where his failure to discredit the red witch and her pyre-obsessed religion 'of the light' gets him locked up. After her remaining loyal Dothraki puke their guts out aboard, Danaerys and Jorah reach the city Astapor, where Kraznys mo Nakloz ruthlessly trains the unconditionally loyal 'Unsullied' slave soldiers for sale, which they want all 8,000 yet ready. Sacked guard commander Barristan Salmy is just in time to save her from a magical attempt on her life and offers his services 'to atone for his failure'. Robb and his men hoped for another battle to win, but find only corpses and one survivor at Harrenhal's ruins.—KGF Vissers

title: Dark Wings, Dark Words
synopsis:
['Brienne of Tarth (Gwendoline Christie) continues escorting Jaime Lannister (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) across the Riverlands to King's Landing. He engages her in a fight, which is interrupted by Bolton soldiers (Bolton is a senior commander in Robb's army who had sent his own best soldiers to track down Brienne and Jamie).After receiving the news of the sack of Winterfell and the disappearance of his brothers Bran (Isaac Hempstead Wright) and Rickon (Art Parkinson) (Robb fears that Theon may have taken them to the Iron Islands as hostages, but strangely there has been no word from Theon and no demands), Robb Stark diverts his attention from the war against the Lannisters to attend Catelyn's father's funeral in Riverrun, angering Rickard Karstark (John Stahl), who seeks vengeance for his sons who were killed by the Lannisters. Robb marches his armies to Riverrun to attend his grandfather's funeral. Karstark says that Robb lost the war the day he married Talisa.
Catelyn admits to Talisa that she hated Jon Snow when he was brought to her for the first time. But then he came down with fever and she prayed to the Gods to let him live, and she would love him as her own child. Jon Snow lived, but Catelyn couldn't keep her promise, which is the root cause of all the ills on her family.Arya Stark (Maisie Williams), Gendry (Joe Dempsie) and Hot Pie (Ben Hawkey) are also on their way to the wall (via Riverrun where Arya hopes to catch up with her Grandfather (Catelyn's father), not knowing he is already dead), but are waylaid by a rebel group, the "Brotherhood without Banners", and are taken to an inn, where the captured Sandor Clegane (Rory McCann) reveals Arya's identity. Arya doesn't have her needle sword as it was taken by a Lannister soldier at Harrenhall.Joffrey thinks nothing of Margaery. He only believes that with the Tyrells at their side, the Lannisters will crush the Northerners and plunder their lands. This will prevent another rebellion for a generation and more. Cersei plants a doubt in Joffrey's head that Margaery was married to the rebel Renly, who only recently wanted to kill Joffrey.
Meanwhile Shae tries to warn Sansa against putting too much trust in Petyr. Shae wants Sansa if Petyr tries to touch her or wants her to spy on anyone.
Tywin had warned Tyrion that he would kill the next whore he lays in bed with. Shae visits him and has sex with him, which he cannot resist.Margaery and her grandmother Olenna (Diana Rigg), the "Queen of Thorns", convince Sansa to tell them about Joffrey's (Jack Gleeson) flawed character. Olenna comes across as a straight shooter and convinces Sansa to spill the beans. She says Joffrey has no claim to the throne, as Robert had 2 brothers. Sansa reveals that Joffrey killed Ned, after he promised her mercy. He made her look at his severed head on a stake. She calls Joffrey a monster.
Soon thereafter Joffrey gets Margaery into his chambers makes her admit that Renly was gay. But she gets over it, and gets close to Joffrey.Theon Greyjoy (Alfie Allen) is tortured by soldiers of Ramsay, the bastard son of Roose Bolton. Ramsay had taken over Winterfell after Greyjoys soldiers left and abandoned Theon there. Theon admits that he took Winterfell as he hated the Starks and wanted to hurt them. Ramsay meets Theon as a spy for Yara. He promises to rescue Theon.Mance Rayder tells Jon that he got 90 clans north of the wall to fight together in the same army. They speak 7 different languages in his army. If they don't get south, they all die. The remaining Fist of the First Men are in full retreat towards the Wall. Sam is slowing them down, so the Night's watch carry him.Bran continues to have dreams about the 3 eyed raven.
Bran, Rickon, Osha (Natalia Tena), and Hodor (Kristian Nairn) encounter the siblings Jojen (Thomas Brodie-Sangster) and Meera (Ellie Kendrick), children of the Stark banner-man Howland Reed, on their way to the Wall. Jojen, who has been sharing Bran's strange dreams, tells him that he is a Warg, able to enter the minds of animals. Jojen teaches Bran on how to control his powers.']
plot outline: Bran dreams of the three-eyed raven but Osha doesn't want to hear the details. He meets Jojen Reed and his sister Meera. Bran and Jojen seem to have a great deal in common. Robb learns of the fall of Winterfell and also that Catelyn's father has died. He leads his troops to Riverrun for his grandfather's funeral and en route Catelyn tells Talisa of her desire that Jon Snow die when he was just a babe. Cersei tries to warn Joffre about Margaery's ambition but it falls on deaf ears. Brienne and Jamie continue their journey to King's Landing but run into trouble. Sansa believes that Baelish's desire to help her is because he loved her mother. Shae explains the nature of men to her. Sansa meets Margaery and her grandmother Lady Olenna and reveals her the truth about Joffrey. Samwell Tarley is having trouble keeping up as what remains of the Night's Watch as they try to reach the Wall. Arya is also trying to get to Riverrun but she and her companions meet up with the Brotherhood without Banners. At a nearby tavern, someone recognizes her.
plot: Bran and company meet Jojen and Meera Reed. Arya, Gendry, and Hot Pie meet the Brotherhood. Jaime travels through the wilderness with Brienne. Sansa confesses her true feelings about Joffery to Margaery. Bran dreams of the three-eyed raven but Osha doesn't want to hear the details. He meets Jojen Reed and his sister Meera. Bran and Jojen seem to have a great deal in common. Robb learns of the fall of Winterfell and also that Catelyn's father has died. He leads his troops to Riverrun for his grandfather's funeral and en route Catelyn tells Talisa of her desire that Jon Snow die when he was just a babe. Cersei tries to warn Joffre about Margaery's ambition but it falls on deaf ears. Brienne and Jamie continue their journey to King's Landing but run into trouble. Sansa believes that Baelish's desire to help her is because he loved her mother. Shae explains the nature of men to her. Sansa meets Margaery and her grandmother Lady Olenna and reveals her the truth about Joffrey. Samwell Tarley is having trouble keeping up as what remains of the Night's Watch as they try to reach the Wall. Arya is also trying to get to Riverrun but she and her companions meet up with the Brotherhood without Banners. At a nearby tavern, someone recognizes her.—garykmcd Bran has another strange dream and out of the blue, the boy of his dreams appears in their camp and introduces himself as Jojen Reed. After a moment of tension, Jojen and his sister team up with the group they head together to The Wall. Theon is tortured by his captors but a servant releases him and he rides to meets his sister. Loras Tyrell escorts Sansa to meet his sister Margaery and their grandmother Oleanna. The old lady asks to Sansa how Joffrey is like and after a moment of reluctance, Sansa tells that he is a monster. Robb and his mother Catelyn leave Harrenhal to go to the funeral of her father. They are also informed about the fate of Winterfell and that Bran and Rickon are missing. Arya, Gentry and Hot Pie are captured by the Brotherhood and brought to an inn to eat and drink. But they also capture The Hound and Arya's identity is disclosed. Jaime lures Brienne and takes her spare sword and they fight on a bridge, but they are surprised by riders from the House of Bolton led by Locke.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Theon squirms and squeals desperately under apparently pointless foot press torture at the Bolton castle, but is sneakily helped to an escape on horseback by their henchman Ramsay Snow. Pre-teen Jojen Reed first appears in Bran's dream, then joins his party to the wall with his sister Meera. Hearing of Catelyn's father's death, Robb takes his army to the funeral at castle Riverrun, where she confides in an uncle her guilt over having jealously prayed for Ned's infant bastard Jon Snow's death and remorsefully for recovery, as if this karma-triggered the constant misery since. Joffrey already heeds his Maergery Tyrell more then the regent Cersei, grandmother Olenna Tyrell gets discarded bride Sansa, who trusts Bailish as her mother's admirer, to confide Joffrey's cruelty into the new one. Brienne's haughty refusal to let Jaime help fight off Locke's Bolton party of northern cavalry gets them captured by the brigand band. The Brotherhood without Banners catches Gentry, Arya, and Hot Pie on a forest path to Riverrun and takes them to an inn, where next captive Sandor 'The Hound' Clegane betrays Arya's identity. Commander Mormont pulls rank against other Night Watch survivors tempted to leave screw-up Samwell behind to die.—KGF Vissers Brienne continues escorting Jaime Lannister across the Riverlands to King's Landing. He engages her in a fight, which is interrupted by Bolton soldiers who capture them. Robb Stark receives news that Winterfell was sacked, and his brothers Bran and Rickon have vanished. Robb diverts his attention from the war against the Lannisters to attend the funeral of Hoster Tully, Catelyn's father, in Riverrun. This angers Rickard Karstark, who seeks vengeance against the Lannisters for killing his sons. Arya Stark, Gendry and Hot Pie also make for Riverrun, but are waylaid by the rebel group "Brotherhood without Banners". They stop at an inn, where the captured Hound exposes Arya's identity. Margaery and her grandmother Olenna, the "Queen of Thorns", persuade Sansa to describe Joffrey's deviant character. Theon Greyjoy is tortured by unknown captors. Bran, Rickon, Osha, and Hodor encounter siblings Jojen and Meera Reed, children of Stark bannerman, Howland Reed. Jojen, who shares Bran's strange dreams, tells Bran that he can enter animals' minds.

title: Walk of Punishment
synopsis:
["Robb and Catelyn (Michelle Fairley) attend the funeral in Riverrun. Robb is frustrated with his lords chasing their own little battles which have no meaning in the larger war against the Lannisters and only give Tywin more time to maneuver things around to his advantage. Two more Lannister boys, great grandsons of Tywin's brother are in Stark possession Martyn Lannister (Dean-Charles Chapman) & Willem Lannister (Timothy Gibbons). This is the result of the Riverrun Lord Edmure Tully conducting an unauthorized action against a Lannister property. Lord Edmure lost 208 men in the effort. Robb is livid as the 2 boys are no leverage at all, and the Starks need their men more than Tywin needs his.
Since Robb is in Riverrun, Roose Bolton (Michael McElhatton) runs Harrenhall. Talisa helps heal the 2 captured Lannister boys. They had some minor wounds on their hands.Tywin knows that Jaime has escaped the Starks. But there is no information on where he is currently.
Tywin decides to send Baelish to Lysa Arryn (widow of Jon Arryn & sister is Catelyn) intending to have them married in order to secure her alliance, making Tyrion the new Master of Coin. Tyrion gets the financial accounts from Petyr and soon figures out that the crown owes millions to Tywin Lannister. In addition the King's Landing owes tens of millions to the Iron Bank of Braavos. If they fail to repay them, they will have no hesitation to fund their enemies. The bank will get their gold back, either way.The brotherhood considers Arya their guest. But advises her against leaving as the woods are not safe for the Starks. Sandor is their prisoner.
While Hot Pie decides to stay at the inn (he finds his calling in baking hot breads), Arya and Gendry follow the Brotherhood. Thoros of Myr (Paul Kaye) the man who captured Arya and Later Sodor, allows them to leave, but Arya is intrigued by their ways.Learning of the massacre at the Fist of the First Men, Rayder sends Jon with a band of Wildlings (led by Tormund) to scale the North Wall and attack the Watch while it is weakened. All they find at Fist of the First Men is dead horses, laid out on the ground in a pattern. The men of the Night's watch (around 300 of them) are nowhere to be found. They reckon that the men have retreated to the wall.
The surviving men of the Night's Watch arrive back at Craster's (Robert Pugh) Keep, where Sam witnesses Gilly (Hannah Murray) give birth to a son. Craster says he does not fear whats out there, as he knows that he is right with the real Gods and they will help him survive the winter. The newborn boy means that Craster will hand him over to the white walkers soon.Theon is freed from torture and captivity by an unknown man (Ramsay, who pretends to be a spy from Catelyn). But Theon is captured again by the soldiers. Ramsay again intervenes, kills the soldiers who were about to rape Theon, and helps him escape again.Melisandre leaves Dragonstone for an unknown mission, stating that the blood of a King is required for victory. She doesn't know how long she will be gone. Stannis thinks she is abandoning him. Stannis wants Robb dead. He wants another son, but Melisandre says he doesn't have the strength.Daenerys agrees to buy all the 8,000 Unsullied and the translator Missandei (Nathalie Emmanuel) for one of her dragons (he ship was worth a 100 soldiers and her jewels another 20 unsullied. And the Dothraki she brought with her were worth less than what it took to feed them, but they would be worth 3 unsullied), against Selmy's and Jorah's (Iain Glen) advice (A dragon is worth more than any army). She trades the biggest one.Jaime persuades his captor Locke (Noah Taylor) not to let Brienne be raped by telling them that Brienne is from the house of Tarth who owns the Sapphire Island which has produced every gemstone used in the Western world, but Locke cuts off the former's sword hand (as Jamie tries to bribe the Bolton Soldiers)."]
plot outline: Arya may have found a new protector but one of her friends decides not to continue on their journey. Robb arrives in Riverrun for his grandfather's funeral but is not pleased to hear that his uncle Edmure failed to follow his orders and attacked Tywin Lannister's army. His plans to entrap the Lannister's army are now ruined. At King's Landing, Tywin Lannister relieves Baelish of his duties as treasurer and assigns the task to his son Tyrion, who openly admits that he has far more experience spending money than managing it. While collecting the accounting books at Baelish's brothel, Tyrion has a gift for Podrick. In Astapor, Daenerys decides to buy all 8000 of the Unsullied and offers one of her dragons as payment. North of the Wall, the surviving members of the Night's Watch try to stay alive. They stop at Craster's keep and Samwell sees that Gilly is giving birth. Jaime manages to convince his captors that Brienne could bring a hefty ransom provided she is unharmed and left with her virtue intact. His captors agree but Jaime is forced to pay a dear price.
plot: Robb and Catelyn arrive at Riverrun for Lord Hoster Tully's funeral. Tywin names Tyrion the new Master of Coin. Arya says goodbye to Hot Pie. The Night's Watch returns to Craster's. Brienne and Jaime are taken prisoner. Arya may have found a new protector but one of her friends decides not to continue on their journey. Robb arrives in Riverrun for his grandfather's funeral but is not pleased to hear that his uncle Edmure failed to follow his orders and attacked Tywin Lannister's army. His plans to entrap the Lannister's army are now ruined. At King's Landing, Tywin Lannister relieves Baelish of his duties as treasurer and assigns the task to his son Tyrion, who openly admits that he has far more experience spending money than managing it. While collecting the accounting books at Baelish's brothel, Tyrion has a gift for Podrick. In Astapor, Daenerys decides to buy all 8000 of the Unsullied and offers one of her dragons as payment. North of the Wall, the surviving members of the Night's Watch try to stay alive. They stop at Craster's keep and Samwell sees that Gilly is giving birth. Jaime manages to convince his captors that Brienne could bring a hefty ransom provided she is unharmed and left with her virtue intact. His captors agree but Jaime is forced to pay a dear price.—garykmcd Daenerys, Jorah and Barristan walk along the Walk of Punishment where slaves are punished and left to die tied to a cross. Against the will of Jorah and Barristan, Daenerys buys 8,000 Unsullied soldiers and the slave translator Missandel giving her biggest dragon in return. Mance sends a small group to scale The Wall and attack Castle Black. Tywin summons the small council and names Tyrion as the new Master of Coin. Soon Tyrion finds that The Iron Throne has a great debt to the Iron Bank of Braavos. Theon is recaptured by his captors but a stranger saves him. Jaime and Brienne are prisoners of Locke and Jaime tries to convince him to let him go. Locke cuts his right hand off.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Arriving at Riverrun castle for his grandfather's funeral, Robb is furious that vindictive uncle Edmure Tully foolishly attacked the Lannister army as they can afford the greater losses better due to gold for recruiting while the element of surprise is lost. Tyrion warns the lavish royal wedding compromises the treasury 'earns' him an appointment to master of coin, he explains to his ignorant novice knight guard the Lannister gold is actually borrowed from the Iron Braavos bank, and must ultimately be repaid or they'll finance the enemy. Rewarded for loyal service with a first-ever brothel treat, squire Pod astounds them as the whores refuse payment for the mutual pleasure. Wounded Theon can't stay ahead of his Bolton persecutors, but when they have his butt bared for flight-punitive rape, Ramsay Snow catches up and slays them by archery. Wildling king Mance sends Jon Sow as local expert with an advanced party to have the Wall prepared. Before leaving by ship, Melisandre promises suspicious Stannis she'll be back and help him on the Iron Throne. In Astapor, Daenerys is told she's far too poor to pay for even a fraction of the 8,000 Unsullied, but Kraznys mo Nakloz accepts the largest dragon and throws in the interpreter girl Missandel as demanded. Jamie tries to sweet-talk brigand boss Locke to spare him and rape-readied Brienne for promises of sapphires and gold, but the 'insulted' fiend severs the 'spoiled-rotten daddy boy' Kingslayer's right hand.—KGF Vissers Robb and Catelyn attend Hoster Tully's funeral in Riverrun. Tywin Lannister sends Littlefinger to the Eyrie to marry Lysa Arryn to secure her alliance, and makes Tyrion the new Master of Coin. Hot Pie is employed by the inn, while Arya and Gendry follow the Brotherhood. Learning of the massacre at the Fist of the First Men, Rayder sends Jon and a band of Wildlings to scale the Wall and attack the Watch while it is weakened. The surviving Night's Watch men return to Craster's Keep, where Gilly gives birth to a son. Theon is freed by an unknown man, who later rescues him again. Melisandre leaves Dragonstone, mysteriously stating that the blood of a king is required for victory. Daenerys barters for the 8,000 Unsullied and the translator Missandei in exchange for one of her young dragons, ignoring Selmy's and Jorah's advice. Jaime persuades his captor, Locke, to prevent Brienne being raped by claiming her father will pay a huge ransom; Locke agrees but he then severs Jaime's right hand without warning.

title: And Now His Watch Is Ended
synopsis:
['Theon is betrayed by Ramsay, who returns him to the prison for torture (instead of taking him to Yara, as he had promised). Before being betrayed, Theon felt that Ramsay was his confidant. He admits that he burnt the Stark boys at Winterfell, but knew that they were only orphans living at some farmer. He did this to make his father proud.After a failed escape attempt, Jaime believes that he is lost without his sword hand. Brienne, knowing what he did for her (to save her from rape and humiliation), urges him not to give up hope. Breinne berates Jaime for quitting just when things got "real" for him in the real world.Tyrion wants Varys to give him proof that Cersei ordered the Golden Cloaks to attack him in BlackWater Bay, on the night of the Stannis attack. Varys has no proof, only whispers.
Varys (Conleth Hill) tells Tyrion how he became a eunuch (a sorcerer had paralyzed him, castrated him and used his parts to conjure a daemon), and that he now has in his power the magician who castrated him (he has the magician caged in a box and his mouth sewn with silk thread, so he cannot scream either), advising Tyrion to be patient for vengeance. This is why Varys supported Tyrion against Stannis and her magician, Melisandre.At Craster's keep, the surviving Night's Watchmen, starving, come into conflict with their host when they see that he is not releasing enough food for men to heal. Gilly wants Sam to help her save her baby's life. One of the Night's watch survivors starves to death (There is sawdust in the bread served to them) and is cremated by the troops.
The men call Craster stingy and confront him. Craster lashes out, and is killed by the men. Joer wants to punish them, but is stabbed in the back by his own men. Sam flees with Gilly and her son. One of the Night's watch Rast (Luke Barnes) (who hates Sam and Jon) led the rebels and takes control of the troops once Mormont is dead. Rast vows to cut Sam's throat.Arya, Sandor and Gendry are taken to the secret cave of the Brotherhood, meeting their leader, Baric Dondarrion (Richard Dormer), who later sentences Sandor to trial by combat with him. Sandor realizes that the brotherhood is made of Stark and Baratheon deserters, and have no honor. He says they are not fighting a war, they are running away from it. Sandor says he is no murderer, but Arya counters him and says she herself has seen Sandor butcher many men in King's Landing. Sandor says he was Joffrey's guard and was sworn to protect him, and hence killed anyone who attacked Joffrey.Joffrey and Margaery plan their wedding.
Cersei speaks to Tywin about reducing Margaery's influence on Joffrey. Cersei says that of all of Tywin's kids, she is the only one living by his ideals and keeping the family traditions and name alive. She wants more recognition from Tywin. Tywin admonishes Cersei about letting get Joffrey out of hand. Tywin wishes that Cersei knew how to manipulate Joffrey instead of Margaery.Tyrion had gifted 3 whores to Podrick, his squire, for saving his life from the Golden Cloaks, on the night of Stannis's landing. But the whores returned Podrick without accepting any payment from him. Ros also relays the same news to Varys, that Podrick was extra-ordinary. Ros also says that Petyr hasn't lost interest in Sansa, while he prepares for his journey to the Kingdom of Vale. Petyr is taking 2 feather-beds for his cabin for the journey to the Vale, which means he plans to take Sansa with him.
Varys inform Olenna about Petyr's plans re: Sansa, as he feels she cares for Sansa's well being. Also if Robb were to die, Sansa Stark is the key to have the Northern tribes on one's side. Varys is vary that Petyr might be plotting against the throne. He says that Petyr might use Sansa to align the Northern tribes behind him and mount an attack on King's Landing itself.
To foil Petyr's plans, Margaery proposes marriage between Sansa and Loras (Finn Jones). Sansa likes Margaery and agrees to the proposed match. Joffrey listens to her because because of her charity work the royal family is once again popular amongst the masses. Margaery convinces Joffrey that the masses love him as he led the defense of King's Landing.Daenerys meets with Kraznys (Dan Hildebrand) to complete the trade of a dragon for the Unsullied army. She tests the Unsullied, then orders them to kill their former masters, reclaims her dragon and frees the Unsullied, who all decide to follow her freely.']
plot outline: In King's Landing, Tyrion seeks out Varys' advice on getting revenge against those who tried to kill him. He learns the Varys' approach is to go slow. Cersei is troubled that Margaery has Joffrey wrapped around her little finger. Her father won't take her advice and tells her why. Varys approaches Margaery's grandmother to discuss matters of mutual interest. North of the Wall, some of the Night's Watch are on the brink of rebellion. Jaime is continually humiliated by his captors but Brienne has words of encouragement for him. Arya reaches the main group of the Brotherhood without Banners and Sandor Clegane learns his fate.
plot: Jaime mopes over his lost hand. Cersei is growing uncomfortable with the Tyrells. The Night's Watch is growing impatient with Craster. Daenerys buys the Unsullied. In King's Landing, Tyrion seeks out Varys' advice on getting revenge against those who tried to kill him. He learns the Varys' approach is to go slow. Cersei is troubled that Margaery has Joffrey wrapped around her little finger. Her father won't take her advice and tells her why. Varys approaches Margaery's grandmother to discuss matters of mutual interest. North of the Wall, some of the Night's Watch are on the brink of rebellion. Jaime is continually humiliated by his captors but Brienne has words of encouragement for him. Arya reaches the main group of the Brotherhood without Banners and Sandor Clegane learns his fate.—garykmcd Jaime is humiliated by his captors and Brienne unsuccessfully tries to protect him. Tyrion meets with Varys, who tells of how he was sold to a sadistic sorcerer that castrated him. He advises Tyrion to be patient and finishes opening a large box and Tyrion sees the sorcerer locked inside. Joffrey shows The Great Sept of Baelor to Margaery and Cersei realizes that Margaery has Joffrey under control. Then she meets her father and tells him that she is worried since Margaery is manipulating Joffrey. Varys meets Olenna and they have a long conversation about Sansa. Then Margaery meets Sansa and tells her that they would be sisters if Sansa married her brother Loras. The Hound is judged by The Brotherhood without Banners through a trail by combat. Theon is led by the youngsters that saved him to meet his sister Yara in a dark chamber and soon he finds that his escape was another sadistic means of torturing him. Lord Commander Mormont tries to calm down his men that are starving but one of them kills Craster and another one stabs Mormont in the back, effectively killing him. Sam flees with Gilly and her son through the frozen woods. Daenerys has a surprising attitude toward Kraznys mo Nakloz and leaves Astapor with her dragons and the army.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Miserable Theon confides his consuming guilt over failure both as Greyjoy and near-Stark into Ramsay, on the way to safety with his sister, only to end back up the torture saltire as it was a ploy. Locke keeps terrorizing Jaime, before and after a valiant left-hand sword-grabbing escape attempt, with Brienne finally realizing he deserves respect and they must collaborate, the Hound survives a Brotherhood 'trial' by combat while Arya's party arrives. Patriarch and Hand Tywin duly dismisses Cersei's claim to be 'his listening child' as she warns of Maergery's manipulative influence on almost enchanted royal groom Joffrey, who basks sharing her popularity while preparing their grand wedding. Varys explains to Tyrion his miserable youth as petty actor sadistically castrated, working himself up by dirty tricks and finally ready for revenge, then agrees with Olenna Tyrell that Sansa, abandoned by ambitious Littlefinger, would be a fit bride for Loras at the family seat. Mounting discontent among the hungry, shit-shoveling Night watch men leads to a brawl with stingy host Craster that gets him and intervening commander Mormont fatally stabbed. Daenerys pays Kraznys mo Nakloz a dragon, only to order it to incinerate the slave soldier merchant and order the Unsullied to murder every free man in Astapor, then declares them free trusting none knows an alternative to following her.—KGF Vissers Theon's "rescuer" betrays him, returning him to the prison for more torture. After a failed escape attempt, Jaime believes himself lost without his sword hand; Brienne urges him to remain hopeful. Varys tells Tyrion how he became a eunuch, then shows him the sorcerer who castrated him, who is now his captive. He advises Tyrion to be patient for vengeance. At Craster's Keep, the surviving Night's Watchmen, starving, come into conflict with their host. Craster and Mormont are slain in the struggle, and Sam flees with Gilly and her new-born son. Arya and Gendry are taken to the Brotherhood's secret cave, meeting their leader, Beric Dondarrion, who later sentences Sandor Clegane to trial by combat with him. Margaery proposes that Sansa marry Loras, which Sansa finds agreeable, unaware he is gay. Daenerys meets with slaver Kraznys to trade one dragon for the Unsullied army. Once the deal is struck, she commands the Unsullied to kill all the slave masters, and has her dragon burn Kraznys; she frees the Unsullied, who willingly follow her.

title: Kissed by Fire
synopsis:
["Tyrion convinces Olenna to pay for part of the royal wedding. The wedding is turning out to be extravagant. Its a huge expense and the Lannisters are at war. Olenna counters that The House of Tyrell has already provided 12,000 infantry, 1800 mounted lancers, 2000 in support. Plus the daily provisions of 100 carts of food for the city. A million bushels of wheat, and half of million bushels each of barley, oat and rye. 20,000 heads of cattle, 50,000 sheep. Still, Olenna agrees to pay for half the wedding.
Petyr has one of his spies seduce Loras, and word reaches him that the Tyrells plan to wed Loras and Sansa.
Sansa tells Petyr Baelish about her decision to stay in King's Landing (reversing her earlier plea where she was ready to leave with Petyr at a moment's notice). The Lannisters discover the Tyrells' plot to marry off Sansa to Loras. Sansa is the key to the North and a future heir to Winterfell. To prevent the union, Tywin plans to marry Sansa to Tyrion, and Cersei to Loras, despite the siblings' protests.Stannis confesses his infidelity to his wife, Selyse (Tara Fitzgerald), who then tells him she already knows and approves of it. Selyse is happy that Melisander gave Stannis a son, which she herself failed to do (3 stillborn boys). His daughter, Shireen (Kerry Ingram) (who is disfigured on one side of her face) (Stannis has told Shireen that Davos is a traitor and is rotting in a dungeon for his crimes), sneaks into the dungeon to visit Davos and starts teaching him to read.Sandor kills Dondarrion in the trial by combat and is released. However, Dondarrion is resurrected seemingly by the power of the Lord of Light. Arya is pissed that Sandor will be released as she has seen him murder all the Stark servants in the King's Landing.
Gendry decides to stay with the Brotherhood (Arya is furious as she wants to get together with Robb, and she believes Robb needs good men like Gendry.. She is hurt as she felt Gendry was her family), and Thoros and Dondarrion plan to ransom Arya to Robb at Riverrun. Dondarrion has been back from the dead 6 times now. He has the Lord of the Light brings him back. But they cannot bring back Ned Stark, the man without a head.Jaime is delivered to Roose Bolton. Roose tells Jaime how King's Landing was attacked by Stannis's army, but Tywin arrived just in time and his forces prevailed. All the Lannisters are alive and well. The infection in Jaime's cut hand has spread and the corruption to the rotten flesh has to be burned off with boiling wine.
Jaime knows that everyone despises him and calls him Kingslayer (Oathbreaker and a man without honor), for killing his own grandfather, The Mad King. Jaime confesses to Brienne why he killed Aerys. Aerys was Jamie's grandfather & was known as the mad king. Aerys was obsessed with Wildfire and was turning his population against him. To prevent total annihilation, Tywin led an army to the King's Landing (Robert Baratheon was also on his way to the city with his army, but Tywin got there first, with an aim to depose Aerys and take over the crown) to which Aerys ordered that it be set fire to (Aerys had placed vats of wildfire all over the city and was ready to ignite them), along with the rest of the city. Aerys ordered Jaime to kill Tywin and then set fire to the wildfire vats in the city. To save thousands of lives, Jamie killed his own grandfather and that's when Ned Stark found him. Ned never wanted to hear Jaime's side of the story and judged him guilty from the first moment.Robb executes Richard Karstark after the latter murders two captive Lannister boys. Karstark is adamant that this is vengeance for Jaime killing his son, but RObb is clear that Karstark killed 2 innocent & defenseless boys. Karstark challenges Robb's rule of the North, leaving him no choice but to execute the entire Karstark clan. This is despite the advice from Catelyn & Talisa. Edmure Tully even says that Robb should keep Lord Kastark hostage in exchange for loyalty from the Karstark army. But Robb is adamant that he cannot fight for justice, if he does not serve justice in his own army.
With the Karstarks abandoning him (accounting for half his forces), Robb plans to make a desperate alliance with Walder Frey (David Bradley). RObb plans to make an alliance with Frey and combine their forces to attack Casterly Rock, the home of the Lannisters.Jon succumbs to Ygritte's seduction and breaks his vows to have sex with her. Ygritte is in love with Jon and wants him to stay with the Wildlings. Jon also gives vital information about the wall's defenses to the Wildlings. He tells them about the size of the patrols North of the wall and whom they are made of. 3 of the 19 castles guarding the wall are manned. The biggest is Castle Black (the others are Shadow Tower and Eastwatch by the sea), the HQ for the Night's watch. 1000 men remain in Castle Black. Tormund does not trust Jon, and berates Ygritte for having slept with him.
The Unsullied select a warrior called Grey Worm (Jacob Anderson) as their leader on Daenerys' order. Barristan and Jorah have served many drunks and lech in their lives. They are looking for someone they can serve with pride. They both wonder if Daenerys is that person. Jorah doesn't trust Barristan yet as just a few months ago, he sent assassins to kill Daenerys on Robert's orders."]
plot outline: Brienne and Jaime are delivered to Lord Bolton where Jaime has his wounds treated. He tells Brienne about the events leading up to killing the King and acquiring the name Kingslayer. Sandor Clegane engages in mortal combat but succeeds in gaining his freedom much to Arya's annoyance. At King's Landing, Cersei begins plotting against the Tyrells and seeks Baelish's assistance. Tyrion discusses the cost of the upcoming wedding with Lady Olenna and she agrees to pay half the cost. Tywin Lannister has become aware of the Tyrells plans to have Sansa Stark marry Ser Loras Tyrell but he has his own idea as to who she should marry. Robb has to deal with the murderers of Tywin Lannisters young nephews including Lord Rickard Karstark whom he executes against the advice of those around him. Daenerys' army is on the move. North of the wall, Jon and Ygritte become lovers.
plot: Robb's army is falling apart. Jaime reveals a story, to Brienne, that he has never told anyone. Jon breaks his vows. The Hound is granted his freedom. The Lannisters hatch a new plan. Brienne and Jaime are delivered to Lord Bolton where Jaime has his wounds treated. He tells Brienne about the events leading up to killing the King and acquiring the name Kingslayer. Sandor Clegane engages in mortal combat but succeeds in gaining his freedom much to Arya's annoyance. At King's Landing, Cersei begins plotting against the Tyrells and seeks Baelish's assistance. Tyrion discusses the cost of the upcoming wedding with Lady Olenna and she agrees to pay half the cost. Tywin Lannister has become aware of the Tyrells plans to have Sansa Stark marry Ser Loras Tyrell but he has his own idea as to who she should marry. Robb has to deal with the murderers of Tywin Lannisters young nephews including Lord Rickard Karstark whom he executes against the advice of those around him. Daenerys' army is on the move. North of the wall, Jon and Ygritte become lovers.—garykmcd Jon Snow is questioned about the defenses of The Wall. Then he goes with Ygritte to a cave where they have sex. Daenerys asks her officers who should be their leader and they indicate Grey Worm. Lord Rickard Karstark kills the Tywin's grandsons and Catelyn, Talisa and Edmure advise Robb to keep Rickard as a hostage since if he executes Rickard, his men will leave him and return home. However Robb beheads Rickard in the name of the justice and he loses half of his army. Jaime and Brienne are delivered to Lord Bolton and he gives accommodations to them and Jaime's arm is treated to avoid gangrenous. The Hound defeats Dondarrion and is released by the Brotherhood. Tyrion makes financial arrangements with Oleanna to share the expenses of the wedding. Then Cercei and he are summoned by their father that explains that each one of them will get married.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Tyrion is relieved when lady Olenna Tyrell agrees to pay half the lavish royal wedding, to appease the war-tested people, but shocked like Cersei that Hand Tywin decides to curb and balance the growing Tyrell sway by marrying Tyrion to Sansa, presumed heiress of the North when Robb falls, and Cersei, instead of Sansa, to gay heir Loras Tyrell, who is successfully seduced into bed by handsome squire Olyvar, actually one of Petyr's 'working boys'. Jon Snow finds his Halfling commander most suspicious of him as 'military expert', and finally rewards Ygritte for her help by breaking his vow of celibacy, bathing naked and making love in a cave pool. Robb almost halves his army by refusing to spare uncle Rickard Karstark's life, even beheads him in person, for the cowardly vengeful murder of Tywin's innocent boy grandsons Martin and Willem Lannister, fears Walter Frey won't forgive his broken promise to marry a daughter and intends to seize the undefended Lannister home estate. Arya pouts as Sandor Clegane survives a duel to the death with flaming swords and sees his adversary Dondarrion revived by the magic of the light religion, sighing he looses part of himself at every resurrection, pouts worse as Podric deserts her quest for Beric's merry brigand band. Jamie's agony end sin a climax when he's delivered to Lord Bolton, has a barred master fire-cleanse his severed hand and finds relief bathing with shy Brienne, who learns the noble truth about his bad reputation as Kingslayer, actually attempting to prevent senseless bloodbaths. Knights Jorah and Barristan Selmy however happily serve blindly loyal under Daenerys, who has her Unsullied soldiers choose new, 'free' names and an executive officer: Grey Worm, who chooses to keep his slave name as it stands for this moment of emancipation, his birth name for the enslavement.—KGF Vissers Tyrion, knowing the Crown is deeply in debt to the Iron Bank, persuades Olenna to pay for half of the royal wedding. Sansa tells Littlefinger she wants to remain in King's Landing. Tywin discovers the Tyrells' intend to marry Sansa to Loras. To circumvent this, he plots to marry Sansa to Tyrion, and Cersei to Loras over both Lannister's objections. Stannis confesses his infidelity to his wife, Selyse, who says she knows and approves. Their daughter, Princess Shireen, sneaks into the dungeon to visit Davos and teaches him to read. Sandor is released after killing Dondarrion in the trial by combat. Thoros resurrects Dondarrion, using the Lord of Light's power. Gendry remains with the Brotherhood, who intend to ransom Arya to Robb. After being delivered to Roose Bolton, Jaime tells Brienne he killed "Mad" King Aerys Targaryen to prevent his destroying King's Landing with wildfire. Robb executes Lord Karstark after the latter murders two captive Lannister boys. With the Karstarks abandoning him, Robb hopes to make a new alliance with Walder Frey. Ygritte seduces Jon, who breaks his Night's Watch vows. Daenerys encourages the Unsullied to choose a leader among them; they choose Grey Worm.

title: The Climb
synopsis:
['In King's Landing, Tywin coerces Olenna into agreeing to marry Loras to Cersei (Olenna says Cersei is having sex with Jaime, while Tywin says Loras is gay) (he threatens Olenna that He will assign Loras to life threatening assignments unless she agrees to his marriage to Cersei). Cersei reveals to Tyrion that it was Joffrey who tried to have him killed during the siege.Baelish tells Varys that he has caught Ros as Varys' informant (Ros had told Varys about Petyr's plan to take Sansa away with him, based on which Varys made the plan to marry Sansa to Loras. But then Petyr found out and changed the game by getting Sansa married to Tyrion instead) and has given Ros to Joffrey, who kills her with his new crossbow.Tyrion confesses to Shae and Sansa about the upcoming marriage. Now Sansa is really sad to have refused Petyr's offer to take her away from King's Landing.In the Riverlands, Melisandre meets up with Thoros and Dondarrion. it seems that the Brotherhood is also part of the Lord of Light cult worshiped by Melisandre. In addition they speak the same code word "Valar Morghulis" given by the assassin Jaqen to Arya when he left her outside Harrenhall. Melisandre is alarmed that Thoros has brought Dondarrion back from the dead 6 times already.
Melisandre buys Gendry from the Brotherhood (Saying that the Light Lord needs his service), foretelling that Arya will kill many people. Gendry doesn't want to leave the brotherhood, but Melisandre tells him that he will make Kings rise and fall.Robb makes a new deal with Frey by agreeing to give him Harrenhal and marry his uncle Edmure Tully (Tobias Menzies) to Frey's daughter, Roslin. Edmure is not happy with the arrangement, but Robb forces him to accept this as the price for kidnapping the great grandsons of Tywin's brother, who were later murdered by Richard Karstark.
Roose Bolton plans to send Jaime to King's Landing In exchange for his soldiers cutting off his arm and immunity from any future persecution (he knows that the Lannisters will kill him if he sends Jaime back North to Robb), but refuses to send Brienne with him.At an unknown location, the mysterious man (Ramsay) continues to torture Theon. Theon is kept starving and without water for days on end. Ramsay starts cutting bits of flesh off Theon's fingers. Ramsay ask Theon to guess where he is and who his torturer is. Theon believes that he is Karhold, and that the man is the son of Rickard Karstark, a banner-man of RObb Stark. But Theon is wrong.In the North, tension arises between Osha and Meera. Meera is from the south and Osha from the North, and they don't see eye to eye on anything. Jojen has a vision that Jon Snow is on the wrong side of the wall and surrounded by enemies. Due to the visions, Jojen gets frequent strokes.Meawhile at the wall, Jon guides a battalion of wild-ling soldiers (including Ygritte (Rose Leslie)) to scale the wall. The wall is 700 ft high, all made of ice. Tormund comments that the Night's Watch is getting smaller every yr and there was a time when there were no trees within a mile of the wall (which allowed the wild-lings to hide as they approached the wall). Tormund has scaled the wall many times. Ygritte tells Jon that she knows he didn't switch sides when he met Mance. She says they are both mere soldiers in their armies and nobody cares for their life. She says they both need to care for each other.
Beyond the Wall, Sam continues his flight with Gilly and her son. Sam shows Gilly the dragon-glass he recovered from the Fist of the First men. The dragon-glass is thousands of yrs old. They are a few days march away from the wall
Jon and Ygritte manage to climb the Wall with two other Wildlings (Tormund and Orell). The other climbers perish in an avalanche triggered towards the mid part of the wall.']
plot outline: In King's Landing, Tywin Lannister and Lady Olenna meet to discuss his children's proposed marriages. She puts up a good fight but in the end is forced to admit defeat. Tyrion and Cersei bemoan their fate. Tyrion is forced to tell Sansa what his father has decided. Baelish meanwhile eliminates a spy in his midsts. Arya takes an immediate dislike to Melisandre when she arrives at their camp. That dislike grows when she learns Melisandre is taking someone away with her. Jaime negotiates his release and return to King's Landing. Robb, his army depleted, realizes he has no choice but to repair relations with the Freys. However, since Robb didn't marry one of the Frey daughters as promised, they demand Edmure Tully marry one of them instead. Jon, Ygritte and many others arrive at the Wall and begin the 700 ft. climb
plot: Jon and the wildlings scale the Wall. The Brotherhood sells Gendry to Melisandre. Robb does what he can to win back the Freys. Tyrion tells Sansa about their engagement. In King's Landing, Tywin Lannister and Lady Olenna meet to discuss his children's proposed marriages. She puts up a good fight but in the end is forced to admit defeat. Tyrion and Cersei bemoan their fate. Tyrion is forced to tell Sansa what his father has decided. Baelish meanwhile eliminates a spy in his midsts. Arya takes an immediate dislike to Melisandre when she arrives at their camp. That dislike grows when she learns Melisandre is taking someone away with her. Jaime negotiates his release and return to King's Landing. Robb, his army depleted, realizes he has no choice but to repair relations with the Freys. However, since Robb didn't marry one of the Frey daughters as promised, they demand Edmure Tully marry one of them instead. Jon, Ygritte and many others arrive at the Wall and begin the 700 ft. climb—garykmcd Tywin summons Lady Olenna Tyrell and forces her to accept the marriage of Loras and Cersei. Meanwhile Tyrion discloses his father's decision to Sansa in front of Shae. Melisandre meets the Brotherhood without Banners and takes Gendry into her custody, delivering two sacks of gold to them. Edmure is forced to marry Walder Frey's daughter to help Robb. Theon Greyjoy continues to be tortured and loses his little finger. Jon Snow, Ygritte and the wildling party climb the Wall, but when the ice cracks, they almost die.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Hand Tywin blackmails Olenna Tyrell into accepting Loras's shambles marriage to Cersei and Tyrion's to Sansa, as feared by both his kids and bemoaned by their betrothed. Ramsay intensifies Theon's torture, tearing up a little finger, and withdraws his promise of release if Theon guesses where he is and who takes revenge why, smirking he just enjoys sadism. Robb gets a last change to replete his Northern army: Walter Frey will join if his scorned daughter gets to marry, as second choice after Robb failed to, unwilling vassal Edmure Tully, who thus redeems himself. Bran makes his jealously bickering girl companions make up wile Jojen Reed suffers heavy spasms during a vision of Jon's peril. Trying to climb the wall is snowy weather, Jon can barely hook up with Ygritte dangling by a rope after they are cut off as a crack makes a large ice slate come loose and drags half their Wildling party down. The Brotherhood without Banners welcomes red witch Melisandre, who is amazed at the sixfold resurrection and promises Gendry a great future while he's wheeled away to be sold for gold to sustain the brigands and villagers.—KGF Vissers In King's Landing, Tywin coerces Olenna into an agreement to marry Cersei to Loras. Cersei admits to Tyrion that Joffrey tried to have him killed during the siege. Tyrion informs Shae and Sansa about his and Sansa's betrothal. Littlefinger tells Varys that he discovered Ros was Varys' informant and that Joffrey killed her. In the Riverlands, Melisandre buys Gendry from the Brotherhood, and foretells Arya that she will kill many people with brown eyes, green eyes, and blue eyes; she promises they will meet again. Having married Talisa, Robb strikes a new agreement with Walder Frey by giving him Harrenhal and having his uncle, Edmure Tully, marry a Frey daughter or granddaughter. Roose Bolton plans to send Jaime to King's Landing, but refuses to allow Brienne to accompany him. At an unknown location, the mysterious man continues torturing Theon. In the North, tension arises between Osha and Meera. Beyond the Wall, Sam continues his flight with Gilly, while Jon and Ygritte scale the Wall with two other Wildlings.
