title: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
synopsis:
["In the North, Jojen tells Bran they must go beyond the Wall to find the raven, to Osha's horror. Bran says that they have to find the raven as it has been coming to his dreams ever since he fell from the tower. Osha tells the story when her man turned into the un-dead back when she was behind the walls. She says she promised to get Bran to the Castle Black, but no further.Jon and Ygritte's relationship deepens, making fellow Wildling Orell (Mackenzie Crook) angry. Orell confronts Jon and says that Ygritte is only in love with Jon for the moment, as it suits her. She knows how things are, but Jon doesn't and which is why he will never hold on to her. Orell propositions Ygritte for himself. But she says that she loves Jon.
The wild-ling attack party gathers across the wall and marches towards Castle Black. Mance had told them that he will light the biggest fire the North has ever seen as a signal to mount the attack.
Jon warns Ygritte that the wild-ling's invasion has failed 6 times in the last 1000 yrs and is bound to fail again (every boy in the North is taught this growing up). But Ygritte says Mance is different.Theon is emasculated by his torturer. his cock is cut off in the most painful manner possible. Ramsay sends 2 whores to have sex with Theon. They give him a hard erection by dry humping him. Thats when Ramsay enters the room, intervenes and cuts off his cock.Talisa reveals to Robb that she is pregnant. Because of rains the Tullys and Starks are delayed in reaching the Frey castle. Catelyn is worried as Lord Frey is already annoyed as he wanted a King for his daughter, and he is very likely to take this delay as a slight towards his family.Arya runs away from the Brotherhood, only to be captured by Sandor.
Melisandre reveals to Gendry that his father was Robert. This is why the Gold Cloaks wanted to find him, and kill him. She takes him back to King's Landing on a ship.Shae tells Tyrion that she will not continue their relationship once he marries Sansa. Shae still wants Tyrion to leave King's Landing and go with her to a quaint location, where they can live out their life in peace. But Tyrion refuses again. Shae knows she is Tyrion's whore and she will be nothing when he is tired of having sex with her.
Margaery tells Sansa to make the best of her situation. Tyrion is not the worst Lannister and plus he has never mis-treated Sansa in any way. Meanwhile Bronn advises Tyrion to marry Stark and keep having sex with Shae. His son with Sansa will be the Lord of Winterfell one day.
Tywin counsels Joffrey and discusses Daenerys with the former dismissing the danger she might pose. He says dragons have been dead and gone for over 300 yrs now. Joffrey is pissed with Tywin that he has taken complete control over the City's affairs (he is even holding the small council meetings in his offices, rather than in the Small Council chamber. To attend a small council meeting, Joffrey would now have to go to Tywin), but feels powerless to say something very strongly to himDaenerys reaches the city of Yunkai and declares war on them. The Yunkai has 200,000 slaves and her plan is to secure their release to build her forces even further before she marches on King's Landing. She brow beats the Yunkai ambassador into giving her gifts of Gold and still threatens him with annihilation unless the Yunkai set their slaves free.Roose Bolton departs Harrenhal for Edmure's wedding while Jaime says farewell to Brienne and departs for King's Landing (he promises Brienne that he will return the Stark girls to their mother). On the road, he finds out (from Maester Qyburn, who treated Jaime's cut & infected hand) (Qyburn was removed from his formal office for conducting experiments on dying men, without their permission. But Qyburn says his insights on diseases has helped him save many lives) that Locke refused Brienne's father's ransom (her father offered 300 gold dragons for her safe return, but Locke believes that her father owns sapphire mines and thus is being cheated.. This was Jaime's lie to Locke). Jaime returns to Harrenhal to find Brienne in a pit fighting a bear. He leaps in and saves Brienne and departs once more, this time with her."]
plot outline: Robb and his entourage are traveling to the Freys but wet weather has delayed them. Talisa has big news for him. Jon Snow, Ygritte and the others have crossed into the south and are headed to Castle Black. Margaery has good advice for Sansa who dreads the thought of having to marry Tyrion. For his part, Tyrion thinks she's too young. Shae is also unhappy with Tyrion's upcoming marriage and she wants them to run away. Tywin Lannister makes sure King Joffrey knows exactly who is on charge. Daenerys and her army arrive at Yunkai, the Yellow City. Ser Jorah recommends that they simply bypass the walled city as conquering it serves no useful purpose. She disagrees but the slavers of Yunkai refuse to free all of their slaves. Melissandre arrives in King's Landing with Gendry and tells him of his ancestry. Arya meanwhile runs off on her own and into the arms of an enemy. Jaime begins his trip to King's Landing but refuses to leave Brienne behind. Theon Greyjoy is comforted by two young ladies but his captor has something else in mind.
plot: Jon and the wildlings travel south of the Wall. Talisa tells Robb that she's pregnant. Arya runs away from the Brotherhood. Daenerys arrives at Yunkai. Jaime leaves Brienne behind at Harrenhal. Robb and his entourage are traveling to the Freys but wet weather has delayed them. Talisa has big news for him. Jon Snow, Ygritte and the others have crossed into the south and are headed to Castle Black. Margaery has good advice for Sansa who dreads the thought of having to marry Tyrion. For his part, Tyrion thinks she's too young. Shae is also unhappy with Tyrion's upcoming marriage and she wants them to run away. Tywin Lannister makes sure King Joffrey knows exactly who is on charge. Daenerys and her army arrive at Yunkai, the Yellow City. Ser Jorah recommends that they simply bypass the walled city as conquering it serves no useful purpose. She disagrees but the slavers of Yunkai refuse to free all of their slaves. Melissandre arrives in King's Landing with Gendry and tells him of his ancestry. Arya meanwhile runs off on her own and into the arms of an enemy. Jaime begins his trip to King's Landing but refuses to leave Brienne behind. Theon Greyjoy is comforted by two young ladies but his captor has something else in mind.—garykmcd Jon Snow, Ygritte and the survivors of the wildling party head to Castle Black. Daenery is decided to take the city of Yunkai and she meets one of the wise masters of Yunkai to offer his and the other masters' lives if they surrender to her. Arya flees from the camp of the Brotherhood but she is caught by The Hound. Theon is released by two gorgeous women that seduce him; out of the blue, his torturer returns and tells that he will castrate him. Jaime leaves Harrenhal escorted by the Bolton guards but when he learns the fate of Brienne, he forces the men to return to rescue the lady from Locke and an angry bear.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Delayed by weather on the way to Frey, Robb enjoys distracting sex with Talisa, who reveals expecting his child. Theon duly fears another ploy when released from the cross by two sexy girls teasing him to awake his 'famous boner', but just when he gets into it Ramsay returns with two goons, ordering castration. Jaime is impressed by the healing skill of the suspended master while finally sent on for exchange, but forces his escort to return to Harrenhal after hearing Brienne will he the brotherhood's 'entertainment', as turns out facing a bear with a wooden sword, but Jaime jumps in saving both. Joffrey summons hand Tywin, displeased the small council meeting in his tower are hard to attend and receiving a promise to be involved in important decisions, albeit 'when necessary'. Maergery convinces Sansa to give marriage to Tyrion a chance, he fails to appease 'scorned' Shae who must move out. Arriving in King's landing, Melissandre tells Gendry he's king Roberts bastard 'heir'. Jon Sow and Ygritte tease even closer as their survivor party continues to the Wall, which he warns stood all six previous Wildling invasions. The rich, well-fortified, yellow 'bed slaves' city of Yunkai offers to buy off Daenerys with all she needs to continue the conquest of Westeros, but she demands the release of all salves, with excessive wages, despite a warning the city has powerful friends.—KGF Vissers In the North, Jojen tells Bran they must not stop at Castle Black, but travel beyond the Wall to find the Three-eyed Raven; Osha warns them about the White Walkers. Jon and Ygritte's relationship deepens, angering jealous Wildling, Orell. Theon's torturer castrates him. Robb learns Talisa is pregnant. Arya escapes the Brotherhood, only to be captured by Sandor. Melisandre tells Gendry that his father was King Robert. Shae warns Tyrion that their relationship will end once he marries Sansa. Tywin and Joffrey discuss Daenerys; Tywin dismisses her as a potential threat. Daenerys reaches Yunkai and declares war on the city. Roose Bolton leaves Harrenhal for Edmure Tully's wedding while Jaime bids Brienne farewell as he departs for King's Landing. On the road, Jaime learns Locke has refused Brienne's father's ransom. He returns to Harrenhal to find Brienne in a pit fighting a bear. He saves her and they depart to King's Landing together.

title: Second Sons
synopsis:
['King's Landing hosts Tyrion and Sansa's wedding. Tyrion insists to Sansa that he didn't ask for this. Tyrion promises her that he wont ever hurt her.
Cersei shows displeasure upon Margaery (she tries to call Cersei sister and Cersei tells her that if she does that again, she will have her strangled in her sleep. Tyrells and Lannisters will never be equals). As Father of the Realm, Joffrey gives away Sansa. He takes a perverse pleasure in Sansa's pain. Joffrey removes the stool for Tyrion at the wedding podium, due to which he is not able to complete the ceremonial duties. But Sansa is gracious and sits down on the ground, so that Tyrion can complete the ceremony.
At the wedding feast Tyrion gets drunk and causes a scene, with Tywin demanding he make a baby soon. Loras approaches Cersei when she is brooding alone after the wedding ceremony and she insults him and dismisses him from her presence. Joffrey corners Sansa and tells her that he intends to rape her once Tyrion passes out. Joffrey insists to conduct the bedding ceremony and Tyrion warns that he will cut off Joffrey's cock, if he continues to insist.
In their bedroom, Tyrion tells Sansa that they will not consummate their marriage until she wants to. Tyrion passes out on a couch. Shae enters the chamber the next morning and finds them sleeping in separate beds.Sandor tells Arya that she is safe with him. He even saved Sansa from some raper at King's Landing, but Arya refuses to believe him. Arya thinks Sandor is taking him back to King's Landing.
Sandor reveals to Arya that they are heading for the Twin Towers (The house of Frey) to ransom her to Robb & Catelyn, as they will be there for Edmure's wedding to Roslin.Stannis releases Davos, demanding he respect Melisandre. Melisandre arrives in Dragonstone with Gendry. Melisandre says that there is power in King's blood. She plans to sacrifice him for her next move. She seduces Gendry and extracts blood from him with three leeches. Davos knows that Stannis is not happy with sacrificing an innocent boy and is only doing so under Melisandre's influence. Stannis says he saw the vision of a great battle in the snow.
In a magical ritual, Stannis casts them into a fire naming three usurpers: Robb, Balon and Joffrey.Daenerys finds out that Yunkai has employed a mercenary company called the "Second Sons". Mero (Mark Killeen) their main leader insults Daenerys during his meeting with her, where he called her a whore (he is insolent and invites Daenerys to sit on his lap) and looked forward to raping her after the war. Mero commands an army which is 2000 strong. Armored and mounted. Daenerys offers that Mero and his men fight for her, but they have already accepted Gold from Yunkai and cannot betray their trust.
One of the lieutenants named Naharis (Ed Skrein) kills the other leaders and pledges his and the company's loyalty to Daenerys.
Naharis was ordered by Mero to kill Daenerys by sneaking into her camp at night, but Naharis refuses and this leads to a fight, which results in Mero's death.Sam and Gilly are attacked by a White Walker who has come to claim the baby, whom Sam destroys by the dragon-glass dagger. The white walker freezes, shatters and dusts away after being struck by dragon glass.']
plot outline: The time for Tyrion's wedding to Sansa has arrived. His resolve to not go through with wedding has evaporated and he now accepts its inevitability. He explains to Sansa why he feels he has to go through with it and she too is prepared to do her duty. Joffrey goes out of his way to embarrass them both at the ceremony. Arya assumed Sandor Clegane was taking her to King's Landing and is surprised when tells her where they're going. The Yunkai have hired an army to protect them and Daenerys tries to convince their leaders to come to her side. Most reject her proposal but one decides to take matters into his own hands. Melissandre returns home intent on showing the power of a king's blood. Sam and Gilly encounter a white walker.
plot: Daenerys tries to persuade the Second Sons to join her against Yunkai. Stannis releases Davos from the dungeons. Sam and Gilly are attacked by a White Walker. Sansa and Tyrion wed. The time for Tyrion's wedding to Sansa has arrived. His resolve to not go through with wedding has evaporated and he now accepts its inevitability. He explains to Sansa why he feels he has to go through with it and she too is prepared to do her duty. Joffrey goes out of his way to embarrass them both at the ceremony. Arya assumed Sandor Clegane was taking her to King's Landing and is surprised when tells her where they're going. The Yunkai have hired an army to protect them and Daenerys tries to convince their leaders to come to her side. Most reject her proposal but one decides to take matters into his own hands. Melissandre returns home intent on showing the power of a king's blood. Sam and Gilly encounter a white walker.—garykmcd Daenerys asks Barristan to schedule a meeting with the leaders of the 2000- professional mercenaries Second Sons. The vulgar Captain Mero, Captain Prendahl na Ghezn and Lieutenant Daario Naharis discuss with Daenery and she gives two days to the leaders to think about her proposal. Mero returns to his camp and decides to kill Daenerys. During the night, Daario comes to Daenerys tent and gives the heads of the two captains to her and swears to serve her. Sam, Gilly and her baby head to Castle Black and they are surprised by a White Walker. Sam stabs the creature with the dragonglass dagger that he found and he kills the White Walker. The Hound is bringing Arya to The Twins to deliver her to Robb. Melisandre brings Gendry to Dragonstone and seduces him. Then she places three leeches on his body to suck Gendry's blood. Then Stannis throw them into the fire as part of the witchcraft and says the name of people he wants dead: the usurpers Robb Stark, Balon Greyjoy and Joffrey Baratheon. Tyrion gets married with Sansa and gets drunk in the feast. Then he tells to Sansa in their room that he will sleep in a separate bed, and will only consume the marriage if she wants.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Joffrey enjoys humiliating dwarf groom Tyrion and scorned teen bride Sansa, but Hand Tywin prevents a real conflict among his offspring. By legendary analogy, Cersei viciously refuses 'upstart' Maergery calling her sister (in law). Drunk Tyrion sends off Shae and decides against the consummated wedding night Tywin is after. Gendry is seduces in bed by with Melisandre, but only for leeches to harvest his royal blood, which Stannis uses to magically curse his three 'usurper' rivals. Yunkai hired 2000 mounted mercenaries, the Second Sons, to scare off Danaerys, but she offers to buy off 'to the winning side' their captain Mero, Prendahl na Ghezn and lieutenant Daario Naharis, denied for credibility, yet Daario, elected to assassinate her at night, decapitates his superiors instead, coveting her. Arya is surprised Sandor 'The Hound' Clegane, who caught her trying to flee the Brotherhood, plans to sell her not to Joffrey but to Robb. Facing the first White Walker, Sam discovers the 'dragon glass' knife he found kills such monsters.—KGF Vissers King's Landing hosts Tyrion and Sansa's wedding. Cersei shows her displeasure toward Margaery and Loras. At the wedding feast, Tyrion causes a drunken scene. Tywin demands that Tyrion quickly produce a Lannister heir, but Tyrion later assures Sansa their marriage will never be consummated without her consent. Sandor tells Arya they are heading for the Twins to ransom her to Robb. Stannis releases Davos, demanding he respect Melisandre. She arrives in Dragonstone with Gendry, whom she seduces to extract his blood using leeches. In a magical ritual, Stannis casts the blood-filled leeches into a fire while naming three usurpers: Robb Stark, Balon Greyjoy, and King Joffrey. Daenerys learns that Yunkai has employed mercenaries called the "Second Sons". One of their handsome lieutenants, Daario Naharis, kills the other leaders and pledges the company's loyalty to Daenerys. Sam and Gilly are attacked by a White Walker, which Sam destroys with a dragonglass dagger.

title: The Rains of Castamere
synopsis:
["Robb discusses with Catelyn his plan to attack Casterly rock after joining with Walder Frey's armies. Catelyn agrees, but sees that the plan is risky because if Tywin attacks from King's Landing, Robb's forces will not have any place to retreat. They will be caught between Tywin's army and the sea.
Robb arrives at the Twins and apologizes to Walder (for breaking his vow to marry one of his daughters or grand-daughters. Frey introduces all of them to Robb), who appears to accept. Robb promises to do everything so that the Freys and the Starks can once again be friends. Frey meets Talisa and calls her a pretty face and says he would have done the same at Robb's age without even a 2nd thought. Edmure marries Roslin (who is revealed to be a beauty) and they leave to consummate. Just after that, Walder's men murder Catelyn, Talisa and most of the Stark banner-men, while Roose Bolton, revealed as a Lannister loyalist, kills Robb.Sam, Gilly and her son arrive at the Wall and go to castle Nightfort, west of Castle Black. It was abandoned as it was too big and impossible to maintain. The castle Nightfort has a portal through the wall, just like Castle Black. This portal can be opened from the North side of the wall, if one can find it. Sam read about this in a book.Nearby, Jon refuses to kill a farmer (who is breeding horses for the Wall, as he feels the old man is no threat to the Wildlings). Tormund and Orell want to kill the farmer for his Gold and Steel. Tormuns wants to kill the farmer, so the Night's watch sends a patrol, whom they can ambush easily out in the open. Jon alerts the farmer by making noise with his sword.
The farmer had escaped the wild-lings on a horse, but they were in pursuit. he was cornered near where Bran & his party were resting. Hodor panics and starts making noises, which Orell hears. So, Bran gets into Hodor's head to calm him, while Jon is attacked. This is an ability not possessed by any Wildling. Orell wants Jon to kill the farmer, but he again refuses. Ygritte protects Jon.
Then Bran gets into the dire-wolves around Jon and gets the dire-wolves to protect Jon, while Jon kills Orell and escapes, leaving Ygritte a furious behind with Tormund.Osha, Rickon and his dire-wolf depart for the Last Hearth (The Umbers are Stark banner-men and will protect Rickon), while Bran and his remaining company plan to go beyond the Wall. Osha is against going past the wall, but Bran and Jojen and Meera are determined. Osha tells them they can avoid climbing the wall by going through the Bay of Seals in a boat. The bay of seals is protected by a castle of the wall. But Bran says that of the 19 castles only 3 are manned. They sealed the gates with ice and stones before abandoning the castles, but Bran plans to open it up again.Daenerys sends Jorah, Naharis and Grey Worm to infiltrate Yunkai and open the city gate for her army. This plan was suggested by Naharis, as he knew the defenses of the city very well. But Jorah suspected that Naharis could be leading him and Grey worm into a trap, have them killed and then collect his fees from the Yunkai, which he cont have to split 3 ways now that his partners are also dead. Grey Worm trusts Naharis and that settles the matter for Daenerys.
Naharis enters through the back gates, kills the guards, open the front gates and lets Daenerys's army inside. Yunkai soon falls to her forces as the slaves surrender and refuse to put up any fight.Arya also arrives at the Twins (under protection from Sandor.. Sandor and Arya have learned to tolerate each other. Arya promises to kill Sandor one day, by putting a sword through his eye) and witnesses a part of the massacre (She witnesses Robb's dire-wolf being killed in its cage), but Sandor knocks her unconscious and carries her to safety."]
plot outline: Robb, his wife Talisa and mother Catelyn arrive for the marriage of Edmure Tully to one of Walder Frey's daughters. There is considerable tension between the two families but Robb's sincere apology for not marrying one of Frey's daughters is well received. It doesn't stop the elderly Frey from being both crude and rude towards his guests. Edmure is pleasantly surprised to see that his bride is to be Frey's prettiest granddaughter, Roslin. The festivities continue but Walder Frey has something very special planned. Arya and Sandor Clegane arrive at the Twins but too late to do anything. Daenerys meanwhile orders the attack on Yunkai based on information provided by Daario. Brandon learns the strength of his powers. Jon Snow is forced to choose between the Watch and Ygritte.
plot: Robb and Catelyn arrive at the Twins for the wedding. Jon is put to the test to see where his loyalties truly lie. Bran's group decides to split up. Daenerys plans an invasion of Yunkai. Robb, his wife Talisa and mother Catelyn arrive for the marriage of Edmure Tully to one of Walder Frey's daughters. There is considerable tension between the two families but Robb's sincere apology for not marrying one of Frey's daughters is well received. It doesn't stop the elderly Frey from being both crude and rude towards his guests. Edmure is pleasantly surprised to see that his bride is to be Frey's prettiest granddaughter, Roslin. The festivities continue but Walder Frey has something very special planned. Arya and Sandor Clegane arrive at the Twins but too late to do anything. Daenerys meanwhile orders the attack on Yunkai based on information provided by Daario. Brandon learns the strength of his powers. Jon Snow is forced to choose between the Watch and Ygritte.—garykmcd Walder Frey sarcastically welcomes apologetic king Robb for the consolation prize wedding of one of his royally scorned (grand)daughters with Lord Edmure Tully, who is relieved it's presentable Roslin. When everyone enjoys the lavish feast, the Twins castle hall doors are locked and crossbows murder most of Robb's men. Walder ignores Catelyn's threat to slit his wife's throat, preferring his revenge on Robb over his own family. Sandor 'The Hound' Clegane arrives disguised as pork seller to deliver Arya during the slaughter, which even includes Robb's wolf, and manages to take her away before she can tempt fatally futile revenge. On their travel to the wall, Bran's party seeks shelter in an old tower, where he must force himself to use his warg powers to keep undetected. Jon arrives just there with the Wildling party while stealing horses, refuses to murder the breeder and seizes the opportunity to kill off the others, except Ygritte, who fought with him until he bolts. Bran decides to send his kid brother and spare Stark heir Rickon to a separate hideout with Osha, while he, Jojen and Hodor continue seeking the Wall. Jorah and Baristan fear Daario Naharis lures them into a trap, but despite the number of slave guards the trio takes the Yunkai gate and the others surrender to Danaerys.—KGF Vissers Catelyn, Talisa and Robb arrive at the Twins for the wedding of Edmure Tully. Dany plots to conquer Yunkai with the help of her crew. Jon and the wildings come to a misunderstanding which will test Jon's loyalty. Bran and his crew make a big decision Sam, Gilly, and her son arrive at the Wall. While hiding in a tower during a thunderstorm, Bran enters Hodor's mind to prevent his revealing their hiding place to Wildlings below with his laments. Nearby, Jon refuses to murder a farmer, whom Ygritte kills; Jon is attacked by the other Wildlings but escapes. Bran uses his warg ability to save Jon, who kills Orell before escaping, leaving a furious Ygritte behind with chief Tormund. Osha, Rickon, and his direwolf, Shaggydog, depart for the Last Hearth, while Bran, Meera, Jojen, Hodor and Bran's direwolf, Summer, plan to go beyond the Wall. Daenerys sends Jorah, Naharis, and Grey Worm to infiltrate Yunkai and open the city gate for her army. Yunkai slaves willingly surrender to her forces. Robb arrives at the Twins and apologizes to Walder for reneging on his agreement to marry a Frey daughter. Walder appears to accept his apology while Edmure marries Roslin Frey, Walder's sole pretty granddaughter. After the newlyweds leave the feast, Walder's men murder Catelyn, Talisa and the Stark bannermen, while Roose Bolton, now a Lannister loyalist, kills Robb. Ser Brynden Tully, Catelyn's uncle, survives, having excused himself from the feast just prior to the slaughter. The Hound and Arya arrive at the Twins during the massacre, but the Hound carries her to safety.

title: Mhysa
synopsis:
['Roose Bolton annihilates Robb's entire army in its barracks. The mastermind of the massacre is revealed to be Tywin (Tywin defeated Robb without ever meeting him in battle), who rewards House Frey with the Seat of Riverrun and appoints Bolton Warden of the North (till TYrion's son comes of age). Joffrey is not thankful even to Tywin, for winning the war against the Starks. Joffrey plans to serve Robb's head to Sansa at his wedding feast, which Tyrion objects to as Sansa is no longer his to torment.
Tyrion tells Tywin that the North will never forget this treachery against the House of Starks. He also refuses to force sex upon Sansa, to get her pregnant.
Sansa is already in tears and forlorn. Tyrion has no courage to say anything to her.
Cersei tells Tyrion that she wont be marrying Loras, and that if he cares for Sansa, he should put a child in her.Theon learns he was surrendered by his men in return for safe passage from Winterfell and that his captor is Ramsay (Iwan Rheon) (who had seized the Winterfell castle), Roose Bolton's bastard. The deal (with Robb, delivered via Ramsay) was that Ramsay would let Yara go, if Theon was delivered to them. Ramsay names Theon "Reek" for the stink emanating from him. Theon begs to be killed. Ramsay has brutal hold over Theon's mind and Theon shudders at the mere sight of Ramsay.
Ramsay sends Theon's penis to Balon and orders him out of the North. Balon has captured lands and strongholds and is very reluctant to give it up for Theon, whom he does not consider his son and now Theon cant even further the Greyjoy line. Balon says that Theon disobeyed his orders by attacking Winterfell. Against Balon's wishes, Yara decides to rescue Theon. She sails with a ship and 50 best killers on Iron Islands. She sails towards Dreadfort (the House of Roose Bolton).Arya and Sandor kill some Frey soldiers mocking Robb's death. This is the first man Arya killed. He was claiming to be the one who sewed the Wolf's head to Robb's body. She remembers the coin from Jaqen.
Arriving in the capital with Brienne, Jaime is reunited with Cersei.
Varys makes friends with Shae and wants her to leave King's Landing (he gives her diamonds to start a new life). Varys thinks Shae can harm Tyrion in the future (while he believes Tyrion is one of the few people who can make King's Landing a better place), just by her presence. Shae takes this as an insult and thinks that Tyrion asked Varys to do this.In the North, Tarly's party encounters Bran's (who have spent the night sheltering at the Nightfort and Tarly's party ended up staying there as well, meeting at night) and gives them the dragon-glass weapons (Sam figures that Bran is Jon's brother (he recognizes the dire-wolf travelling with Bran) and because Jon saved Sam's life, Sam does everything to help Bran and his party). Sam says that there is nothing up North but death, and begs them to come to Castle Black and reunite with Jon. Sam tells Bran and Jejun on how he killed a white walker with a dragon glass. But Jejun is clear that only Bran can stop the white walkers and the dead army (which is countless by now) by travelling North of the wall. Bran, Jejun, Meera and Hodor continue North with Sam showing them the passage through the wall.
Sam reaches Castle Black. He and Maester Aemon send ravens to alert the Seven Kingdoms about the White Walkers. Gilly names the baby Sam. One of the letters is dispatched to Stannis at Dragonstone.Being hit several times, Jon still manages to escape from Ygritte (Ygritte had tracked Jon down alone, and struck him with arrows) and returns to Castle Black.In Dragonstone, Davos helps Gendry escape (Davos is against Melisandre's plan to kill Gendry in aid for Stannis's ascension the the throne. Stannis is with Melisandre on this as Robb is dead, and his name was on one of the leaches. He believes in Melisandre's magic). So, Davos helps Gendry escape. Stannis wants to punish Davos, when he delivers Aemon's message to Stannis.
Stannis decides to head north and aid the Watch against the White Walker threat (Melisandre agrees that Stannis's true fight lies to the North of the Wall), forgiving Davos and keeping him.In Essos, the freed slaves of Yunkai receive Daenerys as their "mother"']
plot outline: The news of the red wedding has reached King's Landing and Tywin Lannister calls a meeting of the small council. Joffery rejoices at the news but no one supports his plan to present Sansa with Robb's head at his wedding to Margaery. Arya flees the Twins with Sandor Clegane as her protector but not before she sees what they've done to Robb. She exacts a modicum of revenge. Ygritte catches up with Jon Snow but he survives the encounter making it to Castle Black as do Sam and Gilly. Bran makes it through the wall and into the unknown lands. Jaime and Brienne arrive in King's Landing.At Yunkai, Daenerys awaits the reaction of the thousands of slaves who are now free.
plot: Bran and company travel beyond the Wall. Sam returns to Castle Black. Jon says goodbye to Ygritte. Jaime returns to King's Landing. The Night's Watch asks for help from Stannis. The news of the red wedding has reached King's Landing and Tywin Lannister calls a meeting of the small council. Joffery rejoices at the news but no one supports his plan to present Sansa with Robb's head at his wedding to Margaery. Arya flees the Twins with Sandor Clegane as her protector but not before she sees what they've done to Robb. She exacts a modicum of revenge. Ygritte catches up with Jon Snow but he survives the encounter making it to Castle Black as do Sam and Gilly. Bran makes it through the wall and into the unknown lands. Jaime and Brienne arrive in King's Landing.At Yunkai, Daenerys awaits the reaction of the thousands of slaves who are now free.—garykmcd Arya and The Hound escape riding through the massacre of the Stark's army and Arya sees the decapitated body of her brother Robb. When Arya sees a group of drunken soldiers mocking her brother, she steals The Hound's knife and stabs one soldier in his throat while The Hound kills the others. The castrated Theon is tortured and his father and sister receive his penis in a box. Yara Greyjoy travels with fifty men to bring her brother back home. In King's Landing, the Lannisters celebrate the death of Robb. Ygritte reaches Jon Snow and he is seriously wounded by his lover. Davos releases Gendry and gives a boat to him. Sam and Gilly meet Bran and his friends and he gives the dragonglass dagger to Bran. Daenerys is worshiped by the former slaves of Yunkai.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Walder Frey celebrates the Starks slaughter, despite his wife's death, unaware Sandor the Hound Clegane rescues Arya. The small council also rejoices in the news, attended by king Joffrey, whom only hand Tywin can stop from serving Robb's head to Sansa at his wedding with Maergery. While Ramsay tortures Theon into even deeper despair, begging for a mercy kill, receiving his penis and threat other body parts follow unless Balon Greyjoy surrenders his conquests doesn't impress the heartless father, but sister Yara Greyjoy sails off on a risky rescue mission with 50 warriors. Jaime gets a lukewarm welcome, master Aemon works on a hand prosthesis. The other surviving halflings suspect Ygritte of deliberately failing to wound Jon mortally when their paths cross, he reaches Castle Black just like Sam and Gilly, while Bran's party passes the Wall into the unknown with the dragon glass knife Sam gave him. Davos liberates Gendry, who gets a boat to return. The freed slaves of Yunkai hail queen Daenerys Targaryen.—KGF Vissers The massacre's mastermind is revealed to be Tywin Lannister, who rewards House Frey with the Seat of Riverrun and appoints Roose Bolton as Warden of the North. Theon learns his men surrendered him in return for safe passage from Winterfell and that his captor is Ramsay Snow, Bolton's bastard son. Against Balon's wishes, Yara leads a mission to rescue Theon. Arya and the Hound kill some Frey soldiers mocking Robb's death. Jaime and Brienne arrive in King's Landing where Jamie is reunited with Cersei. Sam and Gilly encounter Bran's party and, unable to prevent them traveling beyond the wall, Sam gives them dragonglass weapons. Sam returns to Castle Black with Gilly. Maester Aemon has Sam send ravens to alert the Seven Kingdoms about the White Walkers. Ygritte finds Jon and shoots him with three arrows, deliberately only wounding him. He escapes, returning to Castle Black. In Dragonstone, Davos helps Gendry escape to prevent his being sacrificed; Stannis forgives Davos, then heads north to aid the Watch against the White Walker threat. In Essos, the freed Yunkai slaves receive Daenerys as their "mother".

title: Two Swords
synopsis:
["Tywin (Charles Dance) oversees the reforging of Ice, the Stark ancestral Valyrian steel sword, into two new ones. One is for Jaime (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau), who grieves the loss of his sword hand and Cersei's (Lena Headey) love, and the other is for King Joffrey (Jack Gleeson) as a wedding present and that he names, Widow's Wail.
Tywin wants Jamie to return to Casterly Rock and rule in his stead. But Jamie refuses to leave as he wants to be with Cersei.
Qyburn (Anton Lesser) builds Jamie a gold hand. Cersei tells Jamie that she doesn't love Jamie anymore (Cersei is angry at Jaime as he left her alone and he took too long to come back). One of Cersei's maids tells her about the affair between Tyrion and Shae.Prince Oberyn Martell (Pedro Pascal), on behalf of his brother, Prince Doran of Dorne, arrives in King's Landing with his paramour, Ellaria Sand (Indira Varma), to attend the royal wedding and is welcomed by Tyrion (Peter Dinklage). Tyrion is considered a diplomat and hence is sent to receive Oberyn, as there has been bad blood between the Martells and the Lannisters for centuries. But Oberyn arrives at King's Landing incognito, and Tyrion finds out only after the rest of his party arrives at the appointed time.
Tyrion tracks Oberyn to a whorehouse. Oberyn tells Tyrion the motive for his visit: revenge against the Lannisters for raping and murdering his sister, Elia, wife of Prince Rhaegar Targaryen. When the Lannisters reached the city, Tywin gave the order to Gregor Cleagan to rape and kill Elia (he split her in half with his great sword) and to kill both her kids.Brienne (Gwendoline Christie) meets Margaery (Natalie Dormer) that the shadow which killed Renly belonged to Stannis and vows to avenge the dead King Renly.
Meryn (Ian Beattie) was protecting Joffrey while Jamie was gone, but now Jamie is back and sidelines him. Meryn doesn't like that. Even Joffrey mocks Jaime for having just one hand now and says he cannot protect anyone with that.
Brienne badgers Jamie to keep his promise to keep Sansa (Sophie Turner) safe. He cant return them to their mother, as she no longer lives.Sansa is distraught at how her family were treated in death. Her mother's body was thrown in the river. Her brother's dire-wolf's head was sewn on his body and paraded through the streets.
Shae (Sibel Kekilli) is increasingly pissed with Tyrion because he wont sleep with her anymore. She thinks he doesn't love her and tried to ship her away (via Varys), when in fact, he is only trying to protect her.
Ser Dontos meets Sansa and expresses his gratitude for saving his life. Joffrey had ordered his death at his birthday celebration, for turning up drunk and late. But Sansa saves his life by suggesting that Dontos could be the King's fool. Dontos gives her his family necklace.In the North, Styr (Yuri Kolokolnikov) and the cannibalistic Thenns (Joseph Gatt) reinforce Tormund (Kristofer Hivju), Ygritte (Rose Leslie), and the other wild-lings. Tormund has lost his Warg Orell, and hence doesn't have the ability to keep an eye on his enemy's movements anymore.
Jon (Kit Harington) is released by Maester Aemon (Peter Vaughan) after confessing his actions while with the wild-lings to gain information. Alliser wants a stiff punishment for Jon as he admits to killing Halfhand and sleeping with Ygritte, but Aemon over-rules him. Jon warns the Night's Watch that Mance Rayder plans to march on the wall with a 100,000 men. Mance will attack from the North and Tormund and Thenns from the South. The signal for the attack will be the bonfire, the largest the North has ever seen.In the Riverlands, Arya (Maisie Williams) and the Hound (Rory McCann) reclaim her sword, Needle, from Polliver (Andy Kellegher). Polliver was the guard who took them to Harrenhall and stole her needle sword. They run into him outside a tavern. The Hound confronts Polliver and Arya ends up killing him with the Needle. Arya gets her own horse to travel.In Essos, Daenerys (Emilia Clarke) marches her army towards Meereen (a 1000 slaves died building the pyramid of Meereen), the last of the three great slave cities; she is troubled that her growing dragons are becoming less tame and more and more belligerent. Daario Naharis (Michiel Huisman) tries to charm Daenerys, but she keeps rebuffing him. Secretly, she is getting warmed up to Daario's charms. To welcome Daenerys, the lords of Meereen put 163 mile markers on the route to the city. Each city is the dead body of a slave, mounted on a cross."]
plot outline: Tywin Lannister gives his son Jaime a new sword and wants him to return to rule at Casterly Rock in his stead. Jaime wants to rejoin the King's guard. Cersei hasn't forgiven her brother for leaving her. Prince Oberyn Martell arrives in King's Landing for the royal wedding. He and his lover, Ellaria Sand, take their pleasure at Littlefinger's establishment. His hatred of the Lannisters becomes apparent as he blames them for the death of his sister. Daenerys' army is marching toward the slave city of Meereen. She comes to realize that her dragons can never be tamed. Sansa still grieves over the loss of her family at the Red wedding. At Castle Black, Jon Snow faces an enquiry before the commanders of the Watch. Arya and Sandor Clegane come across someone from Arya's past.
plot: Tyrion welcomes a guest to King's Landing. At Castle Black, Jon stands trial. Daenerys is pointed to Meereen, the mother of all slave cities. Arya runs into an old enemy. Tywin Lannister gives his son Jaime a new sword and wants him to return to rule at Casterly Rock in his stead. Jaime wants to rejoin the King's guard. Cersei hasn't forgiven her brother for leaving her. Prince Oberyn Martell arrives in King's Landing for the royal wedding. He and his lover, Ellaria Sand, take their pleasure at Littlefinger's establishment. His hatred of the Lannisters becomes apparent as he blames them for the death of his sister. Daenerys' army is marching toward the slave city of Meereen. She comes to realize that her dragons can never be tamed. Sansa still grieves over the loss of her family at the Red wedding. At Castle Black, Jon Snow faces an enquiry before the commanders of the Watch. Arya and Sandor Clegane come across someone from Arya's past.—garykmcd Tywin gives a sword made of Valyrian steel to Jaime and orders him to return to Casterly Rock, but Jaime refuses to go. Tyrion is assigned to welcome Prince Doran Matell but he learns that his brother Oberyn will attend the wedding instead and has arrived earlier. Tyrion finds Oberyn with his mistress in the brothel and he finds that he hates the Lannisters. Cersei gives a golden right hand for Jaime and her maid discloses information about Shae that she had overheard. Dontos meets Sansa to thank her for saving his life and gives a necklace that belonged to his mother to her. Tormund and the wildlings team up with the cannibals Thenn under the command of Styr. Jon Snow recovers from the injuries and goes to a hearing with the leaders of the Night's Watch. Arya and The Hound reach a tavern with five men and The Hound is forced to fight against them. Arya kills two men, one of them with her Needle. Daenerys find 163 slaves nailed to crosses and she reaches the front gate of the city of Meereen.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Jaime is delighted with the Valyrian steel sword Tywin had forged -first in ages, with a second from the leftover- from Robb's, but refuses to leave the royal guard to the ancestral castle, planning to stay with sister-lover Cersei, only to hear, after fitting the golden hand master Aemon forged, the ingrate blames him for returning 'too late'. Tyrion's boasting about his diplomatic accomplishment doesn't impress novice knight Bronn as prince of Dorn he as to welcome only sent his younger brother, fierce warrior Obryn Martell, who picks harlots together with his mistress Ellaria Sand and commandeers on top Littlefinger's gay brothel manager Olyvar, the picks a fight there with two junior Lannisters and pierces one's wrist, then elaborates his old hatred for the family to Tyrion. Recovered from his arrow wounds, Jon informs the Night watch council about his mission, braving absurd calls for extreme punishment as oath breaker, to warn how grave the danger s, while Tormund's Wildling party is joined by Styr's cannibal band from the detested rival clan of Thenns. Daenerys finds her dragons no longer reliably tame, 'punishes' Daario and Grey Worm for bickering who can woe her and is greeted by 163 crucified slaves, one per mile to front gate of slave city Meereen.—KGF Vissers Tywin oversees the reforging of Ice, House Stark's ancestral Valyrian steel sword, into two new ones. One is for Jaime, who grieves the loss of his sword hand and Cersei's love, and the other is a wedding present for King Joffrey, which Joffrey names Widow's Wail. Prince Oberyn Martell, representing his infirmed brother, Prince Doran of Dorne, arrives in King's Landing to attend the royal wedding. He and his paramour, Ellaria Sand, are greeted by Tyrion. Oberyn secretly seeks revenge against the Lannisters and Gregor Clegane for the rape and murder of his sister, Elia, wife of the unfaithful Prince Rhaegar Targaryen. In the North, Styr and the cannibalistic Thenns reinforce Tormund, Ygritte and the other Wildlings. Maester Aemon absolves Jon after he explains his actions while with the Wildlings and reveals that their army of 100,000 plans to attack Castle Black. In the Riverlands, the Hound and Arya head to the Eyrie where the Hound intends to ransom Arya to her Aunt Lysa, Jon Arryn's widow. Along the way, Arya reclaims her sword, Needle, from Polliver, killing him. In Essos, Daenerys marches her army towards Meereen, the last of the three great slave cities; she fears she is losing control over her growing dragons, now horse-sized.

title: The Lion and the Rose
synopsis:
['Roose Bolton (Michael McElhatton) returns to the Dreadfort. He criticizes Ramsay Snow (Iwan Rheon) for mistreating Theon, who has been brutalized into a subservient persona called 'Reek' (Theon) (Alfie Allen). Theon was supposed to be a valuable hostage to help negotiate the return of valuable lands, but Ramsay responds that Balon has already forsaken Theon. Then Ramsay demonstrates his control over Theon, by putting a sharp blade in his hands and making him give a close shave to Ramsay.
Theon tells Roose (upon being ordered from Ramsay) that Bran and Rickon are alive because he never killed them. He had killed and burnt 2 farmhands just to convince the Ironhands of his toughness.
Roose wants to find and kill the remaining Stark children, Bran (Isaac Hempstead Wright) and Rickon, who threaten the legitimacy of his new title. He dispatches Locke for the task. Theon says that the kids might have gone towards Castle Black to meet Jon Snow.
Roose orders Ramsay to reclaim the territories (mainly Moat Cailin) under Ironborn occupation, which Balon had occupied while Robb was away fight the Lannisters.In Dragonstone, Melisandre (Carice van Houten) orders several people to be burned at the stake, as a tribute to the God of Light, to the delight of Queen Selyse (Tara Fitzgerald) and disgusting Davos (Liam Cunningham) and Shireen (Kerry Ingram). Selyse believes that Shireen has been defaced by the God of Light as she is stubborn and sinful. Melisandre is asked to go and counsel Shireen. Melisandre educates Shireen about the God of Light and the hell they are living in now.To protect Shae from his family (Varys (Conleth Hill) also tells Tyrion that news of Tyrion's affair with Shae has reached Cersei and thus Tywin. Tywin had promised to hang the next whore he found in his bed, and he is not known to make any idle threats), Tyrion arranges to send her to Pentos. Tyrion insults Shae that she is a whore (and not worthy to bear his children) is a bid to get her to leave. Tyrion asks Bronn to put her on a ship to Pentos.
Tyrion has a lot of love and sympathy for Jaime. Bronn (Jerome Flynn) (on the orders of Tyrion) coaches Jaime in left-handed swordplay. Jaime needed a discreet person as he is afraid that he will lose respect if people find out that he cant hold a sword anymore.In the North, Bran is spending too much time inside his dire-wolf's mind. Jojen says this is dangerous as one can get lost inside the mind of another and fail to come back. Their party is running out of food and there is supply up North, beyond the wall. In the middle of wilderness, they find a blooming tree, with flowers. Bran touches the tree and has a vision. He now knows where he has to go.King Joffrey and Margaery Tyrell are wed. During the Royal Wedding feast, Cersei accuses Brienne of loving Jamie. She is in a foul mood and countermands Margaery's first order as Queen (she wanted the feast leftovers to be given to the poor, but Cersei instructs Pycell (Julian Glover) to feed it to the dogs instead). Oberyn irritates Cersei further by calling her "former" Queen regent. Jaime warns Loras to stay away from Cersei.Tensions between Joffrey and Tyrion escalate (Joffrey keeps goading and insulting Tyrion, including ordering him to fetch his wine for him after he pours a full glass over his head) just before Joffrey succumbs to poisoned wine. Before dying Joffrey points his finger at Tyrion. A distraught Cersei has Tyrion arrested for his murder, while Ser Dontos (Tony Way), a former knight (Punished by Joffrey, but saved by Sansa), persuades Sansa to leave the feast with him for her protection.
Olenna (Diana Rigg) reminds Tywin that the Iron Bank will ask for its dues from the King's Landing. Lannisters have spent a lot of money in the war.
Oberyn Takes a liking to Loras (Finn Jones)']
plot outline: Sansa still hasn't recovered from the death of her family and refuses to eat despite Tyrion's requests that she do so. She receives a gift from an unexpected source. It's time for the royal wedding and King Joffrey is on his worst behavior with Tyrion the object of his dislike. He adores the sword given to him by his grandfather but uses it to chop up a book given to him by Tyrion. At the reception after the wedding ceremony, a drunken Joffrey ridicules his uncle and orders him to become his cup bearer. Tyrion does as he's told but Joffrey gets his comeuppance. Meanwhile, Lord Bolton returns home to find what his bastard son did to Theon Greyjoy.
plot: Joffrey and Margaery's wedding has come. Tyrion breaks up with Shae. Ramsay tries to prove his worth to his father. Bran and company find a Weirwood tree. Sansa still hasn't recovered from the death of her family and refuses to eat despite Tyrion's requests that she do so. She receives a gift from an unexpected source. It's time for the royal wedding and King Joffrey is on his worst behavior with Tyrion the object of his dislike. He adores the sword given to him by his grandfather but uses it to chop up a book given to him by Tyrion. At the reception after the wedding ceremony, a drunken Joffrey ridicules his uncle and orders him to become his cup bearer. Tyrion does as he's told but Joffrey gets his comeuppance. Meanwhile, Lord Bolton returns home to find what his bastard son did to Theon Greyjoy.—garykmcd In Dragonstone, Melisandre sacrifices three men that are tied to stakes and offered to the Lord of Light. Roose returns to Dreadfort and finds that Ramsey has tortured and flayed Theon and he is furious with his bastard. At King's Landing, King Joffrey humiliates Tyrion during the feast. Out of the blue, he is poisoned and the guards arrest Tyrion, accused by Cersei of poisoning Joffrey.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Desperate to learn left-handed fencing before his helplessness gets known, Jaimie gets a discrete sparring partner: Tyrion's knight Bronn, who also helped finally shipping home his master's doting, beloved harlot Shae to escape Cersei and Tywin's threats. All King's Landing and the royal wedding guests enjoy the grand cathedral ceremony and lavish feast, where despite queen Maerery's attempted distractions, king Joffrey eagerly receives from Tywin the second Valyrian sword but systematically humiliates uncle Tyrion, forced to act as cup-bearer while Sansa is desperate to retire. Returning from the red wedding, Roose Bolton rebukes bastard Ramsay at castle Dreadfort for his failed initiative to exact lands from king Greyjoy for tortured hostage Theon, who now demonstrates his abject submission as dogsbody Riek, then sends them both on a mission. Jojen warns Bran the temptation to escape his misery as warg by sharing a wolf or raven's thoughts is addictive and can cloud his human brain. Stannis allows Melsiandre to alienate more men by burning unconverted subjects. Cersei calls for Tyrion's arrest as Joffrey dies from poisoned wine from the cup Sansa handed her spouse.—KGF Vissers Roose Bolton returns to the Dreadfort with his bride, one of Walder Frey's daughters. He chastises Ramsay for torturing and castrating Theon, devaluing him as a hostage. Theon, who has degenerated into a subservient persona called 'Reek', discloses that Bran and Rickon Stark are alive and threaten Roose's legitimacy as Warden of the North. Roose orders Ramsay to reclaim the territories under Ironborn occupation, promising a reward if he succeeds. In Dragonstone, Melisandre sacrifices three people, including Stannis' brother-in-law, burning them to death as a tribute to the Lord of Light, delighting Queen Selyse and disgusting Ser Davos and Princess Shireen. To protect Shae from his family, Tyrion arranges to send her to Pentos on Essos, leaving her distressed. Bronn coaches Jaime in left-handed swordplay. King Joffrey and Margaery Tyrell are wed. During the Royal Wedding feast, Joffrey humiliates Tyrion and taunts Sansa just before Joffrey fatally succumbs to poisoned wine. A distraught Cersei has Tyrion arrested for his murder, while Ser Dontos, a former knight, persuades Sansa to leave the feast with him for her protection.

title: Breaker of Chains
synopsis:
['Tywin and Cersei arrest Tyrion and frantically search for Sansa, but Dontos has smuggled her away in time (he takes her in a small boat and meets a ship waiting just off the harbor) before Tywin could seal the capital. Petyr Littlefinger (Aidan Gillen), who hired Ser Dontos, smuggles Sansa out of King's Landing. He says even the necklace Dontos gave Sansa, was made by Petyr a few weeks ago.
Petyr kills Dontos before leaving. Petyr tells Sansa that she will be the prime suspect in Joffrey's killing as he killed Ned Stark and that is ample motivation for her to kill Joffrey.Tywin grooms Tommen (Dean-Charles Chapman) to be the new king (A new King should be holy, just, strong and wise. A wise King listens to his counselors till he comes of age and long afterwards). Cersei wants Jaime to avenge their son. When Cersei resists Jaime, he rapes her in front of Joffrey's dead body.
Tywin enlists Oberyn and Mace Tyrell (Roger Ashton-Griffiths) (Olenna's husband) as his fellow judges for Tyrion's impending murder trial. Tywin promises Oberyn justice for Elia if he helps Tywin bring Joffrey's assassin to justice. He promises that he will arrange for Oberyn's meeting with Gregor (who raped and murdered Elia). Tywin denies ordering Gregor to rape Elia and offers Oberyn a place on the Small council to run affairs for the new King. Greyjoys are in rebellion, Wildlings march from the North and Daenerys has 3 dragons to the East. He needs the Dornish as only the Dorne fought the dragons the last time.Tywin also reveals that Daenerys has 3 dragons and will eventually march on King's Landing. Last time only the Dornish army resisted the Targaryen & their dragons.
Tyrion chooses Jaime as his witness. All the rest have already been requisitioned by the queen Cersei as her witnesses. Podrick (Daniel Portman) (Tyrion's squire) tells him that he is being pressured to testify against Tyrion. Podrick tells Tyrion that Sansa has been missing since the wedding. Tyrion tells Podrick to leave King's Landing asap, since he refused to testify against Tyrion. Tyrion feels that Cersei loved Joffery and couldn't have murdered him, but suspects Tywin.In the Riverlands, Arya and Sandor encounter a benevolent farmer and his daughter, whom Sandor robs, angering Arya. The farmer had agreed to give them shelter and food for the night, when Arya lied to him that Sandor (whom she says is her father), fought for the House of Tully. The farmer wants to employ Sandor, but he ends up robbing his silver instead. Sandor says that the farmer wont survive the winter, and dead men need no silver. Sandor wants to sell Arya to Lysa Arryn at the Eyrie castle.
In Dragonstone, Stannis is stunned to hear of Joffrey's death. He was the 2nd name he tossed into the fire. Davos has had no progress in raising a new army for Stannis. Davos continues his reading practice with Shireen. In the process he reads many books. Davos, needing to replenish Stannis' depleted forces, requests a loan from the Iron Bank of Braavos to hire mercenaries called the "Golden Company" (Since Stannis does not have the money to pay a hired army himself).In the North, Sam (John Bradley) fears for Gilly's (Hannah Murray) safety (as most of the Night watch recruits are rapers and thieves and Sam doesn't think Gilly would be safe with them) and moves her and Little Sam to nearby Mole's Town. He gets her a room in the town's brothel in exchange for her doing cleaning & cooking and looking after the babies of other whores.
Meanwhile, the Wildlings continue to raid northern villages. They want to draw out the men from the Castle Black into the open, so that they can be picked off one by one.The Night's Watch receives word (from a few soldiers who escaped from Craster's place) that the mutineers (the Night's watch men who killed Joer and Craster and kept his food and wives for themselves) are camped at Craster's Keep. Jon proposes sending a detail to attack the mutineers to prevent Castle Black's defense weaknesses being leaked to Mance Rayder's (Ciarán Hinds) approaching army. Jon had told Mance that he had 1000 men at Castle black, while the mutineers know that its a fraction of that number (They have just over 100 men, including the stewards and builders). Jon wants the Lord Commander Alliser to strengthen Castle Black for the eventual attack of the wild-ling army on the wall.Daenerys lays siege to Meereen. She chooses Daario Naharis to kill the chosen champion of Meereen. The whole city was watching from the ramparts. She appeals to the slaves of Meereen with an offer of freedom.']
plot outline: In the aftermath of the Purple Wedding, the players in King's Landing reassess their situation. In the meantime, the wildling threat to the Night's Watch is becoming imminent, Arya and the Hound continue their journey to the Vale, and Daenerys reaches Meereen.
plot: Tyrion is arrested for murder and awaits trial. Sansa escapes King's Landing. Sam sends Gilly to Mole's Town as the Night's Watch finds itself in a tight spot. Meereen challenges Daenerys. In the aftermath of the Purple Wedding, the players in King's Landing reassess their situation. In the meantime, the wildling threat to the Night's Watch is becoming imminent, Arya and the Hound continue their journey to the Vale, and Daenerys reaches Meereen.—balerionthecat With the death of King Joffrey, Tywin begins laying his plans for the future. Joffrey's younger brother Tommen will become king with Tywin guiding him. The senior Lannister also makes a pact with Oberyn Martell and invites him to sit on the small council. Cersei is grieving over her son's dead body and wants Jaime to kill Tyrion. He refuses and is satisfied to let justice take its course. He also decides it's time for he and his sister to renew their relationship. Margaery is in something of a quandary, not knowing if she is queen or what the future might have in store. Sansa learns the identity of her rescuer.The wildlings attack a village as they head to Castle Black. Davos Seaworth may have a way out of their financial problems. Daenerys arrives in Meeren and has a message for the slaves living there.—garykmcd Tywin instructs Tommen how a good king shall rule his realm. Then he makes an agreement with Oberyn Martell to help the Lannister House. Sansa escapes with Dontos to a ship where Littlefinger welcomes her and tells that she is safe now. Tyrion releases his squire Pod from his duties to save his life. Arya and The Hound are received by a farmer and his daughter that offer food and shelter to them; on the next morning, The Hound steals his silver and follows his journey with Arya. Two rangers escape from Craster's Keep and arrive at Castle Black. Jon advises that Rast and Karl must be killed since they know the defenses of Castle Black and they will disclose them to Mance if they are captured. Daario easily kills the champion of Meereen and Daenerys promises to release all the slaves in the city.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil While kingmaker Tywin starts preparing kid prince Thommen to succeed as king, Jaile can't resist making love with reluctant, vindictive Cersei at Joffrey's coffin and Petyr 'Littlefinger' Baelish evacuates Sansa by ship. Proudly bisexual Oberyn Martell explains to perfect toy boy Olyvar only a prince like he remains most desirable -for both sexes- even after gravity kicks in, but chases all nude toys when Hand Tywin arrives to convert hatred for the Lannisters in an alliance with Dorne to save Westeros from Daenerys when she bids for the iron throne, so Oberyn accepts to sit on the tribunal to judge Tyrion for Joffrey's murder. Jon Snow warns the Watch council that Wildling king Mance may never learn he only lied they have enough troops, so none may escape from the cannibal Thenn clan raiding the countryside. Ser Davos realizes Stannis's only hope to capitalize on Robb's death is borrowing from the Iron Bank in Braavos for mercenaries, lacking enough vassals. The haughty Meereen elite expected their champion to chase Daenaerys, but after Daario slays him effortlessly, she calls for a slave revolt.—KGF Vissers

title: Oathkeeper
synopsis:
["Daenerys successfully captures Meereen in the middle of a slave revolt (some of the Unsullied enter the city dressed as slaves via the city sewers. The unsullied meet the slave leaders and tell them their story of how Daenerys liberated them from slavery of their own masters. They also deliver the weapons for the slaves of Meereen to fight) and immediately seeks justice for the slain slave children by nailing 163 masters to road posts. Daenerys is welcomed into the city as Mhysa. Barristan advises mercy for the masters, but Daenerys is firm that she will deliver justice. She occupies the highest room of the pyramid in Meereen.
Missandei is helping teach Grey Worm to read.At sea on their way to the Eyrie, Littlefinger tells Sansa that he was complicit in Joffrey's death. He tells Sansa that he used her to smuggle the poison (it was inside the necklace that Dontos gave her) inside the Wedding ceremony and so she is implicit in Joffrey's murder. He also says that he has new allies, who very much wanted Joffrey dead.
Before leaving King's Landing, Olenna implies to Margaery that she poisoned Joffrey (coz she didn't want Margaery to marry a monster like Joffrey). She wants Margaery to seduce and control Tommen before Cersei can turn him against her.Jaime continues to train with Bronn. Jaime believes Tyrion is innocent (Bronn tells Jaime that at Eyrie, Tyrion first choice of a champion was Jamie, before Bronn stood up for him. as he was sure that his brother would ride day and night to come and fight for him). Jaime meets Tyrion in the dungeons. Jaime cant set Tyrion free, but Tyrion insists that he didn't kill Joffrey.
Cersei is adamant Tyrion is guilty (she also wonders that maybe Catelyn set Jaime free so that he could kill Joffrey and win the war for the Starks) and orders Jaime to find and kill Sansa. Jaime instead tasks Brienne with finding and protecting Sansa, presenting her with a new suit of armor and his Valyrian sword, that she names OathKeeper. Podrick is to be her squire.Margaery starts visiting Tommen alone at night, asking him to keep it a secret from Cersei.In the North Jon starts training the rangers for the attack from Wildlings. The Castle is fortified with additional defenses. Jon makes friends with Locke (Noah Taylor). Locke has reached the Castle Black as well, looking for the Stark boys, but Job doesn't know this. He lies to Jon that he was caught stealing something, and chose the wall instead of losing his hand.
in an effort to get rid of Jon, Lord Commander Alliser Thorne (Owen Teale) and Janos Slynt (Dominic Carter) conspire to have Jon lead an expedition against the mutineers. They know Jon is loved by everyone and soon there will be a choosing of the new commander as Measter Aemon will demand it. Sam also tells Jon that he met Bran and that he is headed North of the Wall to find the 3 eyed raven. They reckon maybe Bran is at Craster's keep.
Meanwhile the mutineers are led by Karl (Burn Gorman). Karl forces Rast to deliver the latest boy baby born to Craster's wives to the white walkers. Bran and his party are nearby to where Rast kept the baby and ran away. BRan enters his dire-wolf to investigate, but he only finds Jon's dire-wolf Ghost caged. Bran and the rest go to the Craster's next morning and see Night's watch men raping Craster's women. They are discovered and captured. BRan reveals his identity to Karl, when Jojen has a stroke and Karl wont let Meera help him..
Alliser allows only volunteers to go with Jon. Locke decides to join Jon in his quest, along with many other volunteers. Craster's keep is 60 miles from the wall.Further north, a White Walker takes Craster's last newborn son to a secret ritual site, where he is transformed into a Walker."]
plot outline: Daenerys easily conquers Meereen and shows just what she's prepared to do to those who defy her. Bronn tells Jaime he is certain Tyrion had nothing to do with Joffrey's death. He visits his brother in his cell and comes away believing the same, but Cersei won't even discuss the possibility with him. Jaime asks Brienne to find Sansa and gives her his new sword, which she names Oathkeeper. Olenna counsels Margaery as to the next steps needed for her to remain Queen. At Castle Black, Jon Snow receives permission to take volunteers 60 miles north to stop their former members who rebelled from talking to Mance Rayder's army. Bran is taken prisoner by Karl Tanner and the mutineers who have taken over Craster's Keep. The identity of Joffrey's killers is revealed.
plot: Jaime entrusts a task to Brienne. Daenerys frees Meereen. Jon is given permission to lead a group of Night's Watchmen to Craster's Keep. Bran and company are taken hostage. Daenerys easily conquers Meereen and shows just what she's prepared to do to those who defy her. Bronn tells Jaime he is certain Tyrion had nothing to do with Joffrey's death. He visits his brother in his cell and comes away believing the same, but Cersei won't even discuss the possibility with him. Jaime asks Brienne to find Sansa and gives her his new sword, which she names Oathkeeper. Olenna counsels Margaery as to the next steps needed for her to remain Queen. At Castle Black, Jon Snow receives permission to take volunteers 60 miles north to stop their former members who rebelled from talking to Mance Rayder's army. Bran is taken prisoner by Karl Tanner and the mutineers who have taken over Craster's Keep. The identity of Joffrey's killers is revealed.—garykmcd Scorned by vengeance-obsessed lover Cersei, who demands he helps murder Tyrion, Jaime visits their brother in jail, dares not help either side but continues his fencing and dirty fighting lessons from Bronn and equips Brienne, even with his Valyrian sword, which they name Oathkeeper, sending her to continue her pledged quest to rescue Sansa, whom Littlefinger patiently explains the cynical paradoxes of power opportunism and treason. At Castle Black only the hope of eliminating a potential rival convinces the acting watch commander to allow Jon recruiting a surprising sixty volunteers on his dangerous mission to prevent king Mance finding out their numeric weakness. Boy king in waiting Tommen enjoys an nocturnal visit from his recuperated bride Maergery, into whom Olena confided she had Joffrey poisoned by Petyr. Mutinous Tanner clan chief Karl terrorizes his prisoners at Craster's Keep till Bran reveals being the Stark heir, hence a priceless hostage. In Meereen, Grey Worm and other Unsullied infiltrate to bring slaves weapons and courage for a rebellion, after which masters are brutally murdered as Daenerys's version of 'justice'.—KGF Vissers Daenerys easily captures Meereen, assisted by a slave revolt. Seeking justice for 163 slain slave children, she nails 163 masters to the same road posts. At sea, Littlefinger reveals his complicity in Joffrey's death to Sansa. Before leaving King's Landing, Olenna implies to Margaery that she poisoned Joffrey. She urges Margaery to marry Tommen before Cersei can turn him against her. Jaime believes Tyrion is innocent, but Cersei is adamant he is guilty and also orders Jaime to locate and kill Sansa as an accomplice. Jaime instead sends Brienne to find and protect Sansa, presenting her with new armor, his Valyrian sword, horses and Podrick Payne as her squire. In the North, hoping to eliminate Jon, Alliser Thorne and Janos Slynt agree to allow Jon to lead the expedition against the mutineers. Unknown to Jon, the mutineers have captured Bran and his companions. Further north, a White Walker takes Craster's last newborn son to a secret ritual site where he is transformed into a Walker.

title: First of His Name
synopsis: ["Tommen is crowned king. Cersei meets with Margaery (Cersei admits that Joffrey was a monster), Tywin (she tells Tommin can marry Margaery after an appropriate amount of time has passed since Joffrey's death. She will marry Loras 2 weeks after that), and Oberyn, hoping to sway them to her advantage in Tyrian's coming trial. Tywin and Cersei discuss Tommen's wedding to Margaery in a fortnight. Tywin also tells Cersei that the Lannisters gold mine ran out 3 yrs ago. And the family owes a huge amount to the Iron Bank of Braavos and having the Tyrells on their side will help repay the Lannister's debts. Tywin refuses to discuss the trial with Cersei. She insists that Tyrion killed Joffrey.\nCersei meets Oberyn and asks of Myrcella (her daughter, who was sent to the Kingdom of Dorne, on Tyrion's advice, for her safety). Oberyn says that Myrcella is safe and happy. Cersei asks Oberyn to send Myrcella a ship, that Cersei has had made for her, as a gift.In the Vale, Littlefinger takes Sansa to the Eyrie, where she poses as his niece. Lysa Arryn (Kate Dickie) pressures Littlefinger to marry her that same day. It is revealed that Littlefinger and Lysa killed Jon Arryn and framed the Lannisters. Petyr told Lysa to poison Jon Arryn and then write a letter to Catelyn Stark blaming the Lannisters. Petyr agrees to marry Lysa that very evening, and they consummate their marriage that night. Lysa screams loudly during sex.\nLysa meets Sansa for dinner and starts by saying that Petyr really cares for her. then, Lysa attacks Sansa with accusation of having slept with Petyr. This was a tactic to get Sansa to agree to marry her son Robin (Lino Facioli).Arya still recites the names of every person she is going to kill, before going to sleep each night. Sandor is on that list. On the Kingsroad, the Hound catches Arya practicing her water dancing and mocks it and Syrios Forell's fighting style (who was killed by Meryn Trant, when he came to kill Arya.. Syrios sacrificed himself to allow her a chance to escape), angering Arya. But Sandor/The Hound says that Syrios could not have been a great fighter if he was defeated by Meryn. He says Meryn is not dead as he had armor and a big sword.On the road, Brienne learns that Podrick lacks practical squire skills (he hasn't cooked anything in his life) but is impressed that he killed a Kingsguard to protect Tyrion (on the night Stannis attacked Blackwater Bay). Brienne allows him to remove her armor at the end of the day. They are headed to the wall as Brienne figures that Sansa would go straight to her brother Jon.Beyond the Wall, Jon's group find and attacks the mutineers. Locke has scouted the location and found bran in a separate hut with his party. Locke returns to Jon and tells him to steer clear of the hut as it has some hounds, who would raise alarm. Locke (working for Roose Bolton) attempts to kidnap Bran in the confusion but is killed by Hodor, Warged into by Bran. Bran and his companions continue their trek north (Jojen convinces Bran that if Jon sees them, he wont let them continue North) while Jon's men execute the mutineers and burns Craster's Keep. Bran rescues his dire-wolf and continues North. Rast escapes and is killed by Jon's dire-wolf, Ghost. Jon takes the women back to Castle Black.News reaches Daenerys that Joffrey is dead. Murdered at his own wedding. Daenerys has 93 ships from the Meereenese navy in her service. They can carry 9300 men. In Meereen, after Jorah informs her that Astapor and Yunkai have reverted to slavery, Daenerys postpones invading Westeros to bring order to Slaver's Bay and pronounces herself queen. She also thinks that 8000 Unsullied and 2000 second sons are not enough to hold Westeros (they many be just about enough to take King's Landing). She takes time to consolidate her position & to prove her credentials as an effective ruler of regions."]
plot outline: Tommen is crowned king, the first of his name. Cersei can see that her newly-crowned son and Margaery are exchanging friendly smiles. Cersei is surprisingly frank with her about Joffrey and asks if she is still interested in being queen. Tywin tells Cersei of the Lannisters dire financial situation and needs the Tyrell family to be part of the crown. Jorah Mormont advises Daenerys of Joffrey's death and they contemplate attacking King's Landing by sea. There is other news as well. The freed slaves of Yunkai have been re-enslaved by their old masters and a coup in Astapor has enthroned a butcher who has declared himself emperor. Daenerys decides to rule over the territories she has conquered. Sansa and Petyr Baelish arrive at the Eyrie where he introduces Sansa as his niece Alayne though her aunt, Lady Arryn, is aware of her true identity. Brienne and Pod continue their journey but Pod proves to be a not very useful squire.
plot: Tommen is crowned King of the Seven Kingdoms. Cersei builds her case against Tyrion. Sansa and Lord Baelish arrive at the Eyrie. The Night's Watch attacks Craster's Keep. Tommen is crowned king, the first of his name. Cersei can see that her newly-crowned son and Margaery are exchanging friendly smiles. Cersei is surprisingly frank with her about Joffrey and asks if she is still interested in being queen. Tywin tells Cersei of the Lannisters dire financial situation and needs the Tyrell family to be part of the crown. Jorah Mormont advises Daenerys of Joffrey's death and they contemplate attacking King's Landing by sea. There is other news as well. The freed slaves of Yunkai have been re-enslaved by their old masters and a coup in Astapor has enthroned a butcher who has declared himself emperor. Daenerys decides to rule over the territories she has conquered. Sansa and Petyr Baelish arrive at the Eyrie where he introduces Sansa as his niece Alayne though her aunt, Lady Arryn, is aware of her true identity. Brienne and Pod continue their journey but Pod proves to be a not very useful squire.—garykmcd Jorah tells to Daenerys that King Joffrey is dead and also that she lost the cities she had conquered in the Slaver's Bay. Daenerys decides to stay and rule the cities. Tommen is crowned at King's Landing. Littlefinger brings Sansa to her aunt Lysa Arryn and marries her. Lysa recalls him that she had poisoned Jon. Arya and The Hound travel having friction most of the time. Jon and the Night's Watch fight and kill the mutineers at Craster's Keep and burn to the place to the ground but Bran hides himself from his brother with his friend to proceed with his quest for the three-eye raven.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Sweet Tommen is crowned the next Lannister boy king, as even mother Cersei admits to Maerery, who pretends not even to have considered a repeat of her family's alliance to the crown, far better fit then cruel megalomaniac big brother Joffrey. Tywin explains to his daughter the Tyrell family's resources are desperately needed, as the Lannister mines are dry since years and the huge war debt to the Iron Bank must be repaid at all cost. Locke and ten more traitors turn on Snow's party while they overcome Karl Tanner's Wildling clan, but Jon prevails and recuperates his shadow wolf, only Bran takes Jojen's advice not to allow big brother taking him into safety in order to pursue their quest for the three-eye raven and magical tree. Craster's measly 'keep' is torched as the locals prefer to leave finally free. Savior Petyr arrives with Sansa at impregnable mountain fortress in the Vale, where co-conspirator widow lady Arryn can't wait to wed him, jump his bones and marry Sansa to her son, boy Lord Robin Arryn. Prince Obryn promises to take Cersei gift for her daughter, a sailing yacht, home. Now Daario has captured a large enough fleet for a risky attack on King's landing now Joffrey is dead, Daenerys decides against leaving the Slave Bay now both post-slavery regimes in Yunkai and Astopor have collapsed, promising to 'stay and rule as a queen should'.—KGF Vissers Tommen is crowned king; Cersei surprises Margaery by encouraging her to marry Tommen. Tywin asks Oberyn to be a judge at Tyrion's trial and swears his innocence in Elia's rape and murder. In the Vale, Littlefinger takes Sansa to the Eyrie where she is reunited with her aunt, Lysa Arryn, who pressures Littlefinger to marry her immediately. It is revealed that Lysa and Littlefinger killed Jon Arryn and framed the Lannisters. Lysa plans for Sansa to marry her son, Robin, an emotionally immature prepubescent boy. The Hound mocks Arya practicing her water dancing and disparages Syrios Forell's fighting style. Brienne learns that Podrick lacks practical squiring skills but is impressed he killed a Kingsguard to protect Tyrion. Beyond the Wall, Jon's group find and defeat the mutineers, while Rast, attempting to escape, is killed by Ghost. Unknown to Jon, Bran and his companions are captives there. Locke attempts to kidnap Bran in the confusion, but Hodor, warged into by Bran, kills him and frees the others. Jojen convinces Bran that they must continue north, while Jon's men are burning Craster's Keep and free his daughter/wives. In Meereen, after Jorah informs Daenerys that Astapor and Yunkai have reverted to slavery, she postpones invading Westeros to instead rule as queen until Slaver's Bay is truly free.
