title: Sons of the Harpy
synopsis:
["Cersei authorizes forming the Faith Militant (in partnership with the High Sparrow, bringing religious police to the King's Landing. The high Faith Militant are against drinking, whore houses, gay fucking and all anti-religious symbols of modern debauchery and excess. All such nefarious establishments in Kings' Landing are raided including Petyr's brothels), who then arrest Loras for this sexual relations with the same sex. Margaery is enraged (she alleges that Cersei is angry that Margaery is close to Tommen and putting Loras in a cell is her revenge and a way for her to have leverage on Margaery). Cersei tells Tommen that she is not holding Loras and asks him to speak with the High Sparrow himself. Tommen is barred to visit the Sept to meet the High Sparrow and is called a Bastard by the people living near the Sept. Tommen decides against confronting the High Sparrow and retreats. Margaery decides to send word to Olenna.The Iron Bank has called 1/10 of the King's Landing debt. The crown can barely afford half of the payments required. Tyrell offers to front the gold to the Bank.
Cersei sends Lord Tyrell to negotiate better terms with the Bank and Meryn Trant (Ian Beattie) to keep an eye on him.Jon writes to all the Lords to send men and supplies to the wall. But he refuses to write to Roose Bolton. Sam tells Jon to be practical.
Melisandre attempts to seduce Jon as a means to convince him to accompany Stannis to Winterfell. Jon refuses as he is still in love with Ygritte. Shireen believes that Stannis does not love her. Stannis reveals that when Shireen was a merchant, his enemies presented him a toy doll by stealth, soaked in gray-scale poison. Unknowingly, Stannis gave the doll to Shireen who loves the doll and pressed it to her face. By the time Stannis found out the truth about the doll, Shireen already had gray-scale and Stannis was told that she would die. But Stannis called in every healer and Measter to treat Shireen. Thats how much he loved her.In Winterfell, Littlefinger prepares to return to King's Landing. He meets Sansa and tells her that Stannis will try and conquer Winterfell before he marches on King's Landing. Its only with the Army of the North that he will dare to challenge the Lannisters. Petyr tells Sansa that if Stannis defeats Roose, then she becomes the Wardeness of the North, else if Stannis looses, she can marry Ramsay and still be close to power.
Before leaving, he dispels Sansa's misgivings about Ramsay, saying that even if Stannis fails to defeat the Boltons and rescue her, she can easily manipulate Ramsay.Bronn knows that they are sailing to Dorne to free Jaime's daughter. He also knows that Jaime was the one who set Tyrion free. Jaime says that Tyrion killed his father and he will kill Tyrion if he finds him.
Bronn and Jaime secretly land in Dorne to retrieve Myrcella, but a sea captain (whom Jamie had bribed) informs the Sand Snakes; Ellaria wants the Sand Snakes to avenge Oberyn's death by abducting Myrcella and thus prompting the Lannisters to go to war against the Dornish. She has 3 daughters Obara, Nymeria and Tyene. Jaime and Bronn are able to fight off the riders sent to intercept them. They proceed towards the water gardens where Myrcella has been kept.Jorah intends to redeem himself to Daenerys by giving her Tyrion as a prisoner. Tyrion says he was headed to meet Daenerys himself.
In Meereen, Loraq makes another appeal to reopen the fighting pits; the Sons of the Harpy ambush an Unsullied patrol inside the citadel, critically wounding Grey Worm (Jacob Anderson) and killing Selmy."]
plot outline: Jorah Mormont steals a boat to navigate with his captive, Tyrion. Aboard a merchant ship, Jaime and Bronn sail to Dorne to rescue Myrcella. The Iron Bank is charging their loan and Cersei sends a representative of the Small Council to negotiate with the bankers. She then has a meeting with the High Sparrow and gives an army and power to his followers to neutralize the capital's sinners, including the patrons of Littlefinger's brothel, and Ser Loras Tyrell, the brother of Margaery. Tommen and his Kingsguard are stared down by the Faith Militant, and the king refuses to fight his way to the Tyrell knight. The disappointed Margaery leaves his side to stay with her family. Stannis Baratheon plans to head to Winterfell before the snow. Jon Snow is summoning nobles to help the Night's Watch with men and supplies and he has a dilemma with the name of the Bolton family. Melisandre tries to seduce Jon Snow, but he resists the temptation and does not break his vows. Shireen, restless at Castle Black, approaches her father and he informs her of what happened to her when she was a child. Sansa visits the tombs of her ancestors and Littlefinger tells a story of her family tells her that he will depart shortly to meet Cersei. He also advises her that the even the best men can be manipulated. In Dorne, Jaime and Bronn are found by a patrol and need to fight to survive. Ellaria Sand wants war but she is warned that Jaime Lannister and his mercenary accomplice are in her lands. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys has a meeting with Hizdahr zo Loraq, and she persists in her refusal to allow gladiatorial combat in Meereen. Tensions between Daenerys' government and the insurgent Sons of the Harpy culminate in the Harpies' ambushing of a party of Unsullied, and the only survivors are Grey Worm and the mortally wounded Ser Barristan Selmy.
plot: Jorah Mormont sets sail alongside his prisoner, Tyrion. Cersei makes a move against the Tyrells. Jaime and Bronn sneak into Dorne. Ellaria and the Sand Snakes make their plans. Melisandre tempts Jon. The Harpies attack. Jorah Mormont steals a boat to navigate with his captive, Tyrion. Aboard a merchant ship, Jaime and Bronn sail to Dorne to rescue Myrcella. The Iron Bank is charging their loan and Cersei sends a representative of the Small Council to negotiate with the bankers. She then has a meeting with the High Sparrow and gives an army and power to his followers to neutralize the capital's sinners, including the patrons of Littlefinger's brothel, and Ser Loras Tyrell, the brother of Margaery. Tommen and his Kingsguard are stared down by the Faith Militant, and the king refuses to fight his way to the Tyrell knight. The disappointed Margaery leaves his side to stay with her family. Stannis Baratheon plans to head to Winterfell before the snow. Jon Snow is summoning nobles to help the Night's Watch with men and supplies and he has a dilemma with the name of the Bolton family. Melisandre tries to seduce Jon Snow, but he resists the temptation and does not break his vows. Shireen, restless at Castle Black, approaches her father and he informs her of what happened to her when she was a child. Sansa visits the tombs of her ancestors and Littlefinger tells a story of her family tells her that he will depart shortly to meet Cersei. He also advises her that the even the best men can be manipulated. In Dorne, Jaime and Bronn are found by a patrol and need to fight to survive. Ellaria Sand wants war but she is warned that Jaime Lannister and his mercenary accomplice are in her lands. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys has a meeting with Hizdahr zo Loraq, and she persists in her refusal to allow gladiatorial combat in Meereen. Tensions between Daenerys' government and the insurgent Sons of the Harpy culminate in the Harpies' ambushing of a party of Unsullied, and the only survivors are Grey Worm and the mortally wounded Ser Barristan Selmy.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Cersei continues to spin her web by suggesting to the High Sparrow that the Faith Militant should be armed and given the authority to persecute the sinners of King's Landing. Soon, the organisation is terrorising the community, causing particular havoc at one of Littlefinger's brothels. Cersei also points the finger at Margaery's brother, Ser Loras Tyrell, and he too finds himself imprisoned. Margaery is outraged and expects her royal husband Tommen to do something, but his excursion to the site of the disruption only results in his being stared down by the Faith Militant. Just as Jaime and Bronn arrive in Dorne, Ellaria Sand and Oberyn's three daughters, known as the Sand Snakes, decide to take matters into their own hands. In Meereen, the Sons of the Harpy take the fight to the Unsullied after the power struggle reaches its climax. Meanwhile, at Castle Black, Jon Snow has to resist temptation when Melisandre offers herself to him.—garykmcd Jaime and skeptic Bronn arrive by merchant ship in Dorne on secret mission to rescue bastard daughter Myrcella and deal the hard way with a mounted patrol of four guardsman, but the bribed captain still betrayed them to Oberyn's vindictive lover Ellaria Sand and three daughters, who plan to stir a war as Sand Snakes. Prince and master of coin Mace Tyrell feels honored to be dispatched to renegotiate the crown's debt with the iron bank, but the other small council members realize she's culling them systematically. Tyrion is abducted by Jorah Mormont and amused to learn he's to be offered to Daenerys, his destination, as a make up present by the banished knight. Inspired by Cersei, the High Sparrow converts his purist sect into a militia reviving the zealot terror of the Faith Militant, which spares no 'sinners' instant 'justice' without recourse. Olyvar can just escape from the brothel, but even lover prince Loras is imprisoned, and despite queen Maergery's best effort boy king Tommen only gets a sanctimonious commiseration from Cersei and lacks the guts to order the golden guard to make way for him to the 'praying' high sparrow. Despite a moment of carnal temptation when Melisandre undresses on his lap, Jon Snow sticks to his sworn duty, staying in Castle Black. Petyr counsels Sansa in the Stark crypt now she accepts to be married off to Ramsay Bolton. Daenery's stubborn refusal to allow voluntary gladiator games further stirs the armed revolt of the growing Sons of the Harpy who overcome a large Unsullied patrol, killed including Ser Barristan, only commander Grey Worm escapes.—KGF Vissers Cersei authorizes arming the Sparrows as the Faith Militant, who then arrest Loras Tyrell for homosexuality. Queen Margaery is enraged, but Tommen proves too weak to countermand them. Melisandre attempts to seduce Jon as a means to convince him to accompany Stannis to Winterfell. In Winterfell, before Littlefinger heads to King's Landing, he dispels Sansa's misgivings about marrying Ramsay, promising that Stannis will defeat the Boltons and rescue her, and even if not, she can manipulate Ramsay. Bronn and Jaime secretly land in Dorne to retrieve Myrcella; hearing this, Ellaria and her Sand Snakes plot to avenge Oberyn's death by abducting Myrcella. Jorah intends to redeem himself to Daenerys by presenting Tyrion as a prisoner. In Meereen, Loraq again appeals to Daenerys to reopen the fighting pits, a local tradition; the Sons of the Harpy ambush an Unsullied patrol inside the citadel, critically wounding Grey Worm and killing Ser Barristan Selmy.

title: Kill the Boy
synopsis:
["Brienne and Podrick arrive at an inn near Winterfell and smuggle a message to Sansa (The Boltons have moved from Moat Cailin and set up camp in Winterfell and carried out the necessary repairs to the Castle), offering her help if it is needed. The message is to light a candle in the highest window of the broken tower, if she is ever in distress. The broken tower is where Bran was pushed off by Jaime.
When Sansa discovers Theon is at Winterfell (he is still kept with the dogs in the kennels), Ramsay forces him to apologize to her for betraying the Starks (and killing Bran and Rickon). Myranda is super pissed that Ramsay has totally ditched her for Sansa. Ramsay had promised her that he would marry her. Ramsay intends to keep Myranda on as his mistress, even after he is married to Sansa.
meanwhile Roose's new wife Walda (Elizabeth Webster) is now preggers and Ramsay is nervous that if its a boy, Roose might change his mind and remove his claim from the throne. Roose re-iterates that he could have had Ramsay thrown into the river when he was first brought to him by his peasant mother, whom Roose had raped. But he saw that Ramsay was is son, as he is even now. Sansa is secretly happy looking at Ramsay's discomfort.
Roose tells Ramsay that eventually Stannis will march towards Winterfell with his army from Castle Black.At the Wall, Tormund accepts an alliance with the Night's Watch that allows Wildlings to settle south of the Wall (They would have to fight with the Night's watch when the time comes). Tormund accepts as he knows that the Walkers are coming and they will hit the wild-lings first. Jon and Tormund (Kristofer Hivju) travel to Hardhome to meet with the Wildlings. Hardhome is near the ocean and Jon asks Stannis to lend him his fleet to transport the wild-lings to sought of the wall. Hardhome is one week away by horse-ride.
This decision is not taken very well by the Night's watch at all. They feel Jon has betrayed them by making peace with Wildlings. Especially hurt is Jon's young squire Olly (Brenock O'Connor), whose whole family was butchered by the wild-lings. Yet, Jon's logic is that wild-lings are better safe than part of army of the dead.Word reaches Castle Black (Sam and Aemon) on how Daenerys fights for the freedom of the slaves and would not rest till it is secured. They both admire her and the work she is doing.
Stannis's army leaves for Winterfell, taking Selyse and Shireen with them. before leaving, Sam tells Stannis that he killed white walker with Dragon glass. He tells Stannis that when the army of the dead arrives, the realm of men will need to know how to fight it. Stannis encourages Sam to keep reading to find an answer.
Sir Davos (Liam Cunningham) advises Stannis to wait for Jon to return with the wild-lings, so they have a bigger army. But Stannis overrules him. Winter is approaching and they have to start before they get snowed in at Castle Black. He decides to take Shireen and Selyse along with him to Winterfell. Stannis knows that they wouldn't be safe at Castle Black without Jon.In Meereen, as Grey Worm recuperates, he and Misandei develop a romantic relationship. Daenerys feeds a Meereenese nobleman to her dragons, Viserion and Rhaegal, and imprisons the others (incuding Hizdahr Zo Loraq). She suspects their hand in the riots taking place inside the city. Daenerys is torn between increasing strictness in the city versus providing freedom to the former slaves. Meesandei counsels her to find a path that no-one else could see (like she always does).
She later agrees to reopen the fighting pits and weds Loraq to facilitate peace.At sea, Tyrion and Jorah sail through Valyria (the ancient abandoned city of the Valyrians), seeing Drogon flying overhead. They are attacked by stone men (the disease is contagious and spreads with touch) and escape, but Mormont is infected with grey-scale but he hides it from Tyrion (Same decease that Shireen had as a kid, before she was cured). Meanwhile Tyrion had correctly deduced that Jorah was spying for Varys and was dismissed from Daenerys's service when he was found out"]
plot outline: In Meereen, Daenerys has to decide how to deal with the former masters after the death of Ser Barristan Selmy and the injuries inflicted on Grey Worm. She decides to round up the heads of the 13 richest families in the city and introduce them to her dragons. Jorah Mormont and Tyrion Lannister approach the ancient city of Valyria and, after witnessing something quite incredible, they are set upon by the Stone Men, and Mormont does not escape unscathed. Sansa finally sees what has become of Theon, courtesy of Ramsay Bolton's jealous mistress. Ramsay is particularly cruel to Theon at a dinner, much to Roose Bolton's displeasure. At Castle Black, Jon Snow tries to convince Tormund Giantsbane to move his people south of the Wall and settle in lands that will be made available to them. Most of the men of the Watch object to the plan.
plot: Daenerys arrests the heads of Meereen's great families. Jon makes a difficult decision. Theon is forced to face Sansa. Stannis rides south. Tyrion and Jorah enter the ruins of Old Valyria. In Meereen, Daenerys has to decide how to deal with the former masters after the death of Ser Barristan Selmy and the injuries inflicted on Grey Worm. She decides to round up the heads of the 13 richest families in the city and introduce them to her dragons. Jorah Mormont and Tyrion Lannister approach the ancient city of Valyria and, after witnessing something quite incredible, they are set upon by the Stone Men, and Mormont does not escape unscathed. Sansa finally sees what has become of Theon, courtesy of Ramsay Bolton's jealous mistress. Ramsay is particularly cruel to Theon at a dinner, much to Roose Bolton's displeasure. At Castle Black, Jon Snow tries to convince Tormund Giantsbane to move his people south of the Wall and settle in lands that will be made available to them. Most of the men of the Watch object to the plan.—garykmcd In Meereen, Grey Worm is wounded and Barristan is dead. Daenerys decides to arrest the leaders of the wealthy families and feeds one of them to her dragons. Jon Snow proposes a deal to Tormund to move the wildlings south of the Wall and join forces with the Night's Watch, and a great number of his men do not accept the truce. Stannis and his army head to the North to fight against the Boltons. Brienne sends a message to Sansa in case she is in danger, and Sansa is lured into reuniting with Theon. Daenerys reviews her position and decides to open the arenas again to placate the insurgent Meereenese. Mormont and Tyrion catch sight of a dragon, and then encounter the Stone Men in the ruins of Old Valyria. Forced to fight, they lose their boat and Mormont suffers an injury.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Ramsay Bolton enjoys telling his mistress, the kennel master's daughter Myranda, she won't become his bride because high-born Sansa is now his dynastic duty, then both play a cruel game on her and Theon 'Riek', stirring Roose to announce his wife Wanda is expecting, hopefully a son and heir, and disgusted Sansa to take note of the anonymous promise for help at a candle sign from Brienne. Jon Sow risks splitting up the Night Watch by promising no longer cultivated land to the Wildlings if they stop raiding and join the winter war, but Tormund can only accept if Jon accompanies him to convince the remaining free tribes. Stannis lets them use his fleet, but takes the army on a campaign to reconquer the North, on the road to Kings Landing. Jorah hoped to avoid pirate danger by sailing past Valyria, but Tyrion is nearly killed by the attacking 'stone men', and after they beach-up without boat, Jorah can only hide being infected with Grey skin disease. After the Sons of the Harpy managed to kill Ser Barristan and badly wound Grey Worm, who feels utterly guilty, Deanerys's misrule reaches a new low of injustice, arresting all heads of Mireen's thirteen old master families, threatening to feed them to her dragons, getting one arbitrarily incinerated, only to apologize next day to their groveling spokesman Hizdahr zo Loraq and announcing to wed him and reinstating pit fights, albeit 'for free men only'.—KGF Vissers Brienne and Podrick arrive at an inn near Winterfell and smuggle a message to Sansa, offering her help if it is needed. Sansa discovers Theon is at Winterfell, and Ramsay forces him to apologize to her for supposedly killing her younger brothers. At the Wall, Tormund Giantsbane agrees to an alliance with the Night's Watch in return for the Wildlings to settle south of the Wall. Jon and Tormund travel to Hardhome to persuade the Wildlings. Stannis's army leaves for Winterfell, taking his family and Melisandre with them. In Meereen, as Grey Worm recuperates, he and Misandei develop romantic feelings. Daenerys feeds one Meereen nobleman to her dragons, Viserion and Rhaegal, and imprisons the others. She later agrees to reopen the fighting pits and weds Loraq to facilitate peace. At sea, Tyrion and Jorah sail through Valyria, seeing Drogon flying overhead. They are attacked by stone men and escape, but Jorah is infected with greyscale.

title: Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken
synopsis:
["Arya continues her duties of washing dead bodies and embalming them. Arya realizes that to be no-one means that you could be anyone you wanted to. H'Ghar takes Arya to a chamber filled with faces of those who died in the House of Black and White. Jaqen does this after Arya convinces a sick girl that she is a healer and makes her drink water from a normal well, making her believe that this is a healing nectar. She is now faceless. These faces are used by the faceless men to camouflage themselves in any shape or form, as required by their assignment.Jaime and Bronn reach the Water Gardens and find Myrcella. The Sand Snakes (daughters of Ellaria) attack them but Dornish guards arrive and arrest everyone.Tyrion tells Jorah about how he killed Tywin, as he sentenced him to death for a crime that Tyrion didn't commit. Tywin also had sex with Shae.
Tyrion tells Jorah about how Joer was killed beyond the wall during a mutiny by his own men. Jorah didn't know that his father was dead. Tyrion debates Jorah on why Daenerys is a the rightful ruler of the seven kingdoms as she has not spent a single day in King's Landing. Jorah says she is the mother of dragons, but Tyrion says Targaryens are famously insane and Daenerys could may well prove to be one herself.
Jorah and Tyrion run into slavers, whom Tyrion convinces to take them to the fighting pits of Meereen instead of salt mines or to be sold as galley slaves. Tyrion convinces the slavers that Jorah is a great warrior. Jorah promises to prove his worth if the slavers put him in the pits with a sword in his hands.Petyr reaches King's Landing. Lancel warns him against re-opening his brothels.
Petyr advises Cersei against angering Tyrells by locking up Loras, but Cersei is adamant. Littlefinger informs Cersei that Roose plans to marry Sansa to Ramsay (He doesn't tell Cersei that he was the one who smuggled Sansa out of King's Landing and delivered her to the Bolton's at Moat Cailin himself, killing Lysa in the process). Cersei wants to attack Winterfell immediately, but Petyr advises restraint till the time Roose and Stannis fight it out amongst themselves. But Cersei has no one to lead her army, as Jaime is away and uncle Kevan is untrustworthy. They cant wait as the weather has already started to turn.
Cersei allows Littlefinger to lead the knights of the Vale to Winterfell to defeat whichever side wins the conflict between Roose and Stannis. In return, Littlefinger will be named Warden of the North.Olenna (Diana Rigg) arrives in King's Landing and warns Cersei that imprisoning Loras has jeopardized their alliance and threatens to withdraw the Tyrell Gold and Troops supporting Tommen's reign. Cersei promises her that at Loras's inquest (a precursor to a trial to determine if there is sufficient evidence for a trial) he will be found innocent and released. At Loras' (Finn Jones) inquest (led by the High Sparrow himself), Loras and Margaery both deny his homosexuality. The male prostitute, Olyvar (Will Tudor), contradicts their testimony (he says he lay with Loras, and once even Margaery walked in on them having sex and wasn't shocked at all, indicating that she knew of Loras's gay nature), and Margaery is arrested for lying to the gods. The matter will head to a formal trial now. TOmmen is helpless.Myranda meets Sansa and tells her about all the lovers that Ramsay had in the past, but Sansa sees right through her and tells her to leave. In Winterfell, Sansa weds Ramsay, who then rapes her in front of a horrified Theon."]
plot outline: Arya is tested by Jaqen H'ghar in the House of Black and White and he tells that she is ready to become someone else. Tyrion and Jorah have a conversation about Daenerys and Jorah's father and how he was murdered by his own men; out of the blue, they are captured by pirates and turned into slaves. Little Finger stumbles with Lancel in King's Landing and has a meeting with Cersei and he plots against Stannis Baratheon and the Bolton. Jamie and Bronn are riding in Dornes and they meet Myrcella; however they need to fight against the Sand Snakes. Lady Olenna meets with Cersei to discuss the future of Loras Tyrell. He is judged by the High Sparrow and Margaery Tyrell is involved and arrested with her brother to a formal trial. Sansa marries Ramsay Bolton and he humiliates her.
plot: Arya is put to the test. Tyrion and Jorah are captured by slavers. Loras Tyrell is judged by the Sparrows. Jaime and Bronn face the Sand Snakes. Sansa marries Ramsay Bolton. Arya is tested by Jaqen H'ghar in the House of Black and White and he tells that she is ready to become someone else. Tyrion and Jorah have a conversation about Daenerys and Jorah's father and how he was murdered by his own men; out of the blue, they are captured by pirates and turned into slaves. Little Finger stumbles with Lancel in King's Landing and has a meeting with Cersei and he plots against Stannis Baratheon and the Bolton. Jamie and Bronn are riding in Dornes and they meet Myrcella; however they need to fight against the Sand Snakes. Lady Olenna meets with Cersei to discuss the future of Loras Tyrell. He is judged by the High Sparrow and Margaery Tyrell is involved and arrested with her brother to a formal trial. Sansa marries Ramsay Bolton and he humiliates her.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil In Braavos, Arya grows weary of living in the House of Black and White where no one will explain to her just what she is meant to be doing. She finally learns what they do with the bodies she has been washing when they take them through the door she has been forbidden to go past. Ser Jorah and Tyrion continue to make do with few rations and Jorah learns that his father died north of the wall. They also encounter slavers who take them to Slaver's Bay where Ser Jorah is to fight in the pits. Littlefinger returns to King's Landing telling Cersei of the forthcoming battle between the Boltons and King Stannis. In return for his assistance in fighting the eventual winner, he asks her to name him Warden of the North. Lady Oleanna returns to obtain the release of her grandson but the High Sparrow's inquest into his behavior does not go well - nor does it go well for Queen Margaery. In Dorne, Trystane wants Marcelle to marry him as soon as possible. As Jaime and Bronn arrive in the capital, the Sand Snakes are waiting for them. At Winterfell, Sansa's wedding day arrives.—garykmcd Disguised as mounted Dorne guards, Jaime and Bronn reach prince Doran's court and find Myrcella kissing her betrothed Trystane Martell, whom Jaime knocks down. Before they can explain, Elaria's Sand Snakes attack them, but a fight is stopped by Doran's guardsmen, who arrest all. Petyr arrives in King's landing, can only pass Lancel's sparrow militia by insisting Cersei awaits him and tells her about Sansa's survival, whereabouts and impending Bolton wedding, advising her to wait until Stannis attacks Winterfell and crush the weakened winner, even offers to do it for her with men from the Vale. Cersei promises Olenna the alliance with the Lyrells isn't compromised by Loras's impending sparrow 'inquisition' for sodomy, as he would be acquitted, but after he and queen Maergery bluntly deny everything, Olyvar's testimony to his intimate services as squire, even boy king Tommen is horrified to hear both are to be tried and risk execution. On his nuptial day, Ramsay enjoys tormenting bride Sansa, who ends up raped, and Riek, who must give her away as Theon again and witness the 'wedding night' mortified. Crossing ruined Valyria on foot, Jora and Tyrion, who finally gets him talking, learn about each-other's family and motivation, but are captured by slavers from a pirate ship. Tyrion convinces them to keep him alive until they meet a buyer for his dwarf cock, and Jora because the distinguished warrior knight would make a unique fighting pit challenger, so they head for Meereen. Ja'qen duly beats Arya, who meets a former fellow aristocratic postulant, for persistent lies and rebellion, concluding she's not ready to finally abandon her identity, but for one change.—KGF Vissers H'ghar takes Arya to a chamber filled with the faces of dead people. Jaime and Bronn reach the Water Gardens and find Myrcella with Trystane. The Sand Snakes attack them but Dornish guards arrive and arrest everyone. Jorah and Tyrion are captured by pirates. They narrowly escape slavery when Tyrion manages to talk their way to the fighting pits of Meereen. Littlefinger informs Cersei that Roose Bolton intends to marry Sansa to Ramsay. He offers to lead the knights of the Vale to Winterfell to defeat whichever weakened side wins the conflict between Roose and Stannis. If successful, Littlefinger will be named Warden of the North. Olenna Tyrell arrives in King's Landing and warns Cersei that imprisoning Loras has jeopardized their alliance. At Loras' inquest, Loras and Margaery both deny his homosexuality. The male prostitute, Olyvar, contradicts their testimony and Margaery is arrested for lying to the gods. Tommen is uncertain and ineffective. At Winterfell, Sansa weds Ramsay. On their wedding night, Ramsay rapes her in front of Theon.

title: The Gift
synopsis:
['Jon leaves for Hardhome with Tormund and some rangers. Thorne tells Jon that his mission is foolhardy and an insult to all the brothers who died at the Night's watch.
Sam gives him dragon-glass for protection.
Aemon dies shortly after (he had advised Sam to take Gilly and little Sam South, before it was too late). Thorne warns Sam that he is losing all his friends at the Castle Black. Gilly is attacked by two Watchmen who pretty much want to rape her. Samwell intervenes and is overpowered until Ghost intervenes and threatens the rapers. Samwell and Gilly consummate their romantic relationship.Sansa begs Theon to help her escape Winterfell (Ramsay is now raping her every night.. she asks Theon to light a candle in the highest window of the broken tower), but Theon instead informs Ramsay, who then flays Brienne's informant inside Winterfell. The winter storms engulfs the Northern Lands. Ramsay tells Sansa that Jon is the Lord Commander of The Night's watch now.
At Stannis' army's camp, Davos pleads Stannis to retreat (the supply lines are clogged and soldiers and horses are dying.. 40 horses are already dead and 500 men have left the army), but he refuses. He doesn't know how many yrs the winter will last. If he retreats now, he will be forever known as the King who ran. Melisandre wants to sacrifice Shireen to gain the God of Lights favor, which Stannis refuses. Melisandre says that only Stannis can lead the living against the dead, and he should become King before the Long Night begins.Jorah and Tyrion are sold to slaver Qaggaz (Enzo Cilenti) (Qaggaz buys Jorah for 20 gold honors for his fighting skills. Tyrion makes Qaggaz buy him as well, when he proves he is a formidable fighter as he beats his guard while Tyrion is in chains. Qaggaz buys Tyrion as he is funny) and are taken to Daznak's fighting pit.Daenerys continues to have sex with Daario. Daario wants Daenerys to marry him instead. He advises Daenerys to kill all the masters on the launch day of the great pit games. She refuses.
Daenerys and her consort, Loraq, inspect the pit in preparation for the upcoming games. Jorah defeats the other fighters and reveals his identity to her and that he has brought Tyrion as a "gift".In Dorne, Myrcella tells Jaime she wants to wed Trystane, Doran's son. Bronn becomes sick in his prison cell from a slow working poison that he got into his blood from the blade of one of the Sand sisters. The sand sisters are in the next cell and they give him an antidote for the poison as they are impressed by his honesty and loyalty.The High Sparrow denies Olenna's demand that Loras and Margaery be released. High Sparrow re-iterates that he simply serves the Gods who apply the law equally and demand justice for all. Olenna threatens to stop sending grain to the city, but the High Sparrow is adamant that they are the majority and the rich Lords a minority. The majority don't fear the rich lords anymore.
Tommen threatens Cersei to call in the army and kill everyone in the Sept, if he has to, to free Margaery. But Cersei says that his actions would only lead to Margaery's death. Cersei promises to negotiate with the high sparrow on Tommen's behalf. Cersei visits Margaery in the cells to mock her present condition.
The High Sparrow arrests Cersei for her earlier incestuous relationship with Lancel. Petyr had met Olenna in secret at his brothel & told her about this relationship and Olenna confronted the High Sparrow about it.']
plot outline: At Castle Black, Jon Snow, Tormund Giantsbane and a few Rangers head north of the Wall. Master Aemon has reached the end of his days and Sam gets a warning. Stannis and his army face the ravages of winter and Ser Davos recommends they return to Castle Black. At Winterfell, Sansa begs a terrified Theon to help her escape but he proves an inadequate ally. Tyrion and Ser Jorah are sold at a slave market. In Meereen, Daenerys gets unexpected advice from Daario. In King's Landing, Lady Olenna calls on the High Sparrow to seek her grandchildren's release but gets no satisfaction. She may have found an ally. A gloating Cersei visits Margaery in the cells below the Red Keep but the High Septon has a surprise for her. In Dorne, Jaime sees Myrcella who makes it clear that she considers Dorne her home and that she has no intention of leaving.
plot: Jon heads east as trouble begins to stir for Sam and Gilly at Castle Black. Sansa asks Theon for help. Tyrion and Jorah are sold as slaves. Cersei savors her triumph over the Tyrells as new plots are developed in the shadows. At Castle Black, Jon Snow, Tormund Giantsbane and a few Rangers head north of the Wall. Master Aemon has reached the end of his days and Sam gets a warning. Stannis and his army face the ravages of winter and Ser Davos recommends they return to Castle Black. At Winterfell, Sansa begs a terrified Theon to help her escape but he proves an inadequate ally. Tyrion and Ser Jorah are sold at a slave market. In Meereen, Daenerys gets unexpected advice from Daario. In King's Landing, Lady Olenna calls on the High Sparrow to seek her grandchildren's release but gets no satisfaction. She may have found an ally. A gloating Cersei visits Margaery in the cells below the Red Keep but the High Septon has a surprise for her. In Dorne, Jaime sees Myrcella who makes it clear that she considers Dorne her home and that she has no intention of leaving.—garykmcd Jon Snow rides with Tormund Giantsbane to meet the Wildlings; Aemon Targeryan dies; and Sam is left alone in Castle Black. Sansa asks Theon to light a candle in the broken tower to help her; however he betrays her. Stannis' army is weak with the cold winter but he decides to continue to march to Winterfell. Melisandre wants to sacrifice Stannis' daughter to victory. Tyrion and Jorah are sold to fight in the arena. Lady Olenna has a conversation with the High Sparrow about the destiny of Margaery and Loras Tyrell. Bronn was poisoned by one Sand Snake, but she gives the antidote to him. Jorah sees Daenerys in the arena and he shows his gift to her. Cersei goes to the Black Cells to visit and annoy Margaery and the High Sparrow gives a surprise to her.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Captives in Dorne, Bronn only survives poisoning by begging the antidote from the Sandsnakes in the cell next door, Jaime learns in palatial confinement that Myrcella really wants to marry Trystane for love and stay. The High Sparrow tells baffled Olenna his devotion to divine justice can't be bribed in any way, Loras and Maergery face a sodomy trial, which may end not to Cersei's liking either as her incestuous affair with Lancel is known. Jon Snow leaves with Tormund Giantsbane to try rally a Wildling army as ally, leaving behind at castle Black Ser Alliser in command and Sam, who is nearly beaten to pulp trying to defend Gilly from two watchmen, and sits with her at the deathbed of king's brother and master Aemon Targaryen, who warns them to move south while they can. Stannis, who refuses to sacrifice his daughter, waves as the Boltons hoped Davos's advice to wait after winter before attacking in dire conditions Winterfell, where Ramsay constantly abuses his locked up wife Sansa and Riek dares not fail to report her pea to give the alarm signal awaited by Brienne, which gets the accomplice crone servant flailed as traitor. After making love to Daario, Daenerys reluctantly accompanies her spouse Yezzan zo Qaggaz to a reopened fighting pit. Jorah was delighted that the slaver the pirates sold him and Tyrion to took them to Meereen, but she refuses to hear him, only learns about surprise 'gift' Tyrion.—KGF Vissers Jon leaves for Hardhome with Tormund and some rangers. Maester Aemon dies shortly after. Gilly is attacked by two Watchmen. Samwell intervenes and is overpowered until Ghost threatens them. Samwell and Gilly consummate their relationship. Sansa begs Theon to help her escape Winterfell, but instead he informs Ramsay, who then flays Brienne's informant inside Winterfell. At his army camp, Stannis refuses Melisandre's request to sacrifice Shireen to gain the Lord of Light's favor. Jorah and Tyrion are sold to slaver, Qaggaz, and are taken to Daznak's fighting pit. Daenerys and her consort, Loraq, inspect the pit in preparation for the upcoming games. Jorah defeats the other fighters, reveals his identity and Tyrion appears as his "gift" to her. In Dorne, while in the dungeon, Tyene Sand gives Bronn the antidote to a poison called "The Long Farewell" that she has infected him with. Prince Doran allows Jaime to take Myrcella and her fiancé, Prince Trystane, to King's Landing. The High Sparrow denies Olenna's demand that Loras and Margaery be released. The High Sparrow then arrests Cersei for her previous affair with her cousin Lancel.

title: Hardhome
synopsis:
["Pycelle invites Cersei's uncle Kevan (who had gone back to Casterly Rock due to Cersei's authoritarian behavior), to take over as the Hand of the King. Qyburn visits Cersei in prison and keeps feeding her info. Cersei's uncle, Kevan, is appointed as the Hand of the King. Cersei is denied water to force a confession, which she refuses to give. Pycelle refuses to visit Cersei in prison. So, does Tommen.
Cersei promises her nun prison guard Unella (Hannah Waddingham) that hers will be the last face Unella sees before she dies.H'Ghar tasks Arya to study a marine insurance vendor who has defrauded beneficiaries. The insurance guy makes a bet with the captain to pay their relatives if they die at sea and basically refuses to pay if that ever happens. Disguised as a shellfish peddler, she is to learn about the insurer and then poison him.Theon tells Sansa that he faked killing Brandon and Rickon. Theon tells Sansa about how he was tortured mercilessly and endlessly after Winterfell was abandoned by his IronHand soldiers. He was cut piece by piece until there was no Theon left. Theon doesn't know where Bran and Rickon went.
Ramsay asks Roose for twenty men to attack Stannis' camp. Ramsay is not in favor of hiding behind the walls of Winterfell and wait for the Stannis army to freeze in the raging storm outside. Roose says that Winterfell is fully repaired, the gates reinforced and have enough supplies for 6 months. There is no need to mount this attack. Ramsay argues that this is an opportunity to show the North, how House Bolton treats invaders.In Meereen, Tyrion convinces Daenerys to spare Jorah's life (he also convinces her that Tyrion is her friend, as he killed Tywin and he means the best for the realm of the seven kingdoms. She cannot build a better world on her own. and she will need advisers who understand the world she is going to conquer. Tyrion served as Hand of the King). Tyrion argues that Jorah might have spied on Daenerys, but is no longer that man.. Yet, Jorah never confessed his betrayal to her until forced to do so. Jorah is devoted to Daenerys, so Tyrion's advise is to keep him alive (as killing him would not inspire people to be devoted to Daenerys); she spares him but exiles him again.
Jorah returns to Yezzan and asks to fight in the pits. Daenerys accepts Tyrion into her council as she needs someone who can advise her on the war strategy in the King's Landing and to rule the lands across the Narrow Sea.Tyrion tells Daenerys how Varys has been helping her ever since she was a little girl and has a big hand in keeping her safe through her journey so far. Although he admits that the order to poison her came from Varys's hand, but maybe under pressure. It was Varys who wanted Tyrion to meet Daenerys to begin with. Varys convinced Tyrion that Daenerys was the one worth living for.
Daenerys wants Tyrion to help her get to the Iron Throne, but Tyrion challenges Daenerys's thinking of coming to power without the support of the rich lords. Daenerys says she intends to end the rule of the Lords and the rich families like the Starks, Baratheons, Lannisters, Tyrells, Arryns and so on. She will break the wheel.Olly confesses to Sam that he is upset that Jon is trying to save the Wildlings. Sam says leadership is all about making tough choices. Without wild-lings, the men don't stand a chance against the white walkers.
Arriving in Hardhome, Jon and Tormund recruit five thousand Wildlings and convince them to join them to lands at the South of the Wall. Jon tells the elders that only by joining forces can they defeat the white walkers. He shows them his cache of dragon glass. Tormund supports Jon and says this is the only way to make peace.
But Thenns refuse to join, still doubting Jon's intentions, since he killed Mance Rayder (Tormund clarifies that Stannis wanted to burn him alive, so Jon's arrow was mercy). An army of wights attacks them. They are after Jon's cache of dragon-glass. Jon kills a White Walker with Longclaw, his Valyrian steel sword and saves his cache of dragon-glass in the process. The Night King launches a veritable ocean of dead at the camp, forcing Jon and Tormund to retreat. As he, Tormund, and the other survivors escape by sea, they witness the Night King (Richard Brake) reanimating the dead Wildlings as wights."]
plot outline: In Braavos, Arya is learning slowly and is regularly tested. She poses as an oyster seller and is assigned a specific task. In Meereen, Daenerys sits in judgment on Ser Jorah and Tyrion. While Jorah is again banished, Tyrion soon becomes her advisor. In Winterfell, Sansa learns something important from Theon. Roose Bolton meanwhile awaits Stannis' arrival but Ramsay disagrees with his approach.In King's Landing, Cersei learns from Qyburn that the High Sparrow has a strong case against her and recommends a way out for her. At Castle Black, Sam recovers from his wounds. Jon Snow and Tormund Giantsbane arrive at their destination north of the Wall. While some of them accept the offer of land in the south, many do not. Before they can leave however, the army of walkers arrive.
plot: Tyrion advises Daenerys. Sansa forces Theon to tell her a secret. Cersei remains stubborn. Arya meets her first target. Jon and Tormund meet with the wildling elders. In Braavos, Arya is learning slowly and is regularly tested. She poses as an oyster seller and is assigned a specific task. In Meereen, Daenerys sits in judgment on Ser Jorah and Tyrion. While Jorah is again banished, Tyrion soon becomes her advisor. In Winterfell, Sansa learns something important from Theon. Roose Bolton meanwhile awaits Stannis' arrival but Ramsay disagrees with his approach.In King's Landing, Cersei learns from Qyburn that the High Sparrow has a strong case against her and recommends a way out for her. At Castle Black, Sam recovers from his wounds. Jon Snow and Tormund Giantsbane arrive at their destination north of the Wall. While some of them accept the offer of land in the south, many do not. Before they can leave however, the army of walkers arrive.—garykmcd Tyrion convinces Daenerys to become her advisor and she spares Johar, banishing him from Meereen. In king's Landing, Cercei refuses to confess and is informed that the High Sparrow has a strong case against her. In Braavos, Arya is assigned to pose as seller of oyster to spy a gambler. In Winterfell, Theon discloses to Sansa that Ramsay has mutilated him and also that he has not killed her two brothers Bran and Rickon. Ramsey tries to convince his father to attack Stannis. Jon Snow and Tormund meet the Wildlings in their village and try to convince them to move to Castle Black, but only 5,000 of them accept the offer and embark in the ships. Out of the blue, they are attacked by the wights and White Walkers.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Even thirsting desperately in sparrow jail, Cersei remains too proud and selfish to take maester Qyburn's advice to confess as the evidence is overwhelming. Jon Snow and Tormund can convince only 5000 Wildlings to embark and join the Watch troops, already too late to escape an attack from Wights and White Walkers. Theon explains too viciously pouting Sansa Ramsay broke his will by torture and confides he didn't burn her kid brothers but passes off two farm boys for Bran and Rickon. Ramsay asks Roose fro twenty men to surprise-attack Stannis. Even Daenerys realizes she needs counsel if still hoping to conquer Westeros, hence accepts clever Tyrion to her small council, but he can only get her to spare Jorah the promised execution, not lift his banishment. Ja'qen now trains 'a girl' Arya in impersonation as his spy in Braavos.—KGF Vissers Cersei's uncle, Kevan Lannister, is appointed as the Hand of the King. Cersei refuses to confess her crimes. H'ghar tasks Arya to study a marine insurance vendor who defrauds beneficiaries. Disguised as a shellfish peddler, she is to first learn about the insurer and then poison him. Theon tells Sansa that he faked killing Brandon and Rickon. Ramsay asks Roose for twenty men to attack Stannis's camp. In Meereen, Tyrion convinces Daenerys to spare Jorah's life; she does but exiles him again. Jorah returns to Yezzan and asks to fight in the pits. Daenerys accepts Tyrion into her council. Arriving in Hardhome, Jon and Tormund recruit five thousand Wildlings but an army of wights attacks them. Jon kills a White Walker with Longclaw, his Valyrian steel sword. As he, Tormund, and the other survivors escape by sea, they witness the Night King reanimating the dead Wildlings.

title: The Dance of Dragons
synopsis:
["Ramsay leads a covert attack on Stannis' camp, destroying the siege equipment, food stores, and killing many horses. Stannis sends Davos (Davos had an inkling what Stannis was upto and tried very hard to convince Stannis to let Shireen go with her, but Stannis did not relent) to the Wall to request more supplies. Davos argues that a boy with a scroll could deliver the message, but Stannis refuses to hear anything against his order. Stannis's army is suffering in the cold and is down to survival rations only.Stannis allows Melisandre to sacrifice Shireen (Melisandre believes that the Fire Lord wants a large sacrifice in exchange for turning the odds in Stannis's favor), burning her alive at the stake, ignoring her pleas and Selyse's objections. The entire Stannis army watches this madness. Stannis watches from behind, unable to face Shireen face to face.Jon and the other survivors return to the Wall (despite their defeat it is still a formidable horde that makes it to the wall), with the intention of allowing the Wildlings to pass South. Alliser is torn about opening the gates, but eventually give the order.Jaime tells prince Doran that he had to come to Dorne in secret as they received a threatening message with Myrcella's necklace in the mouth of a viper. Doran suspects Ellaria. Ellaria refuses to share a drink with Jaime. Jaime says that King Tommen demands the return of his sister to King's Landing. Doran cannot refuse his King's command.
In Dorne, Doran permits Jaime and Bronn to return to King's Landing with Myrcella, provided Trystane accompanies them and serves on the small council in Oberyn's stead. Doran also pardons Ellaria and her daughters, but warns Ellaria to follow his orders henceforth. Ellaria is angry at Doran for letting Myrcella and Jaime walk away free and curses Doran. Bronn is also set free on Trystane's orders.
Ellaria meets Jaime in private and says that she knows Myrcella had no role in what happened with Oberyn. And that she knows Myrcella is Jaime's daughter.
Later Doran asks Ellaria to end her feud with the Lannisters and swear loyalty to Doran, which she does.In Braavos, Arya spots Trant accompanying Mace Tyrell, Margaery's father and the Master of Coin. She was spying on the Insurance guy at the time this happened (her mission was to poison the insurance guy discreetly). Arya still craves revenge against Meryn Trant for causing the death of her father.
Mace and Meryn are in Braavos to negotiate terms with the Iron Bank, as per orders of Cersei. Arya forgets her mission and follows Meryn into a brothel where he almost recognizes her. Meryn has a penchant for very young prostitutes. Arya returns the House and reports to Jaqen that the insurance guy wants hungry that day and hence didn't take any oysters. She will try again the following day.In Meereen, combats at Daznak's fighting pit begin. Daenerys is stunned that Jorah is amongst the combatants. Jorah is nearly defeated but smartly turns the tables on his attackers. His victory is interrupted when the Sons of the Harpy launch a surprise attack. They quickly surround Daenerys and her supporters, including Jorah. Hizdar is killed in the fighting. Jorah, Daario, Daenerys, Tyrion and Missandei descend into the fighting pit to escape the Sons of the Harpy and to find a way out. But all exits are blocked. Drogon suddenly arrives; Daenerys mounts him and burns the Sons of the Harpy before flying away from the pit."]
plot outline: Things are not going well for Stannis and his army. Winter is upon them and they are attacked in the night losing most of their stores. Unable to move forward or back, he dispatches Ser Davos Seaworth to seek help from Castle Black. Jon Snow and the survivors of the attack at Hardhome make it safely back to the wall but the reception they get is anything but warm. In Dorne, Doran Martell takes the diplomatic route telling Jaime that Myrcella can return to King's Landing with him provided certain conditions were met. In Braavos, Arya sees Lord Tyrell who arrives to speak to representatives of the Iron Bank. He's accompanied by Meryn Trant, one of the men on her list. In Meereen, the Great Games begin but the needless killing is not to Daenarys or Tyrion's liking. Ser Jorah defeats his opponents in the arena but a trap is sprung and the Sons of the Harpy attack. Rescue is at hand however.
plot: Jon and the wildlings return to Castle Black. Jaime meets with Doran Martell. Stannis makes a hard choice. Arya runs into Meryn Trant. Daenerys attends the grand reopening of the fighting pits. Things are not going well for Stannis and his army. Winter is upon them and they are attacked in the night losing most of their stores. Unable to move forward or back, he dispatches Ser Davos Seaworth to seek help from Castle Black. Jon Snow and the survivors of the attack at Hardhome make it safely back to the wall but the reception they get is anything but warm. In Dorne, Doran Martell takes the diplomatic route telling Jaime that Myrcella can return to King's Landing with him provided certain conditions were met. In Braavos, Arya sees Lord Tyrell who arrives to speak to representatives of the Iron Bank. He's accompanied by Meryn Trant, one of the men on her list. In Meereen, the Great Games begin but the needless killing is not to Daenarys or Tyrion's liking. Ser Jorah defeats his opponents in the arena but a trap is sprung and the Sons of the Harpy attack. Rescue is at hand however.—garykmcd Prince Doran Martell of Dorn saves the peace: Jaime is welcome to return his niece Myrcella to Tommen's court, with Dornish groom prince Trystan, who will take Obryn's small council seat. Even Bronn is released, at a small condition, while insolent warmonger Ellaria Sand is forced to repent on her knees. Ramsay's small party successfully raids Stannis's winter-blocked army, rendering his situation desperate by depleting food and other supplies, even horses. Stannis orders Davos, who pleads negotiations in vain, to return to Castle Black and demands supplies from the Night Watch. Meanwhile the grim king finally allows Melisandre to sacrifice his daughter Selyse on the stake on account of her royal Baratheon blood, and Ser Allester moodily opens the gates for commander Jon Snow and the surviving Wildlings he gathered. In Meereen, consort Hizdahr zo Loraq eagerly instructs moody Daenerys, gleefully bantering with pit veteran Daario, how to preside over the great gladiatorial games, bloody enough for the crowd, to her further dismay also starring banished Jorah. His spear is just in time to prevent an assassin killing the queen as suddenly many golden masks are up and the Sons of the Harpy attack, stabbing Hizdahr. The Unsullied guard can barely protect the royal party, until the free dragon arrives and wins the day, allowing 'mother' to mount it. During her invisibility training, Arya witnesses the arrival of master of coin Mace Tyrell, who come discuss the royal debt with the Iron bank, while his knightly escort visits the brothel and Meryn Trant insists on a young harlot.—KGF Vissers Ramsay leads a covert attack on Stannis' camp, destroying siege equipment, food stores, and killing many horses. After dispatching Davos to Castle Black to request more supplies, Stannis, with Selyse's approval, allows Melisandre to sacrifice Shireen, burning her alive at the stake, believing it will help win the war. Jon and the other survivors return to the Wall, allowing the Wildlings to pass South. In Dorne, Prince Doran has permitted Jaime and Bronn to return to King's Landing with Myrcella, provided Trystane accompanies them and serves on the small council in Oberyn's stead. Doran also pardons Ellaria and her daughters. Arya aborts her first assassination assignment after spotting Trant accompanying Mace Tyrell, the Master of Coin, who has arrived in Braavos to negotiate with the Iron Bank. In Meereen, combat at Daznak's fighting pit resume. Daenerys is stunned that Jorah is among the fighters. His victory is interrupted when the Sons of the Harpy launch a surprise attack. Loraq is killed while Jorah saves Daenerys. The Harpies quickly swarm Daenerys and her supporters, forcing them and Jorah to retreat into the pit. Drogon suddenly arrives, burning many Sons of the Harpy; Daenerys mounts Drogon and commands him to fly away.

title: Mother's Mercy
synopsis:
["Melissandre believes the Lord of Fire has delivered as the snows melt away and the way forward to Winterfell is clear.
Selyse hangs herself after Shireen's sacrifice and half of Stannis' forces desert (as they did not agree with what Stannis did to his own family). Melisandre flees to Castle Black (she fears for her life after failing to deliver the Fire Gods favor as she promised). Stannis marches to Winterfell with his remaining forces. Stannis plans to lay siege to the castle, but the Boltons bring out their cavalry for a front on attack. Stannis is defeated by the Boltons and subsequently executed by Brienne (she finds him alone in the forest surrounding Wintefell, defeated, injured and given-up). Brienne leaves her lookout where she was waiting for Sansa's signal, and she misses it when Sansa actually manages to send the signal during the Stannis attack on Winterfell.Sansa attempts to escape Winterfell, but is caught by Myranda. Theon kills her (when Sansa again appeals to her) and the duo leap from the outer wall together before Ramsay can enter Winterfell again back from his conquest of Stannis.Cersei confesses her former relationship with Lancel (but not with Jamie. She says this was a lie propagated by Stannis to remove her children's claim from the throne). The High sparrow allows her to return to the Red Keep pending trial, but is forced to atone by parading the streets naked (with her hair cut) as jeering crowds pelt her with garbage and feces. Upon her reaching the Red Keep, Qyburn introduces a new member of the Kingsguard with complete loyalty (Qyburn had managed to restore Gregor Clegane and make him fit again).Jaime, Myrcella, Bronn, and Trystane set sail from Dorne. Soon after, Myrcella is fatally poisoned (administered by Ellaria Sand) (Ellaria has kissed Myrcella on the mouth before she boarded her ship, and delivered slow working poison straight to her mouth). Before dying Myrcella had told Jaime that she knew she was his daughter.Arya enter the brothel the following night, in the form of a young prostitute, of the type that Meryn likes. She enters Meryn's chambers with a face mask stolen from the house of black and white. Arya removes her mask and reveals her true face, before stabbing Meryn in the eye, there by killing him. After that, Arya returns the mask to the house.
Arya is blinded for violating the Faceless Men rules after killing Trant for personal revenge (using the techniques she learned from her time at the house of black and white).Varys arrives in Meereen (Varys is invited by Tyrion as he needs a network of spies to govern Meereen) to govern the city with Tyrion, Grey Worm, and Missandei. Naharis and Jorah search for Daenerys, who has been captured by a Dothraki horde. Drogo had taken Daenerys far away and then gone to sleep while trying to lick his wounds. Daenerys left him and went foraging for food when she was captured.Jon has lost his supply of Dragonglass while escaping from the white walkers at Hardhome. Jon says that the dragon-glass was too little to have mattered anyways. Jon says Valyrian steel is able to destroy the white walkers, but there aren't enough Valyrian steel swords in the Kingdom either.
Sam convinces Jon to let him learn to become a Maester by studying at the Citadel. Jon is reluctant, but agrees. Sam says that his knowledge will come in handy when the white walkers attack.
Samwell, Gilly, and Little Sam leave Castle Black for Oldtown where Samwell is to train as a Maester. Davos arrives at Castle Black and wants the Wildlings to fight for Stannis. Jon refuses. Melissandre enters Castle Black and informs Davos that the entire Barratheon family has been lost.
Mutineers, including Alliser Thorn and Olly, fatally stab Jon (in retaliation for sympathizing with the Wildlings and for letting them through the wall, which they considered an insult to every Night's Watch who fought them previously)."]
plot outline: Stannis attacks Winterfell. Sansa and Theon find themselves on a difficult situation. Arya challenges the many face god. Daenerys is surrounded by acquaintances. Jaime and Myrcella leave Dorne. Cersei confesses. Sam goes to oldtown to become the new maester. Jon receives news about his uncle Benjen.
plot: Stannis arrives at Winterfell. Tyrion runs Meereen as Daario and Jorah go after Daenerys. Jaime and Myrcella leave Dorne. Jon sends Sam and Gilly to Oldtown. Arya challenges the Many-Faced God. Cersei confesses her sins. Stannis attacks Winterfell. Sansa and Theon find themselves on a difficult situation. Arya challenges the many face god. Daenerys is surrounded by acquaintances. Jaime and Myrcella leave Dorne. Cersei confesses. Sam goes to oldtown to become the new maester. Jon receives news about his uncle Benjen. Stannis and his armies march against the Boltons, meanwhile in Winterfell Sansa finds a new ally. Across the narrow sea Daenarys is surrounded by strangers and Arya plans against Meryn Trant. Jamie sauls back to Kings Landing and Cersei meets with the High Sparrow. At Castle Black Jon's authority is challenged. Daenerys finds herself in open country after her exhausted and wounded dragon has set her down and she is soon surrounded by hordes of Dothraki horsemen. Back in Meereen Jorah and Daario set out to find her, leaving Tyrion as regent, helped by Varys. Stannis's attempt to take Winterfell is disastrous - although it affords Sansa and Theon the chance to escape - and there is severe loss of life, culminating in a meeting with Brienne, still out to avenge the death of Renly. Melissandre escapes to Castle Black, where Jon is facing mutiny and Jaime departs from Dorne with Myrcella, who is aware he is her father, though they too encounter treachery. Arya has her revenge on Trant but in disobeying the Many Faced God by not killing the appointed victim she also ends up being disadvantaged. Cersei is forced to perform a walk of shame by the High Sparrow but is saved from total humiliation by Qyburn.—don @ minifie-1 Stannis awakens to find the winter storm has passed, something Melissandre attributes to the Lord of Light and the sacrifice they made. He also learns that half his army has deserted him and someone close to him has committed suicide. He nonetheless marches on Winterfell but the Boltons are waiting for him. At Castle Black, Sam asks Jon to send him to Oldtown so he can learn to become a maester. Ser Davos pleads Stannis' case but the Watch simply doesn't have the forces to spare. Jon Snow doesn't realize the extent to which some of his men disagree with his actions. In Braavos, Arya visits Ser Meryn Trant and strikes one name off her list. She pays a heavy price however. In Dorne, Jaime, Myrcella and Trystane say their farewells and set sail for home but Ellaria has the last laugh. In Meereen, Ser Jorah and Daario set off to find Daenerys while Tyrion stays behind with Missandei and Grey Worm to govern the city. Daenerys has traveled to a faraway and unfamiliar place. In King's Landing, Cersei decides to confess and pays a heavy penance.—garykmcd

title: The Red Woman
synopsis:
["Ser Davos (Liam Cunningham), Edd (Ben Crompton), and several loyalists bolt themselves inside a room with Jon's (Kit Harington) body;
Alliser Thorne (Owen Teale) assumes command of the Night's Watch. Thorne tells his men that Jon was going to destroy the traditions of the Night's watch and hence had to be removed. He gave the wild-lings the same land on which they reaped and raped and murdered.
Edd wants to attack Thorne with Ghost, but Davos knows that they don't have the numbers. Edd leaves Castle Black to go for help.
Thorne allows amnesty to all of Jon's supporters who surrender by night and offers to take Davos south, as a free man. Davos knows that if they open the door, Thorne will slaughter them all. Davos turns to Melisandre for help.At Winterfell, Ramsay (Iwan Rheon) mourns Myranda, while Sansa (Sophie Turner) and Theon (Alfie Allen) are chased by Bolton men. Ramsay vows to repay Myranda's pain a thousand times over.
Theon pushes Sansa very hard to run, but they are eventually captured by Ramsay's men and his hounds. Brienne and Podrick (Daniel Portman) arrive, killing the pursuers. Sansa formally accepts Brienne (Gwendoline Christie) into her service.
Ramsay is now under pressure from Roose (Michael McElhatton) as without Sansa and her heir, Ramsay means nothing to him, as he cant help him legitimize his rule over the North.Jaime (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) arrives in King's Landing with Myrcella's body and vows to Cersei (Lena Headey) (Cersei is back in the castle, but is awaiting her trial for her crimes) to avenge their daughter's death. Cersei says that the witch's prophecy is coming true. She had 3 children and now 2 of them are already dead.
Obara Sand (Keisha Castle-Hughes) and Nymeria Sand (Jessica Henwick) (Ellaria's (Indira Varma) daughters) murder Trystane (Toby Sebastian) (who was waiting on the ship just outside King's Landings waters), and, in Sunspear, Ellaria and Theme (Rosabell Laurenti Sellers) kill Doran (Alexander Siddig) and Areo Hotah (DeObia Oparei), after Doran learns of Myrcella's death. The King's guards support Ellaria as they are not OK with Doran's inaction at the death of Elia and Oberyn
Margaery is still locked in prison. High Sparrow offers her the same deal. Confess, atone and await trial at the palace.In Meereen, Tyrion (Peter Dinklage) and Varys (Conleth Hill) learn ships are burning in the harbor (They start taking daily tours of the city to keep close to the ground realities of the city. They know that the attack in the pits was very carefully planned, which means there is a mastermind behind everything that is taking place). This was the entire Meereen fleet that Daenerys was hoping to use when she would sail across the Narrow Sea to attack King's Landing.
Jorah (Iain Glen) and Daario (Michiel Huisman) continue tracking Daenerys (Emilia Clarke), who the Dothraki take to Khal Moro (Joe Naufahu). Khal Moro wants to rape her (her titles and her status as Queen of Meereen mean nothing to him) but steps back when he learns that she is the widow of Khal Drogo. He will take her to Vaes Dothrak, temple of Dosh Khaleen where the widows of all dead Khals live.
meanwhile Jorah's Greyscale decease keeps growing.In Braavos, Arya (Maisie Williams) lives on the streets as a blind beggar, beaten daily by the Waif (Faye Marsay). The waif was also Arya's trainer at the House of White and Black. She had deduced correctly in the past that Arya was not ready to be a faceless girl. The waif trains Arya to fight even though she cant see anything.In her bedchamber, Melisandre (Carice van Houten) removes her bejeweled necklace to reveal she is an elderly, frail woman."]
plot outline: The fate of Jon Snow is revealed. Sansa and Theon flee the Boltons. Jaime and Cersei reunite in King's Landing. The High Sparrow continues to grow in power. The Sand Snakes make a daring move. Tyrion takes his first steps in ruling Meereen. Daario and Jorah pursue the Mother of Dragons. Daenerys is brought before the Dothraki.
plot: The fate of Jon Snow is revealed. Daenerys is brought before Khal Moro. Tyrion gets used to living in Meereen. Ramsay sends his dogs after Theon and Sansa. Ellaria and the Sand Snakes make their move. Cersei mourns for Myrcella. The fate of Jon Snow is revealed. Sansa and Theon flee the Boltons. Jaime and Cersei reunite in King's Landing. The High Sparrow continues to grow in power. The Sand Snakes make a daring move. Tyrion takes his first steps in ruling Meereen. Daario and Jorah pursue the Mother of Dragons. Daenerys is brought before the Dothraki.—Tyler Mathews To Jaime's surprise, Cersei doesn't blame him for Myrcella's death, having 'realized' it was all foretold; he says they can fight to beet 'fate' like their adversaries. In Dorne, Ellaria murders prince Doran, two fellow sand snakes aboard the ship Trystane. Having welcomed the Rd Witch, Ser Davos and some of Snow's friends lock themselves in with him. The High Sparrow gets queen Margaery Tyrell's first confession, but demands a complete one. Theon flees with Sansa and holds off the Ramsay men long enough for them to be surprise-overcome by Podrick and Brienne, who is finally accepted as vassal - protector. Roose warns Ramsay, who already swore revenge for Myranda, that without Sansa they can't hold out against a Lannister army. Tyrion is joined by Varys assessing the worsening situation in Meereen, while Daario and Jorah find Daenerys in captivity of Khal Moro, who spares her as royal widow but also assigns her as such to the Dothraki temple nunnery.—KGF Vissers Alliser Thorne assumes command of the Night's Watch, while Ser Davos and several loyalists bolt themselves inside a room with Jon's body; Edd leaves Castle Black to seek help. At Winterfell, Ramsay briefly mourns Myranda, while Sansa and Theon are pursued by Bolton men. Brienne and Podrick arrive, killing the pursuers. Sansa formally accepts Brienne into her service. Jaime arrives in King's Landing with Myrcella's body and vows to Cersei to take back everything taken from them. Obara and Nymeria murder Trystane Martell while, in Sunspear, Ellaria and Tyene kill Prince Doran and Areo Hotah after Doran learns of Myrcella's murder. In Meereen, Tyrion and Varys discover ships are burning in the harbor. Jorah and Daario Naharis continue tracking Daenerys, whom the Dothraki take to Khal Moro. In Braavos, a blinded Arya begs on the street. Each day, the Waif beats her with a staff and forces her to fight. In her bedchamber, Melisandre removes her bejeweled necklace revealing her true form, a frail and elderly woman.

title: Home
synopsis:
["Brandon (Isaac Hempstead Wright) visits Winterfell in a vision of the past, and sees Eddard (Sebastian Croft), Benjen (Matteo Elezi), and their sister Lyanna (Cordelia Hill), as well as a young Hodor (Sam Coleman). But the man inside the tree doesn't allow Brandon to stay in the past too long. Meera (Ellie Kendrick) is angry that Brandon doesn't want to leave the cave anymore. The Children of the Forest ask Meera to have patience with Brandon.Edd arrives back at Castle Black with Tormund (Kristofer Hivju) and a group of Wildlings, imprisoning Alliser Thorne and the other mutineers and preventing them from killing Ser Davos and other people with Jon Snow. Tormund decides to build a pyre to burn Jon Snow's body and the other dead men.Tommen bars Cersei from leaving the Red Keep, which infuriates her. Tommen by this act, doesn't allow Cersei to attend Myrcella's funeral. Jaime speaks to TOmmen, who says he is afraid of the Faith Militancy & their high priest High Sparrow (Jonathan Pryce). High Sparrow told Tommen that Cersei wont be allowed into the Sept.
Jaime promises Tommen to protect him from them, and then ask Tommen to see Cersei's forgiveness. Jaime threatens the High Sparrow, but has to step back after looking at the strength of the Faith Militants. Tommen (Dean-Charles Chapman) asks Cersei to teach him how to be strong (as he feels he could not protect her and Margaery (Natalie Dormer) from the High Sparrow). he knows Cersei would have pulled down the Sept and killed the entire Faith Militancy order if Tommen was on the other side.
Gregor Clegane (Hafþór Júlíus Björnsson) assumes the position of Cersei's personal bodyguard.Tyrion learns that Astapor and Yunkai have reverted to slavery. He goes to the catacombs and unchains Rhaegal and Viserion, though does not release them. He does this as the 2 dragons had stopped eating since Daenerys left and Tyrion knew that dragons don't do well in captivity. Missandei (Nathalie Emmanuel) helps Tyrion to calm the dragons down while he unchained them.In Braavos, the Waif attacks Arya daily (and trains her, while beating and attacking her with a stick) before H'Ghar (Tom Wlaschiha) appears and recruits her again.Ramsay proposes to kill Jon Snow to remove all challenges to the Bolton rule in the North. He argues that they don't need the support of all the houses, the Umbers, the Karstarks, and the MAnderlys control more men than every other house combined. With their support, no one can challenge them.
Lady Walda, Roose's wife, gives birth to a male heir, prompting Ramsay to murder Roose, Lady Walda (Elizabeth Webster), and their infant son (he sets loose his hungry dogs upon them both). Ramsay knows that Sansa is moving towards Castle Black to unite with Jon Snow.Yara argues with Balon to abandon his conquest of the North, as they have lost Deadwood Motte. Balon refuses and is adamant to continue on with his quest to establish the rule of the Iron Island all over the North.Brienne tells Sansa that Arya is still alive. Theon decides to leave Sansa, as he thinks he needs to atone for his horrible actions in the past.
Theon returns to the Iron Islands, where his uncle Euron (Pilou Asbæk) reappears and murders King Balon (Patrick Malahide).Davos reaches out to Melisandre. He wants Melisandre to use her magic to resurrect Jon. Melisandre is broken as she thinks everything she believed in was a lie. She also says that she has never tried this particular magic and has only seen it being performed once.
Melisandre attempts and apparently fails to resurrect Jon, but after everyone leaves the room, Jon revives."]
plot outline: Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven. In King's Landing, Jaime advises Tommen. Tyrion demands good news, but has to make his own. At Castle Black, the Night's Watch stands behind Thorne. Ramsay Bolton proposes a plan, and Balon Greyjoy entertains other proposals.
plot: Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven. Tommen meets with Cersei. Tyrion makes a bold move. Theon leaves while at Pyke new issues arise. Ramsay's brother is born. Davos asks Melisandre for a miracle. Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven. In King's Landing, Jaime advises Tommen. Tyrion demands good news, but has to make his own. At Castle Black, the Night's Watch stands behind Thorne. Ramsay Bolton proposes a plan, and Balon Greyjoy entertains other proposals. Brandon is trained by Three-Eyed Raven and has visions of his father Ned's childhood when he was young, happy and Hodor could speak. At Castle Black, Davos and his men are threatened by the Night's Watchmen but the Wildlings break into the Castle and the position of power changes. Cersei is protected by the Mountain and Tommen, who does not allow her to go to Myrcella's funeral. However, Jaime has a conversation with him and convinces Tommen to speak with his mother. Then Jaime challenges the High Sparrow and finds out how powerful he is. Tyrion decides to release two dragons that are not nourishing. Arya is being beaten again and is still blind. Ramsey learns that his father has a baby son and he takes drastic actions. Theon decides to leave Sansa who intends to go to Castle Black to find Jon Snow. The Greyjoys will have a new heir at the Iron Islands. Davos makes an impossible request of Melisandre, but the witch is powerful.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Jaime attends Myrcella's grand funeral, where he almost provokes the High Sparrow, after convincing Tommen to make up with Cersei, whom he banned for her safety from leaving the red keep, only new, masked guard knight the Mountain killed the commoner who flashed during her public penance walk and keeps bragging about it. Enjoying magical visions of Ned's youth when Hodor still spoke as a stable-boy, Brandon wines the Three-Eyed Raven interrupts it so soon but is told more can harm while impatient Meera Reed is told to prepare to help Bran when they move again. Hearing his father now has a legitimate son, Ramsay stabs him to death, the official versions being 'poisoned by enemies', and feeds stepmother Walda and the baby to the dogs. Theon leaves Sansa, promising to go ask Jon Snow for help from the Watch. In Castle Black, Ser Davos insists that the red witch tries resurrecting, which seems to fail as she feared, but once alone with the wolf, he breaths again. Tyrion realizes the two dragons in the dungeon are pining away because of captivity and gathers the courage to looses their chains. The slavers are back in power in the other 'liberated' cities. Blind Arya finally seems to have learned humility after some stick lessons, Ja'qen starts revealing.—KGF Vissers In a vision of the past, Brandon sees his father Ned, Uncle Benjen, their sister Lyanna, and young Hodor at Winterfell. Edd returns to Castle Black with Tormund and a group of Wildlings, imprisoning Thorne and the other mutineers. Tommen asks Cersei to help him be strong, as the High Sparrow threatens Jaime. Astapor and Yunkai have reverted to slavery. In the catacombs, Tyrion unchains Rhaegal and Viserion. In Braavos, H'ghar allows Arya to return to the House of Black and White. Roose Bolton's wife gives birth to a male heir; Ramsay murders Roose, his stepmother, and the infant. En route to Castle Black, Brienne tells Sansa that she had encountered Arya. Theon leaves to head home to the Iron Islands. Euron Greyjoy also returns to Pyke Island and murders his brother, King Balon. Melisandre attempts and apparently fails to resurrect Jon, but after everyone leaves the room, Jon awakens.
