title: Oathbreaker
synopsis:
['En route to Oldtown, Samwell Tarly (John Bradley) is first taking Gilly (Hannah Murray) and Little Sam to Horn Hill to stay with his family while he trains to be a Maester. Sam had to do this as the Citadel does not admit women. Gilly trusts Sam completely and agrees to the plan.In a vision, Brandon sees a young Eddard Stark and Howland Reed (Leo Woodruff), Meera's father, defeat Kingsguardmen loyal to the Targaryens at the Tower of Joy in Dorne. They were guarding a screaming girl (it is implied that the girl imprisoned in the tower is Lyanna Stark, Ned's sister). The man in the tree (Max Von Sydow) brings Brandon back before he can see whats in the tower, as Ned heads towards it. Brandon also realizes he can speak through time and can be heard by Ned (of the past, in his visions). The man in the tree tells Brandon that he needs to learn "everything" and needs to be patient.Daenerys is taken to a Dothraki city and deposited at the hall of widows. But since she did not arrive at the hall of widows immediately after Khal Drogo's death, she has to undergo a public trial to determine her fate.
Varys discovers that the masters of Astapor, Yunkai, and Volantis have been financing the Sons of the Harpy. He had captured Vala (Meena Rayann) one of the conspirators and bribed her to reveal the truth. he promises Vala safe passage for her and her young son to Penthos on a ship leaving the next day, if she reveals the names of the masters behind the Sons of the Harpy.
Tyrion, Missandei and Grey Worm decide to take action against the masters. But they cant leave Meereen, else Meereen descends into slavery.In King's Landing, Tommen convenes with the High Sparrow who refuses to relent on the matter of a public hearing for Cersei (he wants High Sparrow to allow Cersei to see Myrcella's final resting place, but the High Sparrow would only allow it after Cersei's hearing). He councils Tommen to keep the law above all human beings.
Jaime and Cersei interrupt a small council meeting (Pycelle, Mace, Olenna and Kevan), only to be shunned by Kevan Lannister (Ian Gelder) and the Tyrells. Cersei and Jamie want the small council to take action against Dorne for killing Myrcella.
Cersei's bodyguard is revealed to be Gregor Clegane, who was resurrected by Qyburn (Anton Lesser). Cersei orders Qyburn to create a spy network of his own to rival Varys's (Qyburn recruits the same kids that used to spy for Varys all over the entire city). Cersei wants to know the name and addresses of all the people, who are making fun of her and her naked walk down the streets of the city.The Waif rigorously trains Arya in blind warfare (she learns to recognize the smells) (soon Arya learns and starts fighting the waif back), whose sight was later restored after accepting herself as "no-one".In Winterfell, Lord Umber (Dean Jagger) asks for Ramsay's help to protect the North from the Wildlings (since Jon has allowed thousands of them past the wall), presenting Rickon (Art Parkinson) and Osha (Natalia Tena) as a "gift," along with the head of Shaggydog, Rickon's dire-wolf.Melisandre talks to the resurrected Jon and wants to know where he went after he died. Jon says there was nothing at all. Melisandre realizes that Stannis was not the promised King, it was Jon. Jon understands that Tormund stood with Jon and his friends even after he was dead. Davos asks him to figure out a way to defeat the white walkers. Jon executes Thorne, Olly (Brenock O'Connor), and the other mutineers who attacked him. He renounces his oath and puts Edd Tollett in charge of the Night's Watch.']
plot outline: SPOILER: Jon Snow is received by Davos and Melisandre and has difficulties to understand what happened with him. Then he is greeted by his friends. Sam is traveling by boat with Gilly and her baby to the land of his family. Bran has other visions helped by Three-Eyed Raven and finds a hidden past of his father. Daenerys arrives at Vaes Dothrak and is forced to change clothes. Varys and Tyrion discover who is financing the Sons of the Harpy. In King's Landing, Cersei orders Qyburn to send the little birds to several to spy her enemies. King Tommen confronts the High Sparrow but is manipulated by him. In Braavos, Arya continues her painful training. Umber meets Ramsay and delivers Osha and Rickon Stark to him to celebrate their union. Jon Snow executes his enemies and takes a surprising decision.
plot: Daenerys arrives at Vaes Dothrak. Sam and Gilly sail for Horn Hill. Arya trains as No One. Varys finds information on the Sons of the Harpy. Ramsay receives a gift. Tommen meets with the High Sparrow. At Castle Black, a miracle occurs. SPOILER: Jon Snow is received by Davos and Melisandre and has difficulties to understand what happened with him. Then he is greeted by his friends. Sam is traveling by boat with Gilly and her baby to the land of his family. Bran has other visions helped by Three-Eyed Raven and finds a hidden past of his father. Daenerys arrives at Vaes Dothrak and is forced to change clothes. Varys and Tyrion discover who is financing the Sons of the Harpy. In King's Landing, Cersei orders Qyburn to send the little birds to several to spy her enemies. King Tommen confronts the High Sparrow but is manipulated by him. In Braavos, Arya continues her painful training. Umber meets Ramsay and delivers Osha and Rickon Stark to him to celebrate their union. Jon Snow executes his enemies and takes a surprising decision.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Ser Davos is just delighted, Melisandre almost as surprised as (re)birth-naked Jon Snow, that his magical resurrection worked, wondering if the royal destiny she expected for Stannis is his. While Tyrion finds Missandei as miserable a drinking buddy as Grey Worm, Varys finds out which master family finances the Sons of the Harpy terror and disposes of the terrified key witness generously. His 'little bird' kid spies in King's Landing are recruited into Cersei's service by maester Qyburn while Tommen finds the courage to confront the High Sparrow, but gets mother nor wife off the religious trial threat. To reestablish his authority as lord commander, Jon is forced to hang his four murderers, even squire Olly, while Sam sails to the Citadel and Oldtown to leave his family nearby. Bran enjoys watching how his father Ned's sword champion reputation is a half fake. Khal Moro delivers Daenerys to the royals widows nunnery, which must decide whether to admit the runner to their power behind the Dothraki throne. Ramsay receives ally Umber with a surprise gift: Rickon Stark and Osha. Ja'qen keeps beating and testing Arya into the part of Nobody girl.—KGF Vissers En route to Oldtown to train as a Maester, Samwell first visits Horn Hill, his family home, intending to leave Gilly and Little Sam with his family, claiming Little Sam is his biological son. In a vision, Brandon sees young Ned and Howland Reed, Meera's father, dishonorably defeat a Targaryen Kingsguardsmen at the Tower of Joy in Dorne. Varys discovers that the masters of Slavers' Bay are financing the Sons of the Harpy. In King's Landing, the High Sparrow preaches to Tommen, while Jaime, Cersei and her bodyguard, Ser Gregor Clegane, interrupt a small council meeting, only to be shunned by Kevan Lannister and the Tyrells. The Waif rigorously trains Arya, whose sight is restored after accepting herself as "no-one". In Winterfell, Lord Umber asks Ramsay to help protect the North from the Wildlings, presenting Rickon Stark, Osha, and the head of Rickon's direwolf as gifts. Jon executes Thorne, Olly, and the other mutineers. He renounces his oath and puts Tollett in charge of the Night's Watch.

title: Book of the Stranger
synopsis: ["Sansa, along with Brienne and Podrick, arrives at Castle Black where she is reunited with Jon. Sansa implores Jon to take back Winterfell with help from the wild-lings, but Jon is very reluctant to fight more. Melisandre now serves Jon as she believes he is the chosen prince by the God of Light. Brienne informs Davos and Melisandre that she executed Stannis after the battle at Winterfell with the Boltons. Tormund takes a liking to Brienne.In Meereen, Tyrion offers the slave masters of Slaver's Bay peace if slavery is abolished within seven years (in exchange for cutting support to the Sons of the Harpy), an action that angers former slaves. Missandei and Grey Worm reluctantly support Tyrion's plan in front of the slaves, but are convinced that the slavers will use Tyrion's offer to their gain. Seven yrs is not a short time.\nMeanwhile Jorah and Narahis have tracked Daenerys to the Dothraki city, where she is held at the temple of widows. Naharis learns about Jorah Mormont's Greyscale as they arrive in Vaes Dothrak. Jorah and Narahis enter the city as merchants, but are found by a Dothraki patrol. They both fight their way out. They find Daenerys, when she comes out of the temple of Dosh Khaleen at night to pee. Daenerys refuses to run away and says that she has a plan.Littlefinger (Aidan Gillen) returns to the Vale to mobilize soldiers against Ramsay. Robin Arryn is still terrible at the weapons, and Lord Royce constantly looks down upon him. RObin likes Petyr. Lord Royce doubts Petyr's intentions, when he says that Sansa was abducted by the Boltons and forced to marry Ramsay at Winterfell. Royce wants to kill Petyr, but Robin intervenes and wants to throw Royce throw the moon door instead. Petyr decides to give Lord Royce a second chance, if he pledges absolute loyalty and a promise to commander Vale's forces in future wars.In King's Landing, Margaery visits Loras (Loras is also in the same dungeons as her, and The High Sparrow takes pity on her and allows her to meet her brother in a bid to get him to confess). Cersei, Jaime, Kevan, and Olenna shelve their differences and plot to defeat the Sparrows. Cersei tells Olenna that the High Sparrow plans to get Margaery to undergo the walk of atonement through the city, just like she did. Jaime asks Olenna to send the Tyrell army to capture the High Sparrow and asks Kevan to stand his forces down to let the Tyrells capture the priest and disarm his Faith militants. Kevan agrees since he also wants Lancel (his son) back from the clutches of the Faith Militants.Theon arrives at Pyke and tells Yara (Gemma Whelan) he will support her claim at the Kingsmoot. After the death of Balon, Euron stakes his claim to the throne and has support of the clergy, despite Yara having the credentials to rule the kingdom. Yara suspects Theon has showed up just before the Kingsmoot to stake his claim to the throne and was sent by Ramsay to capture the Iron Islands by stealth.In Winterfell, Osha attempts to assassinate Ramsay (while pretending to seduce him) but he kills her. Ramsay sends Jon a message, threatening to harm Rickon unless Sansa is returned. Sansa convinces Jon to retake Winterfell. Ramsay has 5000 men in his army. Tormund offers support of 2000 fighting wild-lings, while Sansa assures that the North will support Jon if he stands up to face Ramsay.Daenerys meets with the Khals in the temple of the Dosh Khaleen (they are there to decide her fate); after they refuse to serve her (she wants all the Khals to follow her. She says that she is the only one fit to be a ruler), she ignites the temple, fatally burning the Khals and Moro. When she emerges unhurt, the Dothraki bend the knee. Once again, Daenerys has a huge army at her command."]
plot outline: Sansa arrives at Black Castle with Brienne and Podrick and reunites with Jon Snow, who has resigned from the Night's Watch after the deception of the betrayal of his brothers. Sansa tries to convince him to attack and retake Winterfell while Brienne meets Davos and Melisandre and warns that she killed Stannis and she does not forget or forgive the assassination of Renly through black magic. Littlefinger returns to Runestone and is welcomed by his nephew Robin and convinces him to send his army to protect Sansa at Castle Black. In Meereen, Tyrion negotiates a truce and the end of the support to the Sons of Harpy with the masters of Slaver's Bay. Jorah and Daario arrive at Vaes Dothrak and they meet Daenerys, who explains a plan to them. Margaery meets the High Sparrow and he tells how he learned the truth. Tommen tells Cersei that Margaery will be exposed to the people soon, and Cersei plots a scheme with Olenna to destroy the High Sparrow. Theon returns to the Iron Island and after a cold reception from Yara, he says that he wants to support her. Ramsey stabs Osha with a knife killing her in Winterfell. Jon Snow receives a letter from Ramsey with insults and threatening him. Daenerys is brought to the khals in a temple and the set in motion her evil plan.
plot: Sansa arrives at Castle Black. Tyrion makes a deal with the slave masters. Jorah and Daario sneak into Vaes Dothrak. Ramsay sends a letter to Jon. Theon arrives at Pyke. Cersei and Olenna Tyrell plot against the High Sparrow. Sansa arrives at Black Castle with Brienne and Podrick and reunites with Jon Snow, who has resigned from the Night's Watch after the deception of the betrayal of his brothers. Sansa tries to convince him to attack and retake Winterfell while Brienne meets Davos and Melisandre and warns that she killed Stannis and she does not forget or forgive the assassination of Renly through black magic. Littlefinger returns to Runestone and is welcomed by his nephew Robin and convinces him to send his army to protect Sansa at Castle Black. In Meereen, Tyrion negotiates a truce and the end of the support to the Sons of Harpy with the masters of Slaver's Bay. Jorah and Daario arrive at Vaes Dothrak and they meet Daenerys, who explains a plan to them. Margaery meets the High Sparrow and he tells how he learned the truth. Tommen tells Cersei that Margaery will be exposed to the people soon, and Cersei plots a scheme with Olenna to destroy the High Sparrow. Theon returns to the Iron Island and after a cold reception from Yara, he says that he wants to support her. Ramsey stabs Osha with a knife killing her in Winterfell. Jon Snow receives a letter from Ramsey with insults and threatening him. Daenerys is brought to the khals in a temple and the set in motion her evil plan.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil The High Sparrow tells Maergery how he converted, she pretends remorse and finds Loras broken, unwilling to fight. Tomme turns to Cersei for help, which she promises, then Jaime and she ally with Olena to secretly field the Tyrell army to wipe out the fanatics, the small council tacitly agreeing to sit back' as Tommen dares not move. Resurrected Jon Snow refuses to resume his watch command, welcomes half-sister Sansa and lets her talk him into attempting to reconquer Winterfell on Ramsay, who threatens to torment Rickon to death before them if they try and actually stabs captive Osha before she can strike. While Tyrion and Varys strike a deal with all Savers Bay masters to stop the Sons of the Harpy terror and outgrow slavery in seven years, using unhappy Grey Worm and Missandei as guarantors, Jorah and Daario, who finds out about his leprous affliction, find Daenerys at the Dothrakai city, sneak and to free her, but are told to wait as she insults the assembled khals, who consider her unworthy of the royal widows temple, burns them in it and emerges 'reborn from fire', planning to rule them again. Petyr shifts the blame for Sansa's captivity to a suspicious lord and has cousin Robyn 'give him a last chance' to redeem himself on campaign against Ramsay.—KGF Vissers Sansa, Brienne and Podrick arrive at Castle Black. Sansa wants Jon to retake the North. In Meereen, Tyrion offers the masters of Slaver's Bay peace in exchange for slavery being abolished within seven years; this angers former slaves. Littlefinger returns to the Vale to mobilize its soldiers against Ramsay. Dario learns about Jorah's greyscale; they find Daenerys in Vaes Dothrak. In King's Landing, Margaery is allowed to visit Loras while Cersei, Jaime, Kevan, and Olenna shelve their differences and plot to defeat the Sparrows. Theon arrives at Pyke Island and supports Yara's claim to the Iron Islands throne. In Winterfell, Ramsay kills Osha, who tries to assassinate him. Ramsay sends Jon a message, threatening Rickon unless Sansa is returned. Sansa convinces Jon to retake Winterfell. In the temple of the Dosh Khaleen, Daenerys tells the Khal leaders that they are not fit to lead the Dothraki. She ignites the temple, killing them. When she emerges unscathed, the Dothraki horde kneels before her. Sansa arrives at Castle Black. Theon arrives at Pyke. Tyrion makes a deal with the slave masters and deals with the slaves. Littlefinger discusses his plans at The Vale. Cersei and Jaime plan their next move while Margaery vists Loras. Jorah and Daario try to rescue Daenerys, but she has other plans.

title: The Door
synopsis: ['Sansa meets with Littlefinger (with Brienne protecting her) (Petyr had sent her a message to meet him in a cottage not far from Castle Black), who offers the Vale\'s forces and says that her great uncle, Brynden Tully (Clive Russell), is building an army in Riverrun; she declines his help. Sansa is still pissed with Petyr for talking her into marrying Ramsay against all her instincts. She makes Petyr enumerate all the ways in which he thinks Ramsay violated her (He never hurt Sansa\'s face, but had his way with the rest of her. He beat her, cut her, raped her). Jon and Sansa leave Castle Black to gather the other Northern houses\' support. Sansa sends Brienne to Brynden to enlist her uncle\'s army (the one Petyr told her about) to fight for her at Winterfell.Arya continues to train with the waif. In Braavos, Arya is given a second chance and assigned to assassinate an actress named Lady Crane (Essie Davis). She watches the play in which Lady Crane acts and tells Jaqen that she believes Lady Crane is a decent woman. She reckons the younger actress has paid to have Lady Crane eliminated as with her out of the way, the younger actress Bianca will get better parts in the play.Beyond the Wall, Brandon learns that the Children of the Forest created the White Walkers (by inserting dragon-glass into the heart of young men) to protect themselves from the First Men. Brandon\'s unaccompanied vision allows the Night King to physically touch him, making the cave vulnerable. The Night King (Vladimir "Furdo" Furdik), along with White Walkers and hordes of wights, attack the cave (after the Night King touched Bran in one of visions, and thus he can now enter the cave), killing the Three-Eyed Raven, several Children, Summer, and Hodor (Kristian Nairn), whose younger self is shown to have been rendered mentally disabled by Brandon\'s interaction (when he traveled into the past with the 3 eyed raven and accidentally Warged Hodor.. The young Hodor kept yelling "Hold The Door" while being Warged, which got shorted to Hodor. and in real life, he dies while holding the door against the dead army while allowing Bran and Meera to escape).In the Iron Islands, Euron wins the Kingsmoot despite confessing to killing Balon (and Theon supporting Yara\'s claim to the throne) (Euron argues that Balon was leading the Iron Islands nowhere and he caused 2 wars which led to heavy defeats for the Iron Islands), causing Yara and Theon to flee (by stealing the best ships harbored at the Iron Islands). Euron proposes to build a large fleet and then create an alliance with Daenerys to attack Westeros (the region of King\'s Landing). Euron starts building his fleet by putting every man, woman and child to work on the Iron Islands. He wants to build a 1000 ships.In Essos, Daenerys orders Jorah Mormont to find a cure for his Greyscale and then return. Daenerys indicates that she has forgiven Jorah and acknowledges his love for her. She says she wants Jorah by her side when she takes the Seven Kingdoms. Daenerys marches with the Dothraki to Meereen.In Meereen, a red priestess named Kinvara (Ania Bukstein) meets Tyrion and Varys and promises to support Daenerys. Kinvara also serves the Lord of the Light and believes that Daenerys is the one who was "promised". Kinvara agrees to help maintain the peace in Meereen while Daenerys is away. Varys is skeptical since Melisandre had backed Stannis and she was wrong. Kinvara convinces Varys (Varys was skeptical since Melisandre also believed that Stannis was the chosen King of the Lord of Light. But she was eventually proven wrong) by revealing things about his past, that no-one knew. His mutilation at the hands of a 2nd rate sorcerer. Varys heard a voice call out from the flames, when the sorcerer threw his parts into the fire']
plot outline: Littlefinger faces the consequences of his actions. Sansa and Jon make plans. Daenerys decides Jorah's fate. An uneasy truce in Slaver's Bay doesn't withhold Tyrion from trying to improve the situation. The Ironborn choose their new ruler. Noone(Arya Stark) is given a new mission and witnesses a play. Bran learns about how the Long Night came to be but brings chaos upon his group. Wyllis holds the door.
plot: Sansa and Jon make plans. Arya is given another chance to prove herself. Jorah confesses a secret to Daenerys. Tyrion meets with a red priestess. Yara finds her rule tested. Bran discovers the origin of the White Walkers. Littlefinger faces the consequences of his actions. Sansa and Jon make plans. Daenerys decides Jorah's fate. An uneasy truce in Slaver's Bay doesn't withhold Tyrion from trying to improve the situation. The Ironborn choose their new ruler. Noone(Arya Stark) is given a new mission and witnesses a play. Bran learns about how the Long Night came to be but brings chaos upon his group. Wyllis holds the door. Sansa receives a sealed letter from Littlefinger and she meets him with Brienne. Sansa discloses the treatment of Ransay and despises her former friend. Arya continues her training in Braavos and Jaqen offers another assignment to her to kill an actress. Bran discovers the origin of the White Walkers in one of his visions. On the Iron Island, Theon supports his sister Yara to be the Queen; however their uncle Euron Greyjoy arrives and claims the throne for him. In Vaes Dothrak, Jorah shows his greyscale to Daenerys and discloses his love for her and Deaenery commands him to find a cure to his disease. In Meereen, people are in temporary peace and he has an encounter with a Red Priestess. Bran disobeys the Three-Eyed Raven and has a vision alone of the White Walkers. Out of the blue, he is touched by Night's Kings with tragic consequences. Sansa, Jon and Davos plot an alliance with other Houses from the North to retake Winterfell.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Petyr arranges by letter to meet Sansa, who only comes with hostile Brienne to disown his protection, blaming him for the abusive marriage to Ramsay, and refuse an alliance with his Vale army. Instead she joins Jon Snow and Ser Davos, hoping for other Northern houses support to reconquer at least Winterfell. Desperate to conclude her 'faceless training', Arya reluctantly accepts to poison on actress, solely because a rival paid Ja'qen, after attending the amateur company's grotesque performance ridiculing the deaths of kings Robert and Joffrey Baratheon. Yara expects to be elected first-ever queen of Iron Island after Theon pledges his support, but Balon's brother Euron Greyjoy arrives In time to secure the Salt Throne by ridiculing his rivals, who steal the fleet during his enthroning sea-rebirth ritual. Daenerys rides off as Dothraki queen with Daario at her side, 'commanding' Jorah, who shows his greyscale affliction, to ride off for a cure. Bran's latest vision shows how the white walkers were magically created against hostile mankind, but he breaks the Three-Eyed Raven rules at his peril.—KGF Vissers Sansa secretly meets with Littlefinger, who offers the Vale's forces and says her great uncle, Brynden Tully, is building an army in Riverrun. Sansa distrusts Littlefinger and declines his help. Jon and Sansa leave Castle Black to gather Northern houses' support. Sansa sends Brienne to meet with her great-uncle, Brynden Tully. In Braavos, Arya is tasked to assassinate Lady Crane, an actress. Beyond the Wall, Brandon learns that the Children of the Forest created the White Walkers to protect themselves from mankind. In the Iron Islands, Euron wins the Kingsmoot, despite confessing he killed Balon; Yara, Theon, and their supporters flee, taking many ships. In Essos, Daenerys orders Jorah to return after finding a cure for his greyscale. In Meereen, Kinvara, a red priestess, meets Tyrion and Varys and promises to support Daenerys. In Brandon's unaccompanied vision, the Night King touches him, leaving his mark and making the cave vulnerable. The Night King, White Walkers, and hordes of wights attack the cave, killing the Three-Eyed Raven, several Children, Summer, and Hodor, whose younger self was rendered mentally disabled by Meera's order to "Hold the door".

title: Blood of My Blood
synopsis:
["Meera (Ellie Kendrick) escapes into the forest with Bran who is still immersed in his visions (he watches the entire history of the world). He awakens just as the wights find them but a mysterious man saves them.Samwell and Gilly reach Horn Hill, the Tarly family estate. Sam's mother and sister are very inviting to him and Gilly. Sam's father, Randyll (James Faulkner), demeans Gilly for being a Wildling (he figures out Gilly is a wild-ling by hearing her talk about how she met Sam). He also demeans Sam for being soft and fat, and buried in books even at the wall. Sam's mother admonishes Randyll. So, he agrees to shelter Gilly and have her work in the kitchens and agrees to raise Sam's bastard as a servant of the house. Sam takes her to the Citadel with him. He also takes House Tarly's ancestral Valyrian steel sword, Heartsbane.Arya knows that Lady Crane is a brilliant actress and that Bianca will never be as good as her. The play itself would be nothing (just farting, slapping and belching) without Crane's performance.
Arya warns Lady Crane that she is to be assassinated (she snatches the poisoned wine glass from Crane, just when she was about to drink it.. she then tells Crane that Bianca wants her dead), then returns to the House of Black and White and retrieves Needle. H'Ghar approves the Waif's request to kill Arya.Tommen meets the High Sparrow for Margaery, who tells him that Margaery has to go through the walk of atonement for her freedom. Tommen also realizes that Margaery has been brainwashed by the High Sparrow.
Jaime attempts to rescue Margaery from the Faith Militant by leading an assault with the Tyrell army (as was agreed), only to find she has repented and Tommen has forged an alliance with the Faith. Tommen removes Jaime from the Kingsguard (as punishment for attacking the faith). Tommen then orders Jaime to help Walder Frey (David Bradley), who is holding Edmure Tully (Tobias Menzies) hostage, and to retake Riverrun from Brynden (who has taken the Riverrun castle back from Walder Frey control and is also Edmure's uncle).
Jamie refuses to leave before Cersei's trial (he wants to take Bronn and attack the High Sparrow, but Cersei knows he will not return alive from the mission), but Cersei convinces Jamie to go and taken back RIverrun. She knows it will be a trial by combat and she has Gregor to fight for her. Cersei further argues that Jaime's right place is at the head of their army, and this is where Tywin also wanted to see him. The world needs to know how the Lannisters deal with their enemies and where the loyalties of their men should lie. She sends him off to take back Riverrun.Benjen Stark (Joseph Mawle), the man who saved Meera and Brandon, says he led a ranging party to the North to find white walkers. They found some and Benjen was turned by the White Walkers(he was stabbed in the gut) but later upturned by the Children using Dragonglass. After the 3 eyed Raven's death, Brandon is the new 3 eyed Raven, but he cant control anything yet. Benjen tells him to be ready before the Night King comes.Daenerys marches with her Dothraki army towards Meereen. Drogon finds her and is now fully grown and fully recovered. Daenerys mounts Drogon and declares to the Dothraki that they will sail across the Narrow Sea to conquer Westeros (a gift that Khla Drogo promised her). She needs a thousand ships and doesn't yet know that the fleet at Meereen has been destroyed."]
plot outline: The white walkers reach Meera and Bran but they are saved in the last minute by a mysterious black rider who turns out to be Benjen Stark. Sam and Gilly arrive at Horn Hill, where Sam introduces Gilly and Crastor's son to his family. Defending Sam, Gilly confesses that she is a wildling, which is appalling to Randyll. Nevertheless, Randyll accepts the baby into his home. However, Sam changes his mind in the last moment and decides to take Gilly, the baby as well as the Valyrian sword of his father with him and leave his home for good. King Tommen is allowed to see Queen Margery. Instead of killing the actress playing Cersei by poisoning her, Arya recovers her Needle and makes different plans. Jaime and the Tyrell army march into King's Landing, trying to stop Margery's planned walk of shame but the High Sparrow already thought this event through, making sure he will succeed in the end by manipulating King Tommen to take his side. As a result, Tommen fires his father from his job as lord commander of Kingsguard. Daenerys reunites herself with Drogon.
plot: Bran and Meera find a new ally. Gilly meets Sam's family. Arya makes a difficult choice. The Lannisters and Tyrells march against the High Sparrow. The white walkers reach Meera and Bran but they are saved in the last minute by a mysterious black rider who turns out to be Benjen Stark. Sam and Gilly arrive at Horn Hill, where Sam introduces Gilly and Crastor's son to his family. Defending Sam, Gilly confesses that she is a wildling, which is appalling to Randyll. Nevertheless, Randyll accepts the baby into his home. However, Sam changes his mind in the last moment and decides to take Gilly, the baby as well as the Valyrian sword of his father with him and leave his home for good. King Tommen is allowed to see Queen Margery. Instead of killing the actress playing Cersei by poisoning her, Arya recovers her Needle and makes different plans. Jaime and the Tyrell army march into King's Landing, trying to stop Margery's planned walk of shame but the High Sparrow already thought this event through, making sure he will succeed in the end by manipulating King Tommen to take his side. As a result, Tommen fires his father from his job as lord commander of Kingsguard. Daenerys reunites herself with Drogon.—Andreea D Beyond the Wall, Bran and Meera are rescued from a wight attack by a mysterious stranger. Gilly and Sam go to Horn Hill and are welcomed by his mother and sister. However when they are having dinner, his father Randyll discovers that Gilly is a Wildling and insults the couple. Tommen meets the High Sparrow that allows him to visit Margaery and she confesses that she repented her sins. Out of the blue, Jaime commands the Tyrell army through King's Landing to release Margaery and Loras, but he is surprised by the revelation of an alliance of the Faith and the Crown. In Braavos, Arya meets Lady Crane and they have a conversation about acting. Then Arya saves the actress from poisoning. However Waif witnesses her behavior and reports to Jaqen that asks her to kill Arya. Meanwhile Arya retrieves the Needle from the hidden place on the rocks and brings it to her room. Daenerys and Daario have a conversation about the number of ships she needs to cross the Narrow Sea with her army. Then she leaves him and returns riding Drogon.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Having escaped the cave, Bran is immersed in the Three-Eyed Raven's transferred visions, urged to take his place before the ultimate battle which will also decide their kind's fate. In the forest, the wights attack his party, but a mystery man on horseback saves them. At stately Horn Hill, Sam is welcomed warmly by his mother with Crastor's son 'little Sam', whom Sam wants to leave there with Gilly while he is on mission to become a Maester, but his father Randyll, who dotes his hunter brother, scolds Sam a cowardly bookworm and rejects Gilly as he finds out over dinner she's a Wildling. That night, Sam takes House Tarly's ancestral Valyrian steel sword Heartsbane, and leaves with his family. Jaime and the foolish vindictive guard commander attempt to rescue Margaery from the Faith Militant and Loras from the dungeon, only to find she has repented and see Tommen forge a holy alliance with the High Sparrow. King Tommen dismisses Jaime from the King's Guard and orders him to lead an army from King's Landing to help Walder Frey, who holds Edmure Tully hostage, to retake Riverrun from Brynden Tully. Arya saves star actress Crane from her planned poison assassination and retrieves Needle. Jaqen H'ghar allows the Waif, who spied on them, to find and kill Arya. Uncle Benjen Stark, who saved Brandon and Meera, says he was turned by the White Walkers but un-turned by the Children using Dragonglass. Daenerys mounts Drogon to give a rousing speech inspiring the Dothraki to cross the Narrow Sea and conquer Westeros, despite having no clue how to find a fleet.—KGF Vissers Meera escapes the cave with Bran, who is immersed in the Three-Eyed Raven's transferred visions. In the forest, the wights attack, but a man on horseback saves them. At Horn Hill, Sam's father, Randyll, demeans him as a soft bookworm and insults Gilly for being a Wildling. That night, Sam takes House Tarly's ancestral Valyrian steel sword, Heartsbane, and leaves with Gilly and Little Sam. Arya warns Lady Crane of her planned assassination, then retrieves Needle. H'ghar allows the Waif to find and kill Arya. Jaime attempts to rescue Margaery from the Faith Militant, only to find she has repented and Tommen has forged an alliance with the Faith. Tommen forbids Jaime to serve as a King's Guard in King's Landing and orders him to aid Walder Frey, who is holding Edmure Tully hostage, to retake Riverrun from Brynden Tully. Benjen Stark, the man who saved Meera and Brandon, says he was turned by the White Walkers but later unturned by the Children using Dragonglass. Daenerys mounts Drogon and gives a rousing speech inspiring the Dothraki to cross the Narrow Sea and conquer Westeros for her.

title: The Broken Man
synopsis:
["Sandor Clegane (Rory McCann) is alive and living a simple, non-violent life, having been saved by a Septon and his followers. The Septon tells Sandor that the Gods have saved him for a reason. When rogue Brotherhood members threaten (they wanted the group to give their food to the Brotherhood) and eventually slaughter the group, Clegane seeks revenge.The High Sparrow tells Margaery to give an heir to Tommen, to continue God's good work. Margaery seems thoroughly brainwashed by him and hangs on his every word.
Margaery convinces Olenna (Diana Rigg) to return to Highgarden (for Loras to repent and confess his crimes. He will lose his name and titles, and live the rest of his life as a penitent) after the High Sparrow says that he will pursue Olenna following her attempt to attack the Faith, alongside Jaime. At this meeting the Speta Unella was with Margaery and listening to every word that was being discussed.
But secretly Margaery passes a message to Olenna telling her that she has not been brainwashed by the High Sparrow and that she is only putting an elaborate act to fool the Faith.
Before leaving Olenna tells Cersei (Cersei had come to ask Olenna to stay and fight the High Sparrow together) that Jaime is gone, Tommen is against her and the populace despises her. She has lost. This enrages Cersei.Jon, Sansa, and Davos recruit the Wildlings (who resist since the deal was to fight the White Walkers and not the Boltons. Tormund convinces them as Jon is their savior and the Boltons will come for the wild-lings once they defeat Jon) and House Mormont (Lyanna Mormont (Bella Ramsey) is tough as nails, and cedes only when Sansa presents her claim to the house of Stark and Ser Davos convinces her that the war with the Boltons is the war of the North for its freedom and that the real war is against the White Walkers, who are coming. So long as Boltons hold Winterfell, the North is divided and a divided North has no chance against the White Walkers. Jon served Joer Mormont as his steward at the Castle Black) to their cause, but remain outnumbered by the Boltons. Lyanna is able to give them 62 fighting men.
Many houses of the North refuses to serve Sansa as they are angry that Robb abandoned them when he took his army towards the King's Landing and allowed the armies of the Iron Islands to take over their castles. They were freed only when ROose Bolton came to their rescue. Plus bulk of Jon's army is made up of wild-lings.
In desperation, Sansa sends a message to the Vale, asking for aid.Jaime arrives in Riverrun with Bronn (Jerome Flynn), and assumes command of the siege set up by the 2 incompetent sons of Walder Frey. The sons of Walder Frey want Brynden to surrender the castle else they will hang Edmure, but Brynden simply tells them to right ahead. They hadn't set a proper perimeter for their siege of the castle, and Jaime was able to march right in with his 8000 soldiers. Bronn takes control of setting up the defensive and offensive positions around the castle.
Jaime unsuccessfully parleys with Brynden. The last time Brynden saw Jaime was when Catelyn released him from Rob's captivity, with a promise to return Sansa and Arya safely. Brynden is angry that Jamie has not kept the promise made to Catelyn, to return Sansa and Arya back to the house of Stark or Tully. He vows not to surrender.Theon and Yara spend their last night in Volantis (Yara tells Theon that she needs the real Theon back. And if he cant find him, then he should end his life then and there), then sail to Meereen to ally with Daenerys.
Arya prepares to return to Westeros until the Waif, disguised as an old crone, viciously stabs her. Arya survives by jumping into the water."]
plot outline: The Hound was saved by Brother Ray, the leader of a community, and has a peaceful life working as woodman. When three men from the Brotherhood threaten the villagers, The Hound is worried about but Brother Ray does not believe in violence anymore. Margaery seems to be converted by the High-Sparrow, but when she learns that her grandmother Oleanna Tyrrell is in danger, she contacts her to convince Oleanna to leave King's Landing. Jon. Sansa and Davos are searching for allies to vanquish Ramsay and retake Winterfell. Jaime and Bronn arrive at the Blackfish Castle and Jaime tries to convince him to surrender to the siege to his castle. Theon and Yara are resting in a brothel and waiting for uncle Euron's attack. Arya makes arrangements to return to Westeros but she is stabbed by the Waif.
plot: Jon and Sansa gather troops. Jaime arrives at Riverrun. Olenna Tyrell plans to leave King's Landing. Theon and Yara plan a destination. Arya makes plans to leave. The Hound was saved by Brother Ray, the leader of a community, and has a peaceful life working as woodman. When three men from the Brotherhood threaten the villagers, The Hound is worried about but Brother Ray does not believe in violence anymore. Margaery seems to be converted by the High-Sparrow, but when she learns that her grandmother Oleanna Tyrrell is in danger, she contacts her to convince Oleanna to leave King's Landing. Jon. Sansa and Davos are searching for allies to vanquish Ramsay and retake Winterfell. Jaime and Bronn arrive at the Blackfish Castle and Jaime tries to convince him to surrender to the siege to his castle. Theon and Yara are resting in a brothel and waiting for uncle Euron's attack. Arya makes arrangements to return to Westeros but she is stabbed by the Waif.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Sandor Clegane is alive and well. The high sparrow tries to persuade Margery to join king Tommen in bed and give him an heir, while threatening the life of her grandmother. Before leaving King's Landing, Lady Olenna lets Cersei know she has lost and has ended up all alone. Jon, Sansa and Davos persuade more people to join them into taking back Winterfell, including the Free Folks and House Mormont. However, they are not as successful with House Glover. Afraid of not having enough men, Sansa breaks her previous promise and asks Littlefinger for help. Asha and Theon plan to get to Daenerys and make a deal with her to reclaim the Iron Islands back. Arya gets herself a cabin on a ship sailing to Westeros before someone makes an attempt on her life.—Andy Ward Jaime, grumpily assisted by still unpaid Bronn, takes charge of the presently incompetent Blackfish castle siege but finds the Frey lord confident he can hold out longer then the Lannister army and indifferent to void or real threats. Jon convinces the Wildlings to help him reconquer Winterfell as a united North is their only chance to resist the winter forces, collects a meager contingent from Mormont girl lady thanks to Ser Davos, but is denied feudal service by petty lord Robett Glover due to Sansa's arrogant demand convincing him to declare Stark extinct, so she asks Petyr for help from the Vale after all. Having failed to release her offspring, Olenna Tyrell bitterly blames Cersei for allowing the zealots to compromise centuries of prominence amassed by their houses, but agrees before returning home they must join forces against the common enemy, receiving a secret message from Maergery, who pretends conversion to the high sparrow, who urges her to resume her conjugal duty as still childless Tommen's queen. Theon seems to relapse in anxious lethargy while Yara enjoys the brothel on the run for uncle Euron who chases them as challenge to his 'stolen' salt throne, so they decide to seek an alliance with Daenerys. Veteran brother Ray sticks to non-violence even when Sandor 'the hound', whom he was surprised to nurse back to health, stands up to three Brotherhood men threatening their carpenter community. Arya buys passage to Westeros.—KGF Vissers The Hound is alive and living a simple, non-violent life, having been saved by a Septon and his followers. When rogue Brotherhood members threaten and eventually slaughter the group, the Hound seeks revenge. Margaery convinces her grandmother to return to Highgarden after the High Sparrow threatens to punish Olenna following her and Jaime's confrontation with the Faith. Margaery then secretly signals to Olenna that she has not converted to the Faith. Jon, Sansa, and Davos recruit the wildlings, House Mormont, and others but remain outnumbered by the Boltons. Sansa secretly sends a message to the Vale requesting aid. Jaime arrives in Riverrun with Bronn and assumes command of the siege. Jaime unsuccessfully parleys with Brynden Tully. Theon and Yara spend their last night in Volantis before sailing to Meereen to ally with Daenerys. Arya prepares to return to Westeros until the Waif, disguised as an old crone, viciously stabs her.

title: No One
synopsis:
["High Sparrow summons Cersei to the Sept, via Lancel, but she flatly refuses. Gregor kills a Septon when he tries to force Cersei to come with them.
Tommen abolishes trial by combat to Cersei's dismay, who planned to win with Ser Gregor as her champion. Cersei is also very angry that Tommen conferred with High Sparrow, Pycelle (Julian Glover) and Kevan before coming up with this rule.
Pycelle tells Cersei that the rumor of the Mad King keeping vats of wildfire all over the city, to destroy it on his whims, are true.Brienne arrives in Riverrun (she has been sent by Sansa to enlist Brynden to join forces with her at Winterfell, the Jon's army). Jamie agrees to let Brynden leave the castle to join Sansa at Winterfell only if Brynden agrees to surrender the Riverrun castle. Brienne returns the Oathkeeper to Jaime, but Jaime tells Brienne that the sword will always belong to her. Brienne also takes Jaime's permission to fight for Sansa and against Jaime, in case she fails to persuade Brynden to abandon the castle.
Brienne fails to persuade Brynden to surrender as he doesn't know Brienne and doesn't believe that Sansa is alive. He will not abandon his castle on a Kingslayers word of honor. Plus Brynden says that he doesn't have enough men to help Jon take Winterfell. Brienne sends a raven to Sansa.
Podrick takes some combat training from Bronn.Jaime talks to Edmure, who says he hasn't seen his wife since their first night together and hasn't ever seen his son.
After Jaime threatens to kill Edmure's infant son, Edmure enters the castle (The castle Lord commander obey's Edmure's orders (as he is still the Lord OF Riverrun and the commander is sworn to obey the orders of the Lord of the Castle) despite Brynden telling them that Edmure is ordering them on Jamie's behest and that its a trap to take control of Riverrun) and orders the Tully forces to stand down. Brynden is killed fighting the Lannisters. Brienne and Podrick escape. Jamie has feelings for Brienne and allows her to escape.KInvara and her other priestesses start spreading Daenerys's word with the common population of Meereen. A fragile peace takes hold.
Varys departs Meereen on an unknown mission (he only says that they will need friends in Westeros and ships). Tyrion is happy, but Grey Worm and Missandei wont rest easy till Daenerys returns.
Meereen comes under naval assault by the masters of the 3 slaving cities (who are bombarding Meereen with fire laden catapults), but Daenerys returns on Drogon.Sandor Clegane encounters Berric Dondarrion (Richard Dormer) and Myr Thoros, who have captured the rogue Brothers (who had killed Sandor's group for their food. Sandor was in the woods chopping trees when the attack took place and wasn't able to help) and allows Sandor Clegane to help execute them. They ask Sandor to join the Brotherhood.Arya manages to reach the theatre of Lady Crane. Arya is taken in by Lady Crane (this is repayment for Arya saving Lady Crane's life from the assassination attempt), who tends her wounds. Crane had ruined Bianca's face after Arya's warning and now Bianca will never get work as an actress. Crane gives her Milk of the Poppy to sleep and help her heal.
The Waif finds Arya, kills Lady Crane, and pursues Arya through the streets. Arya leads the Waif into the darkened catacombs and kills her, using Needle and the fighting skills she acquired while blind. Arya returns the Waif's face to the House's column-collection-room and declares to H'Ghar that she is Arya Stark of Winterfell, and she is going home."]
plot outline: Arya recovers after being helped by the actress whose life she saved, Lady Crane, whom she finds murdered when she wakes up as Waif catches up with her. The Hound goes on a revenge trip and finally reunites himself with Beric. Cersei uses the Mountain to get back at the High Sparrow and his people. Then she receives the cruel news that her son, king Tommen, is manipulated by the high Sparrow to ban the trial by combat in the seven kingdoms. Brienne and Podrick reach Jaime and Bronn. Brienne makes an offer to Jaime to get him, Sansa and the Blackfish satisfied. She tries to convince the Blackfish to take his army North and help Sansa get Winterfell back. As Jaime threatens to kill Lord Edmure's son, Edmure decides to help Jaime take Riverrun. Daenerys comes back to the pyramid in Meereen.
plot: Brienne arrives at Riverrun. Arya seeks shelter. Jaime meets with Edmure Tully. Cersei challenges the Faith. Sandor Clegane hunts for revenge. Tyrion faces the consequences of earlier decisions. Arya recovers after being helped by the actress whose life she saved, Lady Crane, whom she finds murdered when she wakes up as Waif catches up with her. The Hound goes on a revenge trip and finally reunites himself with Beric. Cersei uses the Mountain to get back at the High Sparrow and his people. Then she receives the cruel news that her son, king Tommen, is manipulated by the high Sparrow to ban the trial by combat in the seven kingdoms. Brienne and Podrick reach Jaime and Bronn. Brienne makes an offer to Jaime to get him, Sansa and the Blackfish satisfied. She tries to convince the Blackfish to take his army North and help Sansa get Winterfell back. As Jaime threatens to kill Lord Edmure's son, Edmure decides to help Jaime take Riverrun. Daenerys comes back to the pyramid in Meereen.—Andreea D In Braavos, Lady Crane finds the wounded Arya hidden in her chamber. She stitches her wounds and gives a potion to Arya to sleep. When Arya wakes up, she finds that the Waif has just killed Lady Crane and wants to kill her. Arya flees and is hunted down by the Waif. In Riverlands, Clegane seeks revenge and hunts down the men from the Brotherhood without Banners that killed the settlers; he stumbles upon Beric that invites him to join his group. In Meereen, life seems to be normal; however the Masters send vessels to attack the city. In King's Landing, Cersei challenges the Faith Militant and Gregor defends her killing one fanatic that has attacked him. Out of the blue, King Tommen announces a surprising decision that affects his mother and Loras. Brienne unsuccessfully tries to convince Blackfish to surrender his castle to Jaime. But Jaime makes a deal with Edmure that is released, returns to the castle and surrenders it to Jaime.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Jaime, joined by Podrick and Brienne, fails to personally negotiate an honorable retreat with besieged Brynden 'Blackfish' Tully, but allows Brienne and prisoner kin Edmure to try, and the latter succeeds in handing over the castle by talking over the defenders. Cersei challenges the high sparrow by refusing a summons, trusting on the mountain as guard to protect her against cousin Lancel's sparrow militia, but king Tommen makes her hear from the throne room balcony how he sanctions the trials against her and the Tyrels and bans the alternative trial by duel. Revenging the murders on settlers the brotherhood without Banners, Sandor 'The Hound' Clegane bumps onto mate Beric Dondarrion and joins his band. Tyrion's smugness about his pacification deals, flippantly teaching Worm and Missandei to drink and jest, is shaken as a fleet from the masters attacks Meereen. Stabbed Arya is nursed by her assigned mark actress lady Crane, but Ja'qen's Waif killer is after both of them.—KGF Vissers Tommen abolishes trial by combat, to Cersei's dismay, who planned to win with Ser Gregor as her champion. In Riverrun, Brienne fails to persuade Brynden Tully to surrender the castle and ride safely North. After Jaime threatens to kill Edmure's infant son, Edmure enters the castle and orders the Tully forces to stand down. Brynden is killed fighting the Lannisters while Brienne and Podrick escape. Varys departs for Westeros on a secret mission. Meereen comes under naval assault by the slaving cities; Daenerys returns on Drogon, accompanied by the Dothraki. The Hound kills four of the rogues, then encounters Berric Dondarrion and Myr Thoros, who have captured the others. They execute them and ask Clegane to join the Brotherhood. Arya seeks out Lady Crane, who tends her wounds. The Waif kills Lady Crane and pursues Arya through the streets. Arya leads the Waif into darkened catacombs and kills her using Needle. Arya places the Waif's face in the House's columned collection room and tells H'ghar that she is Arya Stark of Winterfell, and she is going home.

title: Battle of the Bastards
synopsis:
["Daenerys is angry with Tyrion for leading Meereen to ruin, with his 7 yr pact with the slavers. Daenerys wants to destroy the slaver's fleet and kill all the masters, but Tyrion says this is exactly what her father, the Mad King would have done (The mad king had wildfire stored underneath the streets, all over the city to set it on fire if it ever went against him). He asks Daenerys to talk to the slavers once.
Daenerys meets with three slave masters to negotiate a surrender, but they refuse. The masters thought that Daenerys wanted to surrender and their terms were for the dragons to be slaughtered, the unsullied to be sold again to the highest bidder and the same for Missandei. Daenerys to leave Meereen on foot.
Riding Drogon, as Rhaegal and Viserion assist, Daenerys attacks and burns the slavers' fleet. She saves some ships for herself (to cross the Narrow Sea). The Dothraki army purge the city of Sons of the Harpy.
Grey Worm kills two of the masters, leaving one alive to report what he witnessed.After the battle, Theon and Yara meet with Daenerys and Tyrion and form an alliance. They have brought a 100 ships from the iron fleet to support Daenerys and want her support to their claim upon the Iron Islands. Theon tells Daenerys that Euron has more ships in the fleet and is building more. But Euron wont offer these to Daenerys without Daenerys agreeing to marrying him in return.
Daenerys agrees, but only if Yara agrees to supporting Daenerys as the Queen of the seven kingdoms and to stop the raping and pillaging which has been the way of the Iron Islands for many many years.Sansa and Jon meet Ramsay near Winterfell (Sansa insists on being present for the meeting) and Jon challenges Ramsay 1:1. Ramsay refuses knowing he has 6000 soldiers and Jon has not even half that. Ramsay wants Jon to return Sansa, kneel before him accepting him as the true Lord of Winterfell and in exchange Ramsay will let Jon return to the Wall.
Jon is reluctant to attack since Ramsay has Rickon. He wants Ramsay to attack their positions with his cavalry and digs trenches all around his forces for a defensive position. Sansa tells Jon that Rickon is never coming back alive since Rickon is Ned's own son and has a stronger claim to Winterfell than Jon or Sansa. Till he is alive, Ramsay will never have legitimacy to his claim on Winterfell and the North. Sansa also tells Jon that if they loose, she will commit suicide, rather than join Ramsay again.
Jon tells Melisandre not to bring him back, if he dies on the battlefield. Before the battle Ser Davos figures out that Melisandre counseled Stannis to sacrifice Shireen for his victory and favor with the Fire God. Davos is very angry with her.Near Winterfell, the Stark and Bolton armies meet on the battle field. Ramsay feigns releasing Rickon, then kills him with an arrow as he runs toward Jon. Predictably, Jon is enraged and charges towards the Boltons. Davos is forced to order his cavalry to follow their commander. The well laid plans come to nothing, just like Sansa said.
In the battle, the Stark forces are pinned by Bolton soldiers (Ramsay fires arrows right into the middle of the battle, killing his own men, as well as Jon's) until the Knights of the Vale (led by Petyr and Sansa) arrive and overwhelm them.Ramsay takes refuge inside Winterfell, but the Wildling giant Wun Wun breaches the gate. Ramsay is taken prisoner and beaten up brutally by Jon; Sansa later watches as Ramsay's starving hounds devour him."]
plot outline: Meereen is under siege and the fleet of the masters is attacking the city. Daenerys wants to destroy their cities but Tyrion convinces her to not incur in the same mistake of her father in King's Landing. They schedule a meeting with the masters to discuss the terms of surrender. However the masters misunderstand and believe Daenerys want to surrender. She rides Drogon and together with the two other dragons, they burn part of the fleet. Meanwhile Daario and the Dothraki attack the Sons of the Harpy. Then Yara and Theon team up with Daenerys to accept the independence of the Iron Isles and to overthrow Euron. In Winterfell, Jon Snow, Sansa, Davos and Tormund meet with Ramsay, and Jon Snow proposes a dispute between them instead of sacrificing lives in a battle. Ramsay does not accept and they schedule the battle in the morning. Jon Snow plots a scheme with Davos and Tormund and Sansa warns that Ramsay plays dirty. When both armies are ready to battle, Ramsay brings a surprise that affects Jon and his army. Who will win the bloody battle?
plot: Jon and Sansa face Ramsay Bolton on the fields of Winterfell. Daenerys strikes back at her enemies. Theon and Yara arrive in Meereen. Meereen is under siege and the fleet of the masters is attacking the city. Daenerys wants to destroy their cities but Tyrion convinces her to not incur in the same mistake of her father in King's Landing. They schedule a meeting with the masters to discuss the terms of surrender. However the masters misunderstand and believe Daenerys want to surrender. She rides Drogon and together with the two other dragons, they burn part of the fleet. Meanwhile Daario and the Dothraki attack the Sons of the Harpy. Then Yara and Theon team up with Daenerys to accept the independence of the Iron Isles and to overthrow Euron. In Winterfell, Jon Snow, Sansa, Davos and Tormund meet with Ramsay, and Jon Snow proposes a dispute between them instead of sacrificing lives in a battle. Ramsay does not accept and they schedule the battle in the morning. Jon Snow plots a scheme with Davos and Tormund and Sansa warns that Ramsay plays dirty. When both armies are ready to battle, Ramsay brings a surprise that affects Jon and his army. Who will win the bloody battle?—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil With the help of her dragons, Daenerys reclaims Meeren. Ramsay refuses a one-on-one battle with Jon. Sansa argues with Jon about his strategy. Theon and Asha reach Mereen and make a deal with Daenerys and Tyrion. Ramsay executes Rickon in his own way, right in front of Jon. Jon seems to be losing the fight of Winterfell, largely outnumbered by Ramsay's people. But then, close to his end, Jon's life is saved by the coming army, much to Sansa's delight. Ramsay tries to flee but Jon goes after him and makes it his mission to kill him. In the meantime Wun Wun goes down. Eventually the Starks have Winterfell and Sansa takes her revenge on Ramsay in a Ramsay style.—Andreea Ward While Daario's Dothraki army attacks the Sons of the Harpy, the fiery dragons fight off the slavers fleet, afterward Daenerys and Tyrion agree to a pact with Theon and fellow 'first-ever queen' Yara to help them fight off uncle Euon and reconquer the Irons Islands if they salty pirates become a peaceful part of 'her' seven kingdoms. Jon, Davos and Tormund refuse to wait or abandon an attack on the superior Bolton forces. Ramsay posts them outside Winterfell, laughs away a generals duel and proves his sadistic mastery at psychological warfare by leading Stark price Rickon onto the battle field and shooting arrows ever closer at him, drawing Jon to abandon his trenches trap-require position only to collect a juvenile corpse and have his troops, following on Davos's command, exposed to arrow salvos and pincered between impenetrable infantry shield walls. The massacre is stopped only by the late, sudden arrival of Petyr's cavalry from the Vale, which has Ramsay abandon his men in the vain belief the castle will hold out, but before dying from projectiles, the whit giant crushes the front gate. Ramsay is now taken prisoner and exposed to Sansa's beastly wrath in his kennel.—KGF Vissers On Tyrion's advice, Daenerys meets with three slave masters to negotiate a surrender, which they refuse. The three dragons attack and burn the slavers' ships. Grey Worm kills two of the masters, leaving one alive to report what he witnessed. Theon and Yara meet with Daenerys and Tyrion to offer an alliance in exchange for the Iron Islands being independent. Near Winterfell, the Stark and Bolton armies meet on the battlefield. Ramsay feigns releasing Rickon before killing him with an arrow. In the battle, the Stark forces are pinned by Bolton soldiers until the Knights of the Vale arrive and overwhelm them. Ramsay flees to Winterfell, but the wildling giant Wun Wun breaches the gate and Ramsay is taken prisoner after Jon beats him senseless. Later, Sansa watches Ramsay's starving hounds devour him.

title: The Winds of Winter
synopsis:
["The trial gets underway. Loras admits to his crimes of perjury and depravity. Loras kneels before the High Sparrow to beg for mercy. He pledges his life to the Faith Militancy. He promises to abandon the Tyrell name and all that goes with it, the Lord Lordship and the claims on Highgarden. He will never marry or have any children. Cersei stayed away from her own trial. Gregor had stopped Tommen from attending the trial on Cersei's orders. Margaery suspects that Cersei is upto something and asks the High Sparrow to ask everyone to empty the Sept as fast as they can. But The High Sparrow ignores Margaery and intends to force Cersei to attend the trial, or hold the trial in her absence. The Faith Militants prevent anyone from leaving the Sept.
On the day of her trial, Cersei destroys the Sept of Baelor by wildfire, killing the High Sparrow, Margaery, Mace, and Loras Tyrell (Finn Jones), Lancel, and Kevan Lannister, along with hundreds of King's Landing nobles and the Faith Militant, while Qyburn has Pycelle killed (Pycelle is stabbed to death by the children who spied for Varys and then Qyburn). Cersei personally tortures the Septa Unella. Cersei orders Gregor to rape Septa Unella, but not allow her to die.
Distraught over Margaery's death, Tommen commits suicide by jumping out of the window of his cabin. Cersei is not very sorry to see Tommen dead.In Dorne, Varys meets with Olenna and Ellaria (Ollena had traveled to Dorne on Ellaria's invitation), seeking an alliance between Daenerys and their Houses against the Lannisters. Lannisters have declared war on Tyrells as well as on Dorne.Davos confronts Melisandre over Shireen's death (she defends herself saying that she only did what her Lord commanded her to do. She says Jon is alive because of the sacrifice. She also says she can help Jon win the war against the Night King), and Jon banishes her from Winterfell. The Wildlings, the Knights of the Vale and the surviving northern Houses pledge loyalty to Jon as the King in the North. Jon Snow avenged the Red wedding, he is the King in the North. A white raven arrives from the Citadel, finally confirming that Winter is here.Sansa rebuffs Littlefinger's sexual advances. He wants to sit on the Iron Throne with Sansa at his side.Walder Frey and his sons celebrate the re-taking of Riverrun at the twin castles. Jaime Lannister is in attendance and warns Walder Frey that this is the last time he loses Riverrun. It wont be returned, if they lose it again. Arya kills Walder's 2 sons, bakes them into a pie and feeds it to Walder, before killing him as well.
Samwell Tarly and Gilly reach the Citadel in Oldtown. Sam presents his orders from Jon to the admin at the Citadel. Citadel had no news that Joer Mormont had died, and hence to them Jon's orders are invalid. Sam explains that Joer and Aemon are both dead. Sam is allowed to use the library till his case is discussed by the arch Maester himself. The library is endless.Benjen accompanies Brandon and Meera as far as the Wall but is unable to pass through with them (as he is technically not dead. He says the wall has ancient magic carved into its foundations that don't allow the dead to pass). Using his powers, Brandon learns that Jon is the son of Lyanna Stark and was adopted by Eddard after she died during Robert's rebellion. Lyanna was Ned's sister and married to Robert Baratheon. she was abducted by Rhaegar Targaryen, who annulled his marriage to Elia Martell and married Lyanna. During Robert's rebellion, Lyanna gave birth to Rhaegar's son, and named him Aegon. But to save him from the Lannisters & Robert, who had already killed the entire Targaryen clan, Lyanna asks Ned to adopt him. Ned takes the boy to Winterfell and raises him as Jon Snow.When Jaime returns to King's Landing, Cersei has been crowned the Queen of the Seven Kingdoms.Daenerys sets sail for Westeros with her supporters, armies, and dragons, leaving Naharis and the Second Sons behind to rule over Meereen. Daenerys explains to Daario that she cant bring a lover to Westeros. This was Tyrion's plan, since Daario would have been a liability for Daenerys in the Seven Kingdoms. Daenerys appoints Tyrion the Hand of the Queen."]
plot outline: Cersei and Loras stand trial for their crimes, while Jaime celebrates victory with Walder Frey at The Twins. Davos confronts Jon about Melisandre's actions, and Littlefinger reveals his intentions to Sansa. Meanwhile, Bran continues his quest for knowledge in the far North as "winter" finally arrives.
plot: Cersei and Loras Tyrell stand trial by the gods. Daenerys prepares to set sail for Westeros. Davos confronts Melisandre. Sam and Gilly arrive in the Citadel. Bran discovers a long-kept secret. Lord Frey has an uninvited guest. Cersei and Loras stand trial for their crimes, while Jaime celebrates victory with Walder Frey at The Twins. Davos confronts Jon about Melisandre's actions, and Littlefinger reveals his intentions to Sansa. Meanwhile, Bran continues his quest for knowledge in the far North as "winter" finally arrives. Cersei is to be tried by the Seven, but has plans of her own. Jaime and Bronn celebrate with the Freys. Bran continues his quest for knowledge as the Three-Eyed Raven. Jon and Sansa discuss the impending Winter. Daenerys and her fleet finally make way for Westeros. The houses can barely stand by as a broken Loras Tyrell confesses his sins and asks to be branded into the service of the seven gods. Before her trial, Cersei has the Sept of Baelor blown up by wildfire in the cellar, killing the High Sparrow, most Tyrells, Lancel and Kevan Lannister, hundreds of minor nobles and the Faith Militant. Cersei reveals her incest with Jamie and that she killed Robert Baratheon to Septa Unella before having Ser Gregor Clegane, torture her to slow death. Distraught over beloved Margaery's death, Tommen jumps to his own. Qyburn has Pycelle killed and succeeds as queen's hand. In Dorne, Varys meets with Olenna and Ellaria, seeking an alliance between Daenerys and their Houses against the Lannisters. Davos scolds Melisandre for Princess Shireen's fire death, Jon banishes her instead of accepting her help. Led by child heirs, the Wildlings and the surviving northern houses pledge loyalty to Jon as King of the North. Sansa bitterly rebuffs Littlefinger's romantic overture.Arya kills first Walder Frey and after assuming his face tricks his sons and men into mirror vengeance for the red wedding. Sam and Gilly reach the Citadel in Oldtown, where he's assigned menial duties but sneaks into the secret section and is believed by the grand maester, who still feels no action required. Benjen accompanies Brandon and Meera to the Wall but can't go further. In a vision, Bran sees Ned finding Lyanna Stark dying after giving birth to Jon Snow during King Robert's rebellion. Jaime returns to King's Landing where Cersei crowns herself Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. Daenerys names Tyrion Hand of the Queen and sails for Westeros with the Greyjoys, her armies, and her dragons, leaving Dario Naharis and the Second Sons behind to rule Meereen until new leaders are elected.—KGF Vissers Before her trial, Cersei destroys the Sept of Baelor by wildfire, killing the High Sparrow, the Tyrells, Lancel and Kevan Lannister, hundreds of nobles, and the Faith Militant; Qyburn has Pycelle killed. Cersei reveals her incest with Jamie and that she killed Robert Baratheon to Septa Unella before having Ser Gregor Clegane torture her until she dies. Distraught over Margaery's death, Tommen commits suicide. In Dorne, Varys meets with Olenna and Ellaria, seeking an alliance between Daenerys and their Houses against the Lannisters. Davos confronts Melisandre over Princess Shireen's death, resulting in Jon banishing her. Led by Lyanna Mormont, the Wildlings and the surviving northern houses pledge loyalty to Jon as King of the North. Sansa rebuffs Littlefinger's romantic overtures. Sam and Gilly reach the Citadel in Oldtown. Benjen accompanies Brandon and Meera to the Wall but is unable to go further. In a vision, Bran sees Ned finding Lyanna Stark as she lies dying after giving birth (to Jon Snow) during King Robert's rebellion. Jaime returns to King's Landing, and Cersei crowns herself Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. Daenerys names Tyrion Hand of the Queen and sails for Westeros with the Greyjoys, her armies, and her dragons, leaving Daario Naharis and the Second Sons behind to rule Meereen until new leaders are elected.

title: Dragonstone
synopsis:
['At the Twins, Arya (Maisie Williams), disguised as Walder Frey (David Bradley), poisons the remaining lords of House Frey. These were all the men who help Walden slaughter the Starks at the red wedding.
In the Riverlands, Arya meets some friendly Lannister soldiers who consider her declared intention to kill Cersei as a joke.The White Walkers march toward the Wall and the Night King brings the winter storm with him. At the wall Edd Tollett (Ben Crompton) allows Bran (Isaac Hempstead Wright) and Meera (Ellie Kendrick) to enter through the wall gates.At Winterfell, despite Sansa's (Sophie Turner) objection, Jon (Kit Harington) secures the loyalties of the new heads of Houses Umber and Karstark, whose previous leaders fought alongside Ramsay in the Battle of the Bastards. Sansa wants Jon to strip the Umbers and the Karstarks of their titles and give their castles to lords who fought for him against Ramsay. Petyr enjoys the public spat between Jon and Sansa. Jon refuses to punish the sons for their fathers sins since the fathers are already dead in the field of battle. North needs to band together and Jon over-rules Sanse in front of the entire Lord gathering of the North.
Jon asks all house Maesters to look for references to dragon-glass as that's the only thing that can kill White Walkers. Jon asks the house Lords to train their women to fight as well. They cant win if half the population is sitting on the sidelines. Jon sends wild-lings to defend the castle of Eastwatch by the sea. This is the castle closest to Hardhome, where the white walkers were seen last.
Jon receives word that Cersei has been crowned queen and she wants Jon to come to King's Landing and bend his knee, or suffer the fate of all traitors. Petyr continues to inflame Sansa against Jon.At the Citadel, Samwell (John Bradley) secretly borrows library books on White Walkers as no one is willing to take him seriously as they all feel that the wall will protect them (as it has for thousands of years). One reveals a large deposit of dragon-glass in Dragonstone and he sends word to Jon. Sam later finds Ser Jorah (Iain Glen), now heavily infected with Greyscale, quarantined in a cell.Sandor runs into Thoros again and this time he reluctantly joins the Brotherhood. Thoros (Paul Kaye) shows Sandor Clegane (Rory McCann) a vision of the Wall and the marching Army of the Dead, they pass the wall at the Eastfort by the Sea.. The revelation leads him to believe in the Lord of Light.In King's Landing, Jaime (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) tells Cersei (Lena Headey) that allies are crucially needed as the Freys are dead and Sands in the East, Tyrells in the West and Starks in the North are all enemies. They know that Daenerys has chosen Tyrion to be her hand. Jaime says they will head to Dragonstone. Cersei wants Jaime to attack, but Jaime counters that winter is here and they don't have the provisions to feed their army as Tyrells hold all the grain and livestock.
She receives Euron (Pilou Asbæk), who proposes marriage in exchange for his Iron Fleet and an opportunity to kill Theon (Alfie Allen) and Yara (Gemma Whelan). Cersei declines, citing trust concerns (The Greyjoys have broken every promise they have ever made in the past), so Euron promises to return with a "gift" to prove his loyalty.Daenerys (Emilia Clarke) arrives at Dragonstone, the home of House Targaryen, previously occupied by Stannis Baratheon, with her army and dragons.']
plot outline: Bran and Mera arrive at Castle Black. Jon and Sansa plan the defense against the long night. Cersei forges new alliances. Samwell trains to be a maester. Arya gets her revenge. The Hound takes shelter in a familiar place. Daenerys arrives at Westeros.
plot: Jon organizes the North's defenses. Cersei tries to even the odds. Daenerys comes home. Arya reminds the Freys "the North remembers." Sam adapts to life in Oldtown. The Night King makes his way south. Bran and Mera arrive at Castle Black. Jon and Sansa plan the defense against the long night. Cersei forges new alliances. Samwell trains to be a maester. Arya gets her revenge. The Hound takes shelter in a familiar place. Daenerys arrives at Westeros. Jon duly scolds Sansa for publicly questioning him, which seems to amuse Petyr, and decides the North must try to bury all grievances to raise the greatest defense against the Night King's marching forces of Winter, so instead of confiscating their houses castles, he swears in juvenile heirs Ned Umber and even Alys Karstark, as even females must be recruited. Cersei is on the Iron Throne after Tommen's suicide, dying for vengeance on all traitors, but Jaime points out they desperately needs allies instead to stand a chance against the Targeryen threat. Euron Greyjoy offers her an alliance by marriage between 'rightful rulers', but she declines and he promises to return with an irresistible gift. In between menial Citadel library services, Sam learns Archmaester Ebrose believes him but sees no need to permit him before graduation to study a defense against Winter as it always passed, so Sam steal a dead man's key to sneak into the forbidden section, where he learns dragon glass is massively available at one site: the Targeryen castle Dragon Rock, where Daenerys just landed with Theon's Iron Fleet. Arya enjoys generous hospitality at a Lannister troops camp fire and learns the plight of war-recruited farm boys, but remains revenge-obsessed. Bran's three ravens-visions prepare him for his arrival with Meera at Castle Black.—KGF Vissers At the Twins, Arya, disguised as Walder Frey, poisons the remaining lords of House Frey. The White Walkers march toward the Wall. Edd receives Bran and Meera at Castle Black. At Winterfell, Sansa objects when Jon accepts the loyalties of Houses Umber and Karstark, whose previous leaders supported Ramsay. Queen Cersei demands that the North bend the knee. At the Citadel, Samwell "borrows" restricted library books, learning there is a large deposit of dragonglass at Dragonstone; he sends word to Jon. Sam finds Jorah, now heavily infected with greyscale, quarantined in a cell. In the Riverlands, Arya meets some friendly Lannister soldiers, and "jokingly" claims she will kill Cersei. The Hound begins to believe in the Lord of Light after Thoros shows him a fiery vision of the Wall and the Army of the Dead. In King's Landing, Jaime tells Cersei they crucially need allies. Euron arrives to propose marriage in exchange for his Iron Fleet and an opportunity to kill Theon and Yara. Cersei declines over his untrustworthiness; Euron promises to return with a gift that will prove his loyalty. Daenerys arrives at Dragonstone, House Targaryen's ancestral home, with her army and large dragons.
