title: Stormborn
synopsis:
["Daenerys sends the Dornishmen Ellaria and her daughters with Yara's fleet to Sunspear and the Unsullied to Casterly Rock, following Tyrion's (Peter Dinklage) advice to lay siege to King's Landing. Tyrion's plan is to gather the Dornish and Tyrell armies to lay siege to the capital and not use the Dothraki and Unsullied. As they know Cersei will use the fear of foreigners to rally the noblemen behind her. Tyrion wants to convince the great houses of Westeros to back Daenerys, so she can conqueror a Kingdom and not ashes.
The Unsullied will take Casterly Rock and remove the last refuge for the Lannisters. Olenna agrees to Tyrion's plan, but advises Daenerys to ignore Tyrion and be bold in her plan to become the Queen of the Seven Kingdoms.Daenerys challenges Varys' (Conleth Hill) loyalty and threatens to burn him alive if he ever betrays her (She is angry with her for following Robert's orders and planning her execution when she was preggers. She believes that Varys has no loyalty and basically he does whatever required to stay alive and then if he dislikes a royal, he plots and scheme vigorously to dislodge them and install new one). she makes Varys promise her that if he thinks she is failing the people, he will first come and tell her directly rather than plot behind her back.
Melisandre (Carice van Houten) arrives and encourages Daenerys to invite Jon Snow to Dragonstone to plan their fight against the Long Night.. Tyrion agrees since Jon is now King of the North and hates Cersei even more than what Daenerys does. He will be a powerful ally to Daenerys. Daenerys sends a raven to Jon, summoning him to Dragonstone. Jon decides to go as he needs all the help he can get (dragons breathe fire and fire kills wights), to defend against the White Walkers and their army of the dead.Grey Worm (Jacob Anderson) and Missandei (Nathalie Emmanuel) consummate their relationship.Cersei summons several Tyrell lords, wanting their fealty. She makes a whole case around how Daenerys is the Mad King's daughter who has bought the savages to the shores in the form of Dothraki and the Unsullied and killed hundreds of noblemen in Meereen when she had the chance. Randyll is still conflicted between his oath to the Kindgom and his oath to the house of Tyrell. Jaime promises that Cersei will elevate Randyll Tarly (James Faulkner) (Father of Samwell Tarly) as Warden of the South after the war is won, if he fights for the Lannisters.
Qyburn (Anton Lesser) shows Cersei a prototype ballista capable of killing dragons.Arya is reunited with Hot Pie (Ben Hawkey), who tells her Jon is now King in the North. She resets her course for Winterfell, delaying her quest to kill Cersei in the King's Landing. Arya also meets with her Direwolf Nymeria who she had let go all those years ago to save its life.Jon receives another raven from the Citadel from Sam, telling him about the stash of Dragonglass at Dragonstone. Sansa is against Jon's plan as she thinks Daenerys only wants to kill Jon to claim the North.
Jon travels to Dragonstone to request Daenerys' help against the White Walkers, leaving Sansa in charge at Winterfell. Jon warns Littlefinger (Aidan Gillen) to keep his distance from Sansa, when Petyr professes his love for Sansa.Sam has seen Shireen's Greyscale been treated and was sure that there was a cure. Arch Maester counters that Shireen's infection was discovered quite early, while Jorah is at a very advance stage of infection. Samwell applies a forbidden treatment on Jorah's Greyscale infection. The procedure is forbidden as it is considered far too dangerous. The procedure involves removing the entire layer of infected skin tissue and then applying a medicinal ointment to the flesh.Euron's fleet attacks Yara's on the high seas. Obara (Keisha Castle-Hughes) and Nymeria (Jessica Henwick) are killed, while Ellaria (Indira Varma), Tyene (Rosabell Laurenti Sellers), and Yara are captured.
Theon, experiencing flashbacks as Reek, hesitates to challenge Euron and jumps overboard."]
plot outline: Tyrion convinces Daenerys, who gruesomely doubts Varys's motivation, to avoid a bloodbath attacking King's Landing, rather sending Theon and Yara's Iron fleet to ship the Dornish army from Sunspear and lay siege with the Tyrell troops, while Unsullied are shipped to Lannister home Casterly Rock. Jon Snow is haughtily invited to acknowledge 'his queen' Daenerys at Dragonstone, where Grey Worm and Missandei consummate their love. Cersei summons several lords, demanding fealty, while Jaime offers to elevate Randyll Tarly as Warden of the South, undoing loyalty to house Tyrell. Qyburn shows Cersei a prototype ballista to kill dragons. Cook Hot Pie tells Arya the Boltons are smashed by Jon, the new King in the North, who leaves Sansa in charge at Winterfell as he sails against all Northern lords' advice to request Daenerys' help against the Winter forces after harshly warns Littlefinger to keep off Sansa. Samwell performs a forbidden surgery on Jorah's 'greyscale' infection. Euron's fleet crushes Yara's, killing Obara and Nymeria and capturing Ellaria, Tyene and Yara, only Theon, experiencing flashbacks as Reek, jumps overboard.
plot: Daenerys receives an unexpected visitor. Jon faces resistance. Tyrion plans the conquest of Westeros. Cersei gathers her allies. Arya has a reunion with old friends. Sam risks his career and life. Tyrion convinces Daenerys, who gruesomely doubts Varys's motivation, to avoid a bloodbath attacking King's Landing, rather sending Theon and Yara's Iron fleet to ship the Dornish army from Sunspear and lay siege with the Tyrell troops, while Unsullied are shipped to Lannister home Casterly Rock. Jon Snow is haughtily invited to acknowledge 'his queen' Daenerys at Dragonstone, where Grey Worm and Missandei consummate their love. Cersei summons several lords, demanding fealty, while Jaime offers to elevate Randyll Tarly as Warden of the South, undoing loyalty to house Tyrell. Qyburn shows Cersei a prototype ballista to kill dragons. Cook Hot Pie tells Arya the Boltons are smashed by Jon, the new King in the North, who leaves Sansa in charge at Winterfell as he sails against all Northern lords' advice to request Daenerys' help against the Winter forces after harshly warns Littlefinger to keep off Sansa. Samwell performs a forbidden surgery on Jorah's 'greyscale' infection. Euron's fleet crushes Yara's, killing Obara and Nymeria and capturing Ellaria, Tyene and Yara, only Theon, experiencing flashbacks as Reek, jumps overboard.—KGF Vissers Daenerys heeds Tyrion's advice not to take King's Landing by force, which would kill thousands. Yara's fleet is sent to Sunspear to transport the Dornish army to lay siege to King's Landing alongside the Tyrell forces; the Unsullied are to take Casterly Rock. Daenerys challenges Varys' loyalty and threatens to burn him alive if he ever betrays her. Melisandre arrives and encourages Daenerys to invite Jon Snow to Dragonstone, saying he is integral to the war. Grey Worm and Missandei consummate their relationship. Cersei summons several lords, demanding their fealty, while Jaime offers to elevate Randyll Tarly as Warden of the South. Qyburn shows Cersei a prototype ballista capable of killing dragons. Arya is reunited with Hot Pie, who tells her the Boltons are dead and Jon is now King in the North. She resets course for Winterfell. Jon sets sails for Dragonstone to request Daenerys' help against the White Walkers, leaving Sansa in charge at Winterfell. He warns Littlefinger to never touch Sansa. Samwell performs a forbidden surgery on Jorah's greyscale infection. Euron's fleet attacks Yara's, killing Obara and Nymeria and capturing Ellaria, Tyene, and Yara. Theon, experiencing flashbacks as Reek, jumps overboard.

title: The Queen's Justice
synopsis:
['Jon arrives at Dragonstone where Daenerys demands his fealty (Starks had sworn fealty to the Targaryens in perpetuity). when the Starks and Targaryens were allies, were the best years for the Seven Kingdoms. Jon refuses and instead seeks her help fighting the Army of the Dead. Tyrion also implores Jon that it is unreasonable for him to ask Daenerys to abandon her mission and join JOn against the White Walkers, in the first meeting, without any proof.
Jon argues that he will not bend the knee as all of his allies have put their faith in him, and named him King of the North. He will not abandon their faith.Tyrion meets Jon and says he believes his talk of the Night King and the army of the dead. Jon doesn't know how to convince people who don't know him, of the intensity of the threat. Tyrion wants Jon not to give up. Tyrion says Daenerys wont abandon her mission to help Jon, so he asks if there is anything else that Jon needs. Following Tyrion's advice, Daenerys allows Jon to mine the island's dragon-glass.
Melisandre avoids Jon and departs for Volantis, telling Varys that she is retiring and that her job of bringing Daenerys and Jon together is done. She says she is not good terms with Jon or Davos, and hence her presence will only be a distractionVarys bring Daenerys news that their attack on Dorne failed and all of the Greyjoys and sands were killed in battle or captured.
Theon is rescued at sea by a party of Iron Soldiers not loyal to Euron. They correctly figure out that Theon decided to run away rather than fight Euron and save Yara.Sansa orders her commanders to build grain stocks in Winterfell to prepare for the long winter. Bran, with Meera, arrives at Winterfell and reveals his newfound-identity as the Three-Eyed Raven to Sansa.In King's Landing, Euron presents Ellaria and Tyene as a gift for Cersei, who promises him marriage after the war is won. She also awards him co-control of her military, alongside Jaime. Jaime to control the army, and Euron to control the navy. Cersei administers the same poison to Tyene that killed Myrcella, forcing Ellaria to watch her daughter's impending death and remain imprisoned with the body. Cersei then proceeds to have sex with Jamie Lannister.
The Iron Bank sends its emissary to meet Cersei and she re-iterates her promise that "Lannisters always pay their debts". In addition she convinces the emissary that Daenerys is a revolutionary (who freed the slaves, in which the bank was invested heavily) and revolutionaries are never good for sound business. She says that the war has already started and Cersei won the first round by killing the Dornish threat. Euron and his fleet controls the narrow seas and Daenerys's dragon are not as infallible as popularly believed.In Oldtown, a healed Jorah leaves to find Daenerys. Archmaester Ebrose (Jim Broadbent) praises Samwell's skill in saving Jorah (many more experienced Maesters have performed his surgery before and failed, yet Sam succeeded) but makes him copy old texts for his disobedience (If the procedure had gone wrong, it could have infected the entire citadel).Tyrion provides a plan to attack Casterly rock, via a passage through the sewers. When Casterly rock was being built, Tywin gave the job of constructing the sewers to Tyrion. Tyrion built the passage to smuggle his whores in and out. TYwin disapproved of them and so this was Tyrion way of hiding them. The passage started in a cove by the beach.Grey Worm and the Unsullied attack Casterly Rock, only to find that Jaime has led the bulk of the Lannister forces in an attack on Highgarden, while Euron's fleet ambushes and destroys the Unsullied's ships. This was a well thought out strategy by Jamie to out-think Tyrion and upsets his plans. Jaime left no food at Casterly Rock, so Daenerys would eventually have to abandon it. Ryndall Tarly rides with the Lannisters. The Lannister forces quickly overwhelm Olenna Tyrell's (Diana Rigg) army. Jaime offers Olenna a quick and painless death by poison. Olenna says Cersei is a monster. After drinking it, she admits to poisoning Joffrey.']
plot outline: Jaime and Cersei welcome (later celebrate in bed) Euron Greyjoy's victory parade and appoint him admiral in reward for capturing chained Yara and the Dornish Sand Snakes, enabling Cersei to punish Ellaria, forced to watch in chains how her daughter dies from the same slow poison as her own daughter. Despite Tyrion's mediation, Jon gets a cold welcome from Daenerys, who gives chasing Cersei priority over stopping the Winter army and demands feudal homage from Jon to 'his queen' to become her warden of the North, yet Tyrion convinces her to allow the 'potential ally' to mine Dragonstone for dragon glass. Archmaester Ebrose releases cured Jorah, Sam only gets a congratulation and no formal punishment. The Unsullied land and successfully storm Lannister home Casterly Rock, using the secret tunnel Tyrion added to the sewage system for whoring purposes, but find the garrison tiny, while they are stranded as their ships are burnt and Jaime's army lays siege knowing supplies won't last, then marches on Tyrell castle, where Jaime regrets allowing Olenna a merciful poison death as she confesses plotting Joffrey's gruesome murder. Bran's arrival at Winterfell and seer status confuse Sansa.
plot: Jon and Daenerys finally meet. Cersei gains a new ally. Sansa receives an unexpected visitor. Sam is confronted for his actions. Jaime and Cersei welcome (later celebrate in bed) Euron Greyjoy's victory parade and appoint him admiral in reward for capturing chained Yara and the Dornish Sand Snakes, enabling Cersei to punish Ellaria, forced to watch in chains how her daughter dies from the same slow poison as her own daughter. Despite Tyrion's mediation, Jon gets a cold welcome from Daenerys, who gives chasing Cersei priority over stopping the Winter army and demands feudal homage from Jon to 'his queen' to become her warden of the North, yet Tyrion convinces her to allow the 'potential ally' to mine Dragonstone for dragon glass. Archmaester Ebrose releases cured Jorah, Sam only gets a congratulation and no formal punishment. The Unsullied land and successfully storm Lannister home Casterly Rock, using the secret tunnel Tyrion added to the sewage system for whoring purposes, but find the garrison tiny, while they are stranded as their ships are burnt and Jaime's army lays siege knowing supplies won't last, then marches on Tyrell castle, where Jaime regrets allowing Olenna a merciful poison death as she confesses plotting Joffrey's gruesome murder. Bran's arrival at Winterfell and seer status confuse Sansa.—KGF Vissers Jon arrives at Dragonstone. He refuses Daenerys' demands to bend the knee, and instead asks her help fighting the Army of the Dead. On Tyrion's advice, Daenerys allows Jon to mine the island's dragonglass. Melisandre avoids Jon and departs for Volantis, telling Varys she will return to Westeros. Bran, with Meera, arrives at Winterfell and reveals his new Three-Eyed Raven identity to Sansa. In King's Landing, Euron presents Ellaria and Tyene as gifts to Cersei, who promises him marriage after the war is won. She makes him commander of her navy. Cersei administers the same poison to Tyene that killed Myrcella; Ellaria will watch her daughter die and remain imprisoned with the body. A healed Jorah leaves Oldtown to find Daenerys. Ebrose praises Samwell's skill in saving Jorah then makes him copy old texts for his disobedience. Grey Worm and the Unsullied attack Casterly Rock but discover that Jaime has led the bulk of the Lannister forces to attack Highgarden, while Euron's fleet ambushes and destroys the Unsullied's ships. The Lannister forces quickly overwhelm Olenna Tyrell's army. Jaime offers Olenna a quick and painless death by poison. After drinking it, she reveals she poisoned Joffrey.

title: The Spoils of War
synopsis:
["Arya returns to Winterfell and is reunited with Sansa and Bran. Arya tells Sansa about all the people she is going to kill. They exchange their stories on each of them got back to Winterfell. Bran already knows about Arya, her list and her journey. Brienne is almost in tears that she completed her vow to Catelyn.
She later spars with Brienne (Gwendoline Christie), impressing her and unnerving Sansa with her exceptional fighting skills. Bran bids Meera an unemotional farewell as she prepares to head home (Meera gets upset at this bland goodbye since Hodor, Summer and Jojen all died to protect Bran), divulging he is no longer the boy she accompanied through the North.
Littlefinger presents Bran with the Valyrian steel dagger his would-be assassin used. Bran later gives it to Arya. Bran makes Petyr aware that he is aware of Petyr's every action and games that he has played in the past.Cersei assures the Iron Bank a full repayment of her debt as a wagon train carrying gold from Highgarden travels to King's Landing. Jaime also empties the granaries at Highgarden and orders it to be shifted to King's Landing. Cersei has made contact with the Golden Company in Essos. They specialize in recovering stolen or lost artifacts, amongst other things. The Iron Bank is interested in helping Cersei expand her armies and navies to take full control of the Seven Kingdoms.In a cave filled with dragon-glass (its virtually a whole mountain of dragon-glass, all that Jon and his army will ever need), Jon reveals ancient wall paintings to Daenerys depicting the First Men and the Children of the Forest joining forces against the un-dead. Daenerys says she will fight for the North, if Jon bends the knee.
Later, Daenerys learns that the attack on Casterly Rock was a diversion and Lannister forces have captured Highgarden. Daenerys is outraged and wants to attack the King's Landing with her dragons, but Jon talks her out of it as many innocent civilians will die. Ignoring Tyrion's protests (Daenerys is convinced that Tyrion is trying to protect his own family. Jon also says that if Daenerys uses her dragon to burn cities and castles, then she is no different.. she is more of the same), Daenerys rides Drogon as the Dothraki cavalry launches a surprise attack on the Lannister army, decimating it and capturing its remaining forces.
The gold from High garden makes it through to the King's Landing, but Drogon destroys all other food and supplies headed to the city. Tyrion watches on the sidelines as the Dothraki massacre the entire Lannister army.Theon returns to Dragonstone. Jon says the only reason he is not killing Theon is because of what he did for Sansa. Euron has Yara.Jaime leads a counterattack, but the normal weapons have no effect on Drogon's thick hide. So, Jaime orders Bronn to man the Scorpion Ballista weapon.
Drogon is wounded when Bronn (Jerome Flynn) fires a bolt from Qyburn's new scorpion Ballista weapon (Bronn misses the first shot, but hits Drogon on the next attempt), but he and Daenerys land safely (before landing Drogon destroys the Ballista weapon as Bronn gets away just in time). Jaime's desperate charge on horseback at a vulnerable Daenerys (she was busy taking out the spear from Drogon's body) is thwarted by Drogon spewing fire. Bronn tackles Jaime into the lake, saving him."]
plot outline: Daenerys seeks advice from Jon and Tyrion to win the war. Theon returns to Dragonstone asking his queen for help rescuing his sister. Jaime faces an unexpected encounter while transporting the Red Keep's gold. Arya returns home to Winterfell.
plot: Daenerys takes matters into her own hands. Arya reaches her destination. Jaime and Bronn collect the spoils from the war with the Tyrells. Daenerys seeks advice from Jon and Tyrion to win the war. Theon returns to Dragonstone asking his queen for help rescuing his sister. Jaime faces an unexpected encounter while transporting the Red Keep's gold. Arya returns home to Winterfell.—Krishang Kagzi Jon Snow gets closer to Daenerys and shows her his discovery in the dragonglass mine. Tyrion advises Daenerys and she asks Jon for his advice, and he tells her that she must be a fair queen and not attack and burn the houses of the common people. Meanwhile Arya returns to Winterfell and reunites with Sansa and Bran. Jaime's army and Bron are looting House Tyrell and their lands when they get a surprise.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Littlefinger hands to Bran the Valyrian steel dagger his would-be assassin used, which Bran gives to just-returned Arya. Bran tells homeward-bound, disappointed Meera he is ow Three Ravens, no longer Bran. Arya impressing sparring partner Brienne and Sansa with her fighting skills. Cersei promises the Iron Bank repayment of all Lannister's debt as a wagon train of gold from Highgarden travels to King's Landing. In a cave near castle Dragonstone, filled with dragonglass, which he is allowed to forge into weapons, Jon shows Daenerys ancient wall paintings where First Men and Children of the Forest jointly fight the undead. They learn the failed defense of Casterly Rock was a diversion while Jaime's Lannister army captures and loots Highgarden. Ignoring Tyrion, Daenerys rides Drogon as the Dothraki cavalry surprise attack decimates the Lannister army, capturing its remaining forces. Drogon is wounded by Bronn's bolt fired from Qyburn's new scorpion ballista, but lands Daenerys safely and his fire thwarts Jaime's desperate charge on horseback at a vulnerable Daenerys. Bronn tackles Jaime into a river to save him.—KGF Vissers Arya returns to Winterfell and is reunited with Sansa and Bran. Littlefinger presents Bran with the Valyrian steel dagger his would-be assassin used. Bran gives the dagger to Arya. Bran bids a homeward-bound Meera an unemotional farewell, explaining he is no longer Bran. Arya spars with Brienne, impressing her and amazing Sansa with her exceptional fighting skills. Cersei assures the Iron Bank full repayment of the Lannister's debt as a wagon train carrying gold from Highgarden travels to King's Landing. In a cave filled with dragonglass, Jon reveals ancient wall paintings to Daenerys depicting the First Men and the Children of the Forest joining forces against the undead. Daenerys learns that the attack on Casterly Rock was a diversion and Lannister forces have captured Highgarden. Ignoring Tyrion's protests, Daenerys rides Drogon as the Dothraki cavalry launches a surprise attack on the Lannister army, decimating it and capturing its remaining forces. Drogon is slightly wounded when Bronn fires a bolt from Qyburn's new scorpion ballista weapon, but he and Daenerys land safely. Jaime's desperate charge on horseback at a vulnerable Daenerys is thwarted by Drogon spewing fire. Bronn tackles Jaime into a river, saving him.

title: Eastwatch
synopsis:
["Jaime thought he had a chance to end the war with a single shot.
Jaime and Bronn return to King's Landing. Jamie is now really concerned of the consequences if Daenerys decides to attack King's Landing with all 3 of her dragons. King's Landing will not survive the assault. The Dothraki army will beat any army in the world and now the Lannisters don't have an army. He tries to convince Cersei that Tyrion had nothing to do with Joffrey's death (he tells her that Olenna confessed before she died), but she is adamant and wont make any peace.Daenerys offers the Lannister army survivors the choice to pledge fealty to her or die. She tells the troops that she is in the Seven KIngdoms to rule, and not murder everyone. She wants to destroy the wheel of rich and poor, which benefits only Cersei. Against Tyrion's advice, she has Drogon burn Randyll and Dickon Tarly (Randyll says at least Cersei was born in Westeros and lived there all her life.. Daenerys has no ties to the land), who refused to bend the knee. Tyrion wanted to put them in a cell, to give them time to reconsider, but Daenerys is also adamant that she meant what she said.Daenerys returns to Dragonstone and Jon makes a bond with Drogon when they both touch each other
Jorah arrives at Dragonstone and reunites with Daenerys. Maester Wolkan (Richard Rycroft) alerts Jon and the Citadel about the wights approaching Eastwatch (Bran has a vision that the dead army is approaching the castle at the end of the Wall where the wall meets the sea) (the army of the dead is endless). Bran asks Wolkan to send Raven's to all allies in the seven kingdoms. Tyrion and Varys are starting to have doubts about the brutality of Daenerys. Will she walk the same path as her father, the Mad King.
Jon gets the letter and proposes he travel beyond the Wall to capture a wight as proof they exist (Jorah decides to join Jon on his quest) and to convince Cersei to accept a temporary alliance. He wants Daenerys to position her army to face the White Walkers. But she is skeptical since if she moves her army, Cersei will take over all the vacated lands. So, Tyrion volunteers to travel to King's Landing to parley with Jamie. The plan it to present a wight to Cersei and convince her to fight together against the army of the dead.In Winterfell, the allies are pressurizing Sansa to accept the ruler-ship of the North, since Jon is not returning. Arya is angry with Sansa as she believes Sansa is hungry for power and what she really wants is to be the queen of the seven kingdoms.Davos (Liam Cunningham) smuggles Tyrion inside King's Landing, where he secretly meets with Jaime to propose an armistice. Cersei accepts it (as she knows that Daenerys has the advantage right now) and also informs Jaime she is pregnant. Davos rendezvous with Gendry (Joe Dempsie) (Robert Baratheon's bastard son, who was working in King's Landing) and returns him to Dragonstone. Gendry meets Jon at Dragonstone and decides to join his quest to find a wight.With the Citadel ignoring Wolkan's letter (the Citadel Maesters think the letter is a ploy from Daenerys to lure the Southern armies away, so she can conquest them easily) (They don't Sam yet that his father and brother have been burnt alive by Daenerys's dragon), Samwell steals several restricted books and leaves the Citadel with Gilly (Hannah Murray) and Little Sam.
While helping Sam with his work, Gilly discovers that in the past, one Maester conducted a marriage annulment ceremony for Prince Rhaegar, while marrying him off to another woman at the same time. Sam dismisses this news.At Winterfell, Littlefinger, knowing Arya is spying on him, lures her into finding the letter that Sansa was forced to write as a hostage in King's Landing (denouncing her family as traitors).
Jon, Jorah, and Gendry, joined by Sandor, Thoros, Beric (who were in Tormund's cell at the wall, as they were captured trying to go beyond the wall. They convince Jon that their purposes are the same and thus they need to join forces), and a group of the Free Folk led by Tormund (Kristofer Hivju), leave Eastwatch and pass beyond the Wall to capture a wight."]
plot outline: Bronn saves Jaime from the lake and he is surprised with the power of Daenerys' dragon. Daenerys offers the prisoners to bend their knees and join her army, or to die. Randyll and his son Dickon from the House of Tarly refuse to serve Deanerys and her dragon turns them into ashes. Arya confronts Sansa at Winterfell and suspects of Littlefinger. Samwell has a deception with the Maesters and decides to leave the Cidatel with Gilly and their child. Tyrion advises Daenerys and Jon Snow to bring a Wight to King's Landing to prove that the Army of the Dead and the White Walkers do exist. Jaime tries to convince Cersei that they do not have any chance fighting Daenerys and her three dragons, but she plots a scheme to destroy Daenerys. Then Jaime has a surprising encounter. Jon and a group head to the Wall and meet prisoners of he Night's Watch that accept to join them in their journey to capture a Wight.
plot: Daenerys demands loyalty from the surviving Lannister soldiers; Jon heeds Bran's warning about White Walkers on the move; Cersei vows to vanquish anyone or anything that stands in her way. Bronn saves Jaime from the lake and he is surprised with the power of Daenerys' dragon. Daenerys offers the prisoners to bend their knees and join her army, or to die. Randyll and his son Dickon from the House of Tarly refuse to serve Deanerys and her dragon turns them into ashes. Arya confronts Sansa at Winterfell and suspects of Littlefinger. Samwell has a deception with the Maesters and decides to leave the Cidatel with Gilly and their child. Tyrion advises Daenerys and Jon Snow to bring a Wight to King's Landing to prove that the Army of the Dead and the White Walkers do exist. Jaime tries to convince Cersei that they do not have any chance fighting Daenerys and her three dragons, but she plots a scheme to destroy Daenerys. Then Jaime has a surprising encounter. Jon and a group head to the Wall and meet prisoners of he Night's Watch that accept to join them in their journey to capture a Wight.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Jaime and Bronn must report the dragon's victory in King's Landing to Cersei. Daenerys spares those surviving Lannister soldiers who bend the knee, which all do after lord Randyll Tarly and his son, Dickon, refuse and against Tyrion's advice are executed on the spot by Drogon's dragon breath. Jorah is welcomed back by Daenerys at Dragonstone. Maester Wolkan alerts Jon and the Citadel about the wights approaching Eastwatch. Jon proposes prove their existence by capturing a wight beyond the Wall to convince Cersei to accept a temporary alliance, which fits Jaime's advice to negotiate. Davos smuggles and bribes past guards Tyrion inside King's Landing to secretly meet with Jaime to propose an armistice. Cersei agrees and informs Jaime, who instilled her their military position is hopeless, that she expects his child, now openly. In King's Landing, Davos finds Gendry and takes him back to Dragonstone, where he's accepted by Jon as Robert's bastard son. Frustrated as the Archmaester practically ignores his and Maester Wolkan's warnings about Winter approaching, Samwell leaves the Citadel with Gilly, Little Sam and restricted books with him. At Winterfell, Littlefinger, knowing Arya spies on him, lures her into finding the letter that Sansa had to write as a hostage in King's Landing to estrange the sisters. Jon, Jorah and Gendry take jail-liberated Clegane, Thoros, Beric, Tormund and his Free Folk from Eastwatch North beyond the Wall to capture a wight.—KGF Vissers Jaime and Bronn return to King's Landing. Daenerys offers the surviving Lannister soldiers the choice to bend the knee or death. Randyll Tarly and his son, Dickon, refuse her offer, and against Tyrion's advice, Daenerys has Drogon burn them to death. Jorah is reunited with Daenerys at Dragonstone. Maester Wolkan alerts Jon and the Citadel about the wights approaching Eastwatch. Jon proposes capturing a wight beyond the Wall to prove their existence and convince Cersei to accept a temporary alliance. Davos smuggles Tyrion inside King's Landing to secretly meet with Jaime to propose an armistice. Cersei accepts, and she also informs Jaime she is pregnant with their child. While in King's Landing, Davos finds Gendry and takes him back to Dragonstone. With the Citadel ignoring Maester Wolkan's warning letter, Samwell, frustrated, leaves the Citadel with Gilly and Little Sam, taking several restricted books with him. At Winterfell, Littlefinger, knowing Arya is spying on him, lures her into finding the letter that Sansa was forced to write as a hostage in King's Landing. Jon, Jorah, and Gendry take Clegane, Thoros, Beric, Tormund and a group of the Free Folk from Eastwatch North beyond the Wall to capture a wight.

title: Beyond the Wall
synopsis:
["At Winterfell, Littlefinger plots to isolate Sansa. Tensions between Arya and Sansa increase following Arya's discovery of the letter Sansa was forced to write, begging for Robb's fealty to Joffrey. Sansa, in turn, finds Arya's collection of faces she took from Braavos.At Dragonstone, Tyrion counsels Daenerys about the upcoming negotiations with Cersei. He knows Cersei will say something provocative and begs Daenerys not to act impulsively, as she did when she burnt Randyll and Dickon Tarly. Tyrion is also concerned that Daenerys does not have any succession plan for after she wears the crown and is not sure if she is building a sustainable vision for the future of the seven kingdoms. Daenerys wants Tyrion to focus on the short term and win the war against Cersei.Arya confronts Sansa with the letter and Sansa says she was forced to write it. Arya says that she was there when Joffrey executed Ned, and Sansa was dressed very pretty for the occasion. Arya says she would have died before betraying her family. Sansa counters that she took hits as well for the sake of the family, while Arya was off travelling the world. Arya feels Sansa is scared that the North Lords will read the letter.
Sansa confides to Petyr that Arya has her letter. She might expose the letter to the Lords if Arya believes that Sansa is betraying Jon.
Sansa gets an invitation from Cersei to join her at King's Landing for the all party negotiations. Sansa, sensing a trap, sends Brienne to represent her. Brienne is not happy to leave Sansa with Petyr.Beyond the Wall, the men have their differences. THoros had earlier sold Gendry to Melisandre. Jon doesn't want to bend the knee to Daenerys, but that's the only way she will fight against the army of the dead. Dondarrion has already been dead 6 times. Jon wants to return Joer's sword to Jorah. Joer had gifted the family sword to Jon, but Jon says it has been in the Mormont family for generations. Jorah says he brought shame upon his family and broke his father's heart. He wants Jon to keep the sword. Sandor hates wild-lings. Tormund misses Brienne and says he wants to make babies with her.
Sandor sees the Mountain shaped like a arrowhead, just like he saw in the fire. They are close. An un-dead bear attacks the group and its all of them to fight it off. Thoros is badly injured. He asks the group to leave him and move onJon and the men hunt for a wight to prove the White Walkers' existence. After capturing one (it was part of a small patrol who was detached from the main group. Jon kills one of the white walkers, and all the dead who were turned by him, just fell), the group is beset by the White Walker army who are approaching very fast. Jon sends Gendry to Eastwatch to dispatch a raven to Daenerys requesting help.
In the meanwhile Jon and his men get onto a small stone island in the middle of the frozen lake and the dead cant reach them as the ice breaks from their weight.During the night, an injured Thoros freezes to death (Jon burns his body). Dondarrion says that the Night King turned them all, so if he is killed, the army of the dead will cease to exist.
As the wight army is about to overwhelm Jon's group, Daenerys arrives with her dragons and rescues the men. The Night King (Vladimir Furdik), leader of the White Walkers, kills Viserion, one of Daenerys' dragons, with an ice spear. Daenerys flies off with the men, but is unable to save Jon. Benjen Stark (Joseph Mawle) intervenes and sacrifices himself (Benjen gives Jon his horse and stays back to give Jon time to escape to the pass) to save Jon.When Jon and Daenerys are reunited (Daenerys has now seen the army of the dead for herself and pledges herself to Jon's mission), Jon pledges himself and the North to Daenerys as Queen. The Night King reanimates Viserion, making the dragon a part of his army."]
plot outline: Jon and his band of men go beyond the wall in search of a Wight to capture and return to Kings Landing. Arya and Sansas relationship continues to derail with the help of LittleFinger. And Tyrion and Daenerys discuss the future of her reign.
plot: Jon and his team go beyond the wall to capture a wight. Daenerys has to make a tough decision. Jon and his band of men go beyond the wall in search of a Wight to capture and return to Kings Landing. Arya and Sansas relationship continues to derail with the help of LittleFinger. And Tyrion and Daenerys discuss the future of her reign.—duffmanbjk Jon and his team go north to capture a wight. Daenerys and Tyrion discuss love, planning for future and taking risks. Arya and Sansa learn a disturbing secret about each other's past. Jon faces off with the Night King and is aided by someone unexpected At Dragonstone, Tyrion counsels Daenerys how to negotiate with even haughtier Cersei. At Winterfell, Littlefinger's letter plot gets Arya to bitterly blame Sansa, who pleads force majeure and youth, for begging for Robb's fealty to Joffrey. Sansa finds Arya's faces from Braavos. Beyond the Wall, Jorah declines Jon's offer to returning his father's Valyrian sword, deeming himself less worthy. The hunting party captures a wight to prove the White Walkers' existence from the vanguard of the the White Walker army, but is surrounded on a frozen lake as the main body follows too fast to escape. Only the fiery swords enable fighting off the giant bear, incurring casualties. Jon sends fastest man Gendry on foot back to Eastwatch to dispatch a raven requesting for a dragon rescue. That night, injured Thoros freezes to death. Last minute, Daenerys arrives with her dragons, destroying many wights. The Night King, the White Walkers' leader, kills Daenerys' dragon Viserion with an ice spear, later resuscitates it as zombie in his army. Daenerys flies off with most survivors, but can't rescue Jon, whom Benjen Stark saves sacrificing himself. Grateful Jon pledges himself and the North to Queen Daenerys.—KGF Vissers At Winterfell, Littlefinger schemes to isolate Sansa. Tensions between Arya and Sansa increase after Arya discovers the letter Sansa was forced to write, begging for Robb's fealty to Joffrey. Sansa, in turn, finds Arya's collection of faces from Braavos. At Dragonstone, Tyrion counsels Daenerys about the upcoming negotiations with Cersei. Beyond the Wall, Jon and the men hunt for a wight to prove the White Walkers' existence. After capturing one, the group is beset by the White Walker army but not before Jon sends Gendry to Eastwatch to dispatch a raven to Daenerys requesting help. During the night, an injured Thoros freezes to death. As the wight army is about to overwhelm Jon's group, Daenerys arrives with her dragons, destroying many wights. The Night King, the White Walkers' leader, kills Viserion, one of Daenerys' dragons, with an ice spear. Daenerys flies off with the men, but is unable to rescue Jon. Benjen Stark intervenes and sacrifices himself to save Jon. When Jon and Daenerys are reunited, Jon pledges himself and the North to Daenerys as Queen. The Night King reanimates Viserion, making the dragon a part of his army.

title: The Dragon and the Wolf
synopsis:
["The Unsullied & Dothraki army reaches the King's Landing. The armies are formidable. Bronn and Jaime know that they are facing certain defeat. Theon, Tyrion, Sandor, Jon, Davos, Brienne and many others have traveled there. Daenerys flies in with her dragon. A million people stay in King's Landing. Cersei orders Gregor to kill Daenerys, Tyrion and Jon in that order, in case anything goes wrong during the discussions.Euron taunts Theon that he has Yara and will kill her if Theon doesn't surrender. Sandor confronts Gregor and promises to kill him before the war is over. Daenerys wants a truce till the army of the dead is dealt with. Cersei still believes that the army of the dead is a rumor.
At King's Landing, the wight is presented to the Lannisters and their supporters (Jon demonstrates that the wights can be killed by fire or by dragon-glass. Their army is at least 100,000 strong). Euron is so terrified that he decides to take his fleet back to the Iron Islands (the army of the dead cant swim)Cersei demands Jon's neutrality in the Great War, but he upholds his oath to Daenerys, provoking Cersei to end discussions. Tyrion meets privately with Cersei (who still blames Tyrion for killing Tywin, Myrcella, Tommen.. Tyrion says he loved the children whether Cersei cares of it or not), apparently gaining her alliance as she commits her armies to help fight the army of the dead, alongside Jon and Daenerys. Cersei later reveals to Jaime that she really intends to use the Golden Company of Braavos (a band of 20,000 mercenaries that she has hired with help of a loan from the Iron Bank. Euron had not left for the Iron Islands, he had gone to Essos to bring the Golden Company to the King's Landing) to secure her hold on Westeros. Disgusted, Jaime deserts her and rides north despite Cersei ordering him not to.Aboard a ship bound for White Harbor (the plan is that the Dothraki will ride to Winterfell and Jon & Daenerys (who are sailing together on a ship) will pick the Unsullied from White Harbor and join the Dothraki at a mid-point to ride into Winterfell together), Jon and Daenerys make love.
At Dragonstone, Theon earns his men's respect (by beating up a commander who insults Yara, the same men who rescued Theon from the sea) and leads them to rescue Yara from Euron.At Winterfell, Littlefinger sows dissent by exploiting Arya's threatening demeanor toward Sansa (Sansa confides in Petyr that Arya could want her dead as she wronged her family. She found the letter as proof of Sansa's betrayal. After Sansa is dead, Arya would become the Lady of Winterfell), leading to a trial. Sansa has also got word that Jon has bent the knee to Daenerys.
To his surprise, a united Sansa, Arya, and Bran accuse Littlefinger of murder, conspiracy, and treason, which Bran confirms with his visions. Sansa says that the whole issue between Starks and Lannisters started when Petyr got Lysa to poison Jon Arynn and got her to write a letter to Catelyn that it was the Lannisters who poisoned him. She then also says that He wanted a strife between Sansa and Arya, so he could profit from it. The Knife used to attack Bran belonged to Petyr and not anybody else.
Deserted by the Lords of the Vale, Littlefinger is sentenced to death by Sansa and executed by Arya.Samwell arrives at Winterfell and meets with Bran. They discuss Jon's parentage and through Sam's earlier research and Bran's visions, they extrapolate that Jon is a true-born Targaryen named Aegon, the legitimate heir to the Iron Throne. His parents - Rhaegar Targaryen (Wilf Scolding) and Lyanna Stark (Aisling Franciosi) - married in secret.
It also means that King Robert's rebellion was built on a lie. Rhaegar Targaryen neither raped nor killed Lyanna. He proper married her.At Eastwatch, the Night King, astride the un-dead Viserion, blasts a hole through the Wall with blue dragon fire, allowing the Army of the Dead to march through."]
plot outline: In King's Landing a grand meeting takes place. Theon makes amends and rescue plans. Sansa punishes those who wronged her family. Jaime confronts Cersei. The complete truth of Jon's lineage is revealed. The army of the dead reaches the Wall.
plot: Everyone meets in King's Landing to discuss the fate of the realm. In Winterfell, Sansa confronts Arya. Sam reaches Winterfell, where he and Bran discover a shocking secret about Jon Snow. In King's Landing a grand meeting takes place. Theon makes amends and rescue plans. Sansa punishes those who wronged her family. Jaime confronts Cersei. The complete truth of Jon's lineage is revealed. The army of the dead reaches the Wall. In King's Landing, Daenerys, Jon Snow and Cersei have a tense meeting where they show a wight to Cersei that does not accept the proposed armistice. However, Tyrion has a private encounter with her and she changes her position. At Winterfell, Sansa brings Arya to accomplish a death penalty for murder and treason. Then Samwell has a meeting with Bran and they discuss Jon Snow's lineage. At Eastwatch, the Night King riding his dragon and the White Walker army attack the Wall.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil The Lannister court formally receives John and Daenerys's delegation at the ancient arena where the old dragons withered. Thyrion's plea is coldly received by Cersei, until the Hound lets the undead out of the box and Jon demonstrates it can only by killed by fire or dragon-glass. An armistice to fight fight the greater common enemy is acceptable, but off the table when Jon refuses to revoke his oath to the dragon queen. Jaime gets Thyrion an audience to push their sister Cersei, daring to let the Mountain kill him, which seems to talk her over after spotting her pregnancy. Jon and Daenerys celebrate the outcome making love, but Cersei confides into Jaime she intends to reconquer the North after the rivals exhausted themselves.. Bran reveals to Sam that Jon was given in Ned's care as secret legitimate heir to the Iron throne, being born Aeon Targaryen. Theon dares his uncle Euron Greyjoy, who was boarding to flee back to the Islands, to duel and kills him, yet calls for loyalty to his missing sister. At Winterfell, schemer Petyr expected to assist at Arya's execution as traitor to Sansa, but has his own throat slit without due trail as the sister gang up accusing him constant plots and the murder of their aunt to become Lord of the Vale. Tormund Giantsbane's Nightwatch garrison shivers at the arrival of the Winter king, but worse, his zombie dragon's white fire simply melts the Wall down.—KGF Vissers The wight is presented to the Lannister court. Cersei demands Jon's neutrality, but she storms off when Jon upholds his oath to Daenerys. Tyrion meets with Cersei, apparently gaining her alliance. Cersei reveals to Jaime that she instead will use the Golden Company of Braavos to secure her hold on Westeros and allow the white walkers to destroy Daenerys and Jon's armies. Disgusted, Jaime rides north to warn Jon and Daenerys. At Dragonstone, Theon wins his men's respect and leads them to rescue Yara. Aboard a North-bound ship, Jon seeks out Daenerys, and they become lovers. At Winterfell, Littlefinger works to increase dissent between Arya and Sansa. Sansa, Arya, and Bran publicly accuse Littlefinger of murdering Jon and Lysa Arryn and of treason against their father. Deserted by the Lords of the Vale, Littlefinger is executed by Arya. Samwell arrives and meets with Bran. Combining Gilly's earlier information and Bran's vision, they realize Jon is Aegon Targaryen, the legitimate heir to the Iron Throne. Jon's parents, Rhaegar Targaryen and Lyanna Stark, secretly married. At Eastwatch, the Night King, astride the undead Viserion, blasts a hole through the Wall with blue dragon fire; the Army of the Dead marches through.

title: Winterfell
synopsis:
["Upon reaching Winterfell with their combined armies, Jon (Kit Harington) and Daenerys (Emilia Clarke) learn the Army of the Dead has breached the Wall, and the Night King (Vladimir Furdik) commands the un-dead Viserion. The Northern Houses and their allies rally around Winterfell, but distrust Daenerys and doubt Cersei's (Lena Headey) pledge to send troops.
Jon asks the Night's watch to evacuate their castles at the wall. They will make the last stand at Winterfell. The Lords of the North are angry with Jon for bending his knee to Daenerys. Tyrion defends that Jon has brought the world's strongest army and 2 full grown dragons to defend the North. He risked his life to show everyone that the threat of the Army of the DEad is real. Sansa is worried that Winterfell doesn't have enough provisions to feed armies of the Unsullied and the Dothraki. She doesn't even know what dragons eat.Gendry shapes weapons out of the dragon-glass brought to Winterfell from Dragonstone. he makes a dragon-glass Axe for Sandor. Arya asks Gendry to make a Dragonglass dagger for her. Sansa tells Tyrion that she doesn't believe that Cersei is sending her army North.
Davos proposed to Tyrion that if they survive the army of the dead, Jon and Daenerys could get married. This would ensure the loyalty of the North and The seven kingdoms would get just leaders.Euron (Pilou Asbæk) returns to King's Landing with the Golden Company and entices Cersei to consummate their union (he has given her justice, an army and an iron fleet). The Golden company has 20,000 men, 2000 horses, but no elephants. Harry captains the Golden Compass. Cersei wanted the elephants, but they are not good with sea voyages.
Cersei decides to sleep with Euron. On Cersei's orders, Qyburn (Anton Lesser) hires Bronn (Jerome Flynn) to assassinate Tyrion (Peter Dinklage) and Jaime (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau). She pays Bronn with a wagon full of Gold.
Yara is held captive of one of Euron's ships.Theon (Alfie Allen) leads his men to rescue Yara (Gemma Whelan). They then sets out to retake the Iron Islands, while Theon returns to Winterfell. Yara argues that if Jon & Daenerys cant hold the North, they will need a place to fall back on, and hence she decides to take Iron Islands back from Euron (as he is away in King's Landing).At Winterfell, Jon reunites with Bran (Isaac Hempstead Wright) and Arya (Maisie Williams). Arya is delighted to see Jon again (she still has the Needle, gifted to her by Jon). Tyrion and Varys also reach Winterfell. Jon is ecstatic to see Bran and Arya alive.
Jon later learns to ride Rhaegal. It is clear that Jon and Daenerys are in love with each other. Drogon sees them kissing.
Sam (John Bradley) meets Daenerys (who thanks Sam for saving Jorah's life), who states that she executed his father and brother. Sam reveals to Jon that he is actually named Aegon Targaryen by his mother. Ned was protecting Jon from Robert, as Robert would have killed him had he known. Ned had promised Lyanna to protect Aegon/Jon. He also tells Jon about how Daenerys executed Sam's father and brother.Some of the houses refuse to send their fighting men to Winterfell as they pledged their armies to the King in the North. Jon insists that without Daenerys, the North doesn't stand a chance. Sansa knows that Jon loves Daenerys.
At House Umber's seat of Last Hearth, Tormund (Kristofer Hivju) and Beric (Richard Dormer) encounter Edd (Ben Crompton) and other Night's Watch members. They find the castle's occupants dead, and the wight of Ned Umber (Harry Grasby) is left as a gruesome message.
Jaime arrives at Winterfell where Bran awaits him."]
plot outline: SPOILER: Jon and Daenerys have a cold reception in Winterfell. Jon meets his brother and sisters and rides the dragons with Daenerys. Then she discloses to Sam the fate of his father and brother. When Jon meets Sam, he discloses who his parents are. Euron Greyjoy meets Cersei to collect his recompense for joining to her army. Theon rescues his sister Yara and decides to go to Winterfell. Jaime arrives in Winterfell and sees Bran Stark.
plot: Jon and Daenerys arrive in Winterfell and are met with skepticism. Sam learns about the fate of his family. Cersei gives Euron the reward he aims for. Theon follows his heart. SPOILER: Jon and Daenerys have a cold reception in Winterfell. Jon meets his brother and sisters and rides the dragons with Daenerys. Then she discloses to Sam the fate of his father and brother. When Jon meets Sam, he discloses who his parents are. Euron Greyjoy meets Cersei to collect his recompense for joining to her army. Theon rescues his sister Yara and decides to go to Winterfell. Jaime arrives in Winterfell and sees Bran Stark.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Reaching Winterfell with their combined army and impressive dragons, Jon and Daenerys learn the Army of the Dead breached the Wall and the Night King commands the undead Viserion. The Northern Houses and their allies rally around Winterfell but distrust Daenerys, scold Jon for ceding her his crown and duly doubt Cersei's pledge to send troops. Euron returns to King's Landing with the mercenary Golden Company, smaller then hoped and without elephants, and entices Cersei to consummate their union. Cersei, through Qyburn, hires Bronn to assassinate Tyrion and Jaime if they don't fall on the field. Theon rescues chained 'queen' Yara, who sets out to retake the Iron Islands, telling Theon to return at Winterfell to Jon, who welcomes him warmly, like Arya, only Sansa remains an icy skeptic. Jon and Daenerys ride the dragons, deepening their bond. Daenerys wants to reward Sam for saving Jorah then realizes that she executed his father and brother. Sam tells Jon he is actually the Iron Throne heir, born Aegon Targaryen. Sent to help evacuate House Umber's seat Last Hearth, Tormund and Beric encounter Edd's now superfluous Night's Watch garrison but find the castle's occupants dead, and the wight of Ned Umber is left as a gruesome message. Jaime arrives at Winterfell, where Bran awaits him..—KGF Vissers Upon reaching Winterfell with their combined armies, Jon and Daenerys learn the Army of the Dead has breached the Wall and the Night King commands the undead Viserion. The Northern Houses and the Vale rally around Winterfell but distrust Daenerys and doubt Cersei's pledge to send troops. Euron returns to King's Landing with the Golden Company and entices Cersei to consummate their union. Cersei, through Qyburn, hires Bronn to assassinate Tyrion and Jaime. Theon rescues Yara, who then sets out to retake the Iron Islands, while Theon returns to Winterfell. There, Jon is reunited with Arya. Jon and Daenerys ride the dragons and deepen their bond. Daenerys wants to reward Sam for saving Jorah before realizing that she executed his father and brother. Sam tells Jon that he was born Aegon Targaryen and is the true heir to the Iron Throne. At House Umber, Tormund and Beric encounter Edd and other Night's Watch members. The castle's occupants dead, and the wight of Ned Umber is left as a gruesome message. Jaime arrives at Winterfell where Bran awaits him.

title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
synopsis:
["Jaime reveals Cersei's deception to the Targaryen-Stark alliance (that she never intended to send her army to the North and now has 20,000 fresh men from the Golden Company is Essos to take on whoever is left after the war in the North is over) and joins them after Brienne vouches for his loyalty (she says Jaime protected Brienne from Locke and his rapers. he armed her and sent her to find Sansa and Arya, as he had made a promise to Catelyn). Daenerys thinks this is yet another plot by Cersei, to execute her through Jaime. Tyrion vouches for Jaime, but Daenerys dismisses him.
Jaime later apologizes to Bran for crippling him; Bran replies he harbors no anger and says they are no longer the same people. Bran wants Jaime to fight for the Army of the Living.Jon gets Gendry (Joe Dempsie) to work the dragon-glass and outfit the entire army with weapons forged from dragon-glass. All the able men and women in Winterfell are drafted as soldiers to fight the army of the dead.
Tyrion tells Jaime that Daenerys is different and she is right person to rule the Seven Kingdoms.Tyrion loses Daenerys' trust for having believed Cersei, prompting Jorah to ask her to forgive Tyrion's mistakes. Jorah also urges her to speak to Sansa directly.
Citing their mutual love for Jon, Daenerys tries and fails to gain Sansa's trust after refusing to give assurances about the North's fate (Sansa wants The North to be independent of the Seven Kingdoms). Sansa feels men are easily manipulated by women they love and Jon loves Daenerys. Daenerys counters that she is the one in the North, fighting his war with her armies and her dragons. Sounds like JOn manipulated Daenerys.Theon, Edd, Tormund, and Beric arrive at Winterfell, with the latter three reporting the un-dead army's impending arrival (they will arrive before sunrise of the following day). Sansa welcomes Theon back with a hug.
Jon knows that they cant defeat the Army of the Dead in a straight fight. If they kill the Night King the entire army of the dead falls as he raised each and every one of them.
Bran proposes that he lure out the Night King, who wants to destroy the Three-Eyed Raven. The Night King wants an endless night. He wants to erase this world and the Three Eyed Raven is its memory. The Night King has his mark on Bran and this he knows where Bran is at all times.
The others agree, with Theon and the Ironborn offering Bran protection. They don't know if dragon-fire will stop the Night King.Arya seduces Gendry & has sex him on the night before the attack of the army of the dead. Arya knows that they might not survive the night. She wants to experience sex before she dies.
Jaime formally anoints Brienne (Gwendoline Christie) as a knight (any Knight can anoint a new Knight), and asks for permission to fight under her command. She is commanding the left flank.Jorah fails to dissuade Lyanna Mormont (Iain Glen) from fighting, and he receives House Tarly's ancestral sword as a gift from Sam. The warriors gather for a last drink before the enemy arrives.
As the Army of the Dead approaches, Jon reveals his Targaryen lineage to Daenerys."]
plot outline: Jaime is faced by his past mistakes. Tyrion's decisions are seen with doubt. The Battle of Winterfell is discussed tactically. Sansa and Danaerys discuss the future. The remaining Night's Watch are reunited. Everyone prepares emotionally with thoughts of their fate.
plot: Jaime faces judgment and Winterfell prepares for the battle to come. Jaime is faced by his past mistakes. Tyrion's decisions are seen with doubt. The Battle of Winterfell is discussed tactically. Sansa and Danaerys discuss the future. The remaining Night's Watch are reunited. Everyone prepares emotionally with thoughts of their fate.—eduardo-carbonella Jaime Lannister stands before Daenerys, Jon and Sansa in the main hall of Winterfell. While deciding his fate, his prior actions speak other wise. The rest goes on with everyone catching up to what they've experienced over the past few years. But the battle is nearly here. Proudly, calmly braving the Stark court, Jaime reveals Cersei's jealous treason to to the Targaryen-Stark alliance, having hired the Golden Company, joins them as able general after Brienne vouches for his honor and apologizes for crippling Bran, who replies he harbors no anger and says they are no longer the same people, the fateful past shapes all. Daenerys doubts Tyrion's Hand capacities for his having believed Cersei, but Jorah intercedes on his behalf. Citing their mutual love for Jon, Daenerys tries to gain Sansa's trust, but Sansa says the North no longer bows to outsiders. Theon, Edd, Tormund and Beric arrive at Winterfell, the latter three reporting the Undead army's impending arrival. Bran volunteers he lure out the Night King, who intends to destroy the Three-Eyed Raven, Theon protect Bran with the Ironborn troops. Arya gets a dragon-glass weapon and intimately questions and seduces Gendry, wanting not to die as virgins. Jaime knights Brienne during the long, cold, fearful night of wait with drinks and stories. Sam presents Jorah with House Tarly's ancestral sword. As the Army of the Dead approaches, Jon reveals his true lineage to Daenerys, who realizes her lover's higher claim to the Iron Throne but tells no-one.—KGF Vissers Jaime reveals Cersei's deception to the Targaryen-Stark alliance and joins them after Brienne vouches for his honor. Jaime apologizes to Bran for crippling him; Bran replies he harbors no anger and says they are no longer the same people. Daenerys no longer trusts Tyrion's judgment for his having believed Cersei, but Jorah asks that she forgive Tyrion's mistakes. Citing their mutual love for Jon, Daenerys tries to gain Sansa's trust, but Sansa says the North vowed never to bow to anyone again. Theon, Edd, Tormund, and Beric arrive at Winterfell, with the latter three reporting the undead army's impending arrival. Bran proposes he lure out the Night King, who intends to destroy the Three-Eyed Raven. Theon and the Ironborn will protect Bran. Arya seduces Gendry, wanting to experience sex before they die. Jaime formally anoints Brienne as a knight. Jorah fails to dissuade Lyanna Mormont from fighting, and Sam presents Jorah with House Tarly's ancestral sword. As the Army of the Dead approaches, Jon reveals his true lineage to Daenerys, who recognizes his claim to the Iron Throne.

title: The Long Night
synopsis:
["The plan goes into motion. Brandon moves himself into the park near the castle (Godswood), protected by Theon and the Ironborn. Daenerys and Jon watch from the side as the battle unfolds.
Missandei comes to Winterfell and Davos lets her in. She promises Davos that there is no need to execute her as she will be dead before the dawn. She provides to power of fire to all Dothraki swords.The Living Army meets the Army of the Dead outside Winterfell. The initial Dothraki charge is decimated (Their fires are extinguished and only some horse return to Winterfell), and the Unsullied are quickly overwhelmed. Only the dragons prevent the Unsullied lines from being completely overrun as they continue to burn their way into the back lines of the enemy army.
It is a gruesome battle by any standards as the wights don't tire and just keep on coming.
Jon and Daenerys engage the Night King on their dragons. But the Night King invokes a fearsome storm which renders the entire night dense with snow and ice and impossible to see anything.Edd is killed while saving Sam. The survivors retreat into the castle (ordered by Brienne). The last line of the Unsullied protect the retreat. The Unsullied want Davos to give the signal to Daenrys to light the trench with dragon-fire. But she cant see anything due to the storm. Daenerys fails to see Davos's signal. All the fire arrows shot at the trenches fail to ignite it.
Melisandre (Carice van Houten) ignites the defensive fire trench surrounding Winterfell to delay the advancing horde. Sandor and Tormund defend the gate of Winterfell as the armies retreat inside the castle. The wights wait for the fires of the trench to burn out before advancing on Winterfell castle. It is only a matter of time now.
ON The Night King's command, the dead fall on top of the fire to create a bridge for the others to pass.Arya sends Sansa down into the crypt for her safety. Tyrion was already ordered into the crypt by Daenerys.
The wights invade Winterfell, overpowering the defenders and killing Lyanna Mormont (Bella Ramsey) (who dies while killing a giant who had wrecked havoc inside the castle). The fight moves to inside the castle and to its dark alleyways and cabins.
Beric dies defending Arya (Melisandre says this was the reason that the Lord of the Light brought Beric back from the dead 6 times). Jon and Rhaegal knock the Night King off Viserion, and Daenerys burns him with dragon-fire but it has no effect.The Night King then raises slain Winterfell defenders, including the dead entombed in the crypt where the non-combatants are attacked. After wights pull Daenerys from Drogon, Jorah is fatally wounded defending her. The wights literally fall on top of each other storming the walls of winterfell. The living are buried under the sheer weight of the dead. The end seems near and the situation is all but hopeless. Jon goes around in a daze, trying to reach Bran. He is now the only remaining hope. The un-dead dragon blocks Jon's path and wont allow him to proceed.
The Night King arrives at the Godswood for Bran and kills Theon. The Night King reaches Bran.Arya ambushes the Night King (she lunges at the Night King from a hidden position, but the Night King grabs her by the neck before she can hit him), stabbing him with her Valyrian steel dagger (Arya uses a deception technique to transfer the dagger from one hand to the other and then stabs the Night King). The Night King and his White Walkers shatter, causing Viserion and the wights to collapse. Her purpose served, Melisandre allows herself to die from old age. Jorah dies in Daenerys's arms."]
plot outline: The allied living meet the vast Army of the Dead outside Winterfell. Despite swords ignited by the Red Witch, the initial Dothraki charge is decimated, and the Unsullied are quickly overwhelmed, despite the dragon-fire assist. Edd is killed saving Sam. Survivors retreat into the castle. Melisandre ignites last-minute the fire trench surrounding Winterfell to delay the advancing horde. Jon and Daenerys aerially engage the Night King, all three riding dragons. The wights fill the fire moat with corpses to invade Winterfell, storming at great effort the walls, then easily overpowering line after hideout of defenders. Jon and Rhaegal knock the Night King off Viserion, and Daenerys and Drogon burn him with dragon-fire in vain, the Night King raises the slain Winterfell defenders, including the dead entombed in the crypt, which attack the sheltered non-combatants. Wights pull Daenerys from Drogon, and Jorah is fatally wounded defending her. The Night King arrives at the Godswood and kills Theon, but just as he reaches Bran, Arya from ambush fatally stabs him with her Valyrian steel dagger. The Night King and his White Walkers shatter, creatures Viserion and all wights collapse. Her purpose served, Melisandre dies of old age.
plot: The Night King and his army have arrived at Winterfell and the great battle begins. The allied living meet the vast Army of the Dead outside Winterfell. Despite swords ignited by the Red Witch, the initial Dothraki charge is decimated, and the Unsullied are quickly overwhelmed, despite the dragon-fire assist. Edd is killed saving Sam. Survivors retreat into the castle. Melisandre ignites last-minute the fire trench surrounding Winterfell to delay the advancing horde. Jon and Daenerys aerially engage the Night King, all three riding dragons. The wights fill the fire moat with corpses to invade Winterfell, storming at great effort the walls, then easily overpowering line after hideout of defenders. Jon and Rhaegal knock the Night King off Viserion, and Daenerys and Drogon burn him with dragon-fire in vain, the Night King raises the slain Winterfell defenders, including the dead entombed in the crypt, which attack the sheltered non-combatants. Wights pull Daenerys from Drogon, and Jorah is fatally wounded defending her. The Night King arrives at the Godswood and kills Theon, but just as he reaches Bran, Arya from ambush fatally stabs him with her Valyrian steel dagger. The Night King and his White Walkers shatter, creatures Viserion and all wights collapse. Her purpose served, Melisandre dies of old age.—KGF Vissers The living meet the Army of the Dead outside Winterfell. The initial Dothraki charge is destroyed and the Unsullied are quickly overwhelmed, despite the dragonfire. Edd is killed saving Sam and survivors retreat into the castle. Melisandre ignites the fire trench surrounding Winterfell to delay the advancing horde. Jon and Daenerys aerially engage the Night King on their dragons. The wights invade Winterfell, overpowering the defenders; Lyanna Mormont is killed destroying a giant wight; Beric dies defending Arya, and Melisandre tells Arya what she must do. Jon and Rhaegal knock the Night King off Viserion, and Daenerys and Drogon burn him with dragonfire without any effect. The Night King raises the slain Winterfell soldiers and the dead entombed in the Stark family crypt, who attack those sheltered there. Wights pull Daenerys from Drogon and Jorah is fatally wounded defending her. The Night King kills Theon as he protects Bran. Arya ambushes and stabs the Night King with her Valyrian steel dagger shattering him and his White Walkers and Viserion and all wights. Her purpose served; Melisandre allows herself to die of old age.

title: The Last of the Starks
synopsis:
['The survivors mourn and burn the dead. Sansa mourns Theon, Daenerys mourns Jorah. Daenerys legitimizes Gendry as a Baratheon, naming him Lord of Storm's End. Arya declines Gendry's subsequent marriage proposal. Arya says that she is not a lady and a domestic life is not what she is looking for. She still has names on her list that she needs to kill.
during drinking Jaime learns Brienne is a virgin still. Brienne is upset and goes back to her cabin. Jaime follows her. Jaime and Brienne become lovers.
To protect her claim to the throne, Daenerys wants Jon to conceal his true parentage (she had seen how the men revered his bravery on the battlefield and knows that if they know his ancestry, they will not hesitate to crown him as the King of the seven kingdoms). Jon is the true blood of Rhaegar Targaryen. Thus his claim on the Iron Throne is higher than that of Daenerys to begin with. She knows that even Sansa would want to see Jon on the Iron Throne instead of her.Now the attention turns towards King's Landing. Half the Unsullied are dead. Cersei has the 20,000 soldiers from Golden compass. The balance is now even.
Daenerys wants to attack with her dragons, but Tyrions wants to kill Cersei without destroying the city. Daenerys is a little angry with Tyrion for that. Jon proposes a long siege and to cut off the supply routes so that the people of the city rebel against Cersei. They want the people to see that Cersei is their only enemy.Bronn arrives to kill Jaime and Tyrion for Cersei, but spares them in exchange for being promised Highgarden castle.
Jon reveals his Targaryen claim to Sansa (Sophie Turner) and Arya, swearing them to secrecy. Wanting Jon as king, Sansa tells Tyrion, who informs Varys. Sansa really dislikes the idea of handing over power to Daenerys and then serving as her vassal state for all eternity. She tells Tyrion that Daenerys will never be the "just" queen that they all hope she will be.Arya and Sandor the Hound head for King's Landing, bent on revenge against Cersei. Gilly is preggers with Sam's baby. She wants to name the baby "Jon" if its a boy.
Tormund returns north with the Wildlings, taking Ghost at Jon's request. Daenerys and her fleet set sail for King's Landing, while Jon leads the Northern army. Varys and Tyrion argue that Jon doesn't want the throne. He cant marry Daenerys as she is his aunt. Varys worries about Daenerys's state of mind.At Dragonstone, Euron's navy ambushes her fleet, killing Rhaegal with ship-mounted scorpions. Daenerys wants to destroy Euron right there, but backs off as she knows she will loose Drogon too. Euron then targets Daenerys's fleet, destroying many ships. Missandei is taken hostage. Cersei moves the entire population of KIng's Landing to inside the castle.
Daenerys considers seizing King's Landing using dragon-fire from Drogon. Varys pleads that doing so will result in the death of thousands of innocent people and hence this option should not be considered.
Tyrion wants Daenerys to give Cersei a chance to surrender. Make an effort to avoid the bloodshed.Varys (Conleth Hill) and Tyrion debate whether Jon would be a better ruler than Daenerys. Varys starts to root for Jon as he knows a boy from a Targaryen father and a Stark mother might finally be able to keep the North within the seven kingdoms. Tyrion still roots for Daenerys and believes that she will make the right choice. Varys tells Tyrion that Daenerys has to die for Jon to assume his rightful place on the throne. Varys says the innocent people of the seven kingdom also have a right to life and happiness and he will continue to fight for that right.
Jaime feels compelled to return to Cersei, despite Brienne's plea that he stay (she knows that Jamie will die if he goes back to defend Cersei against the coming onslaught).Cersei defiantly refuses Daenerys' demand to surrender and has Missandei (Nathalie Emmanuel) beheaded before an enraged Daenerys and Grey Worm (Jacob Anderson). Before dying Missandei uses the fire word for dragons, indicating to Daenerys that she wanted King's Landing burnt to the ground.']
plot outline: After the funeral for the dead, there is a feast at Winterfell. Gendry is recognized as a Baratheon and asks Arya to marry him. Brienne and Jaime have a love affair. Daenerys asks Jon to keep his roots secret, but he decides to tell Sansa and Arya. Daenerys, her dragons, and her fleet are ambushed by Euron's fleet and are defeated; Missandei is taken captive. Daenerys decides to go to King's Landing to ask Cersei to surrender, but Cersei makes a tragic decision.
plot: The Battle of Winterfell is over and a new chapter for Westeros begins. After the funeral for the dead, there is a feast at Winterfell. Gendry is recognized as a Baratheon and asks Arya to marry him. Brienne and Jaime have a love affair. Daenerys asks Jon to keep his roots secret, but he decides to tell Sansa and Arya. Daenerys, her dragons, and her fleet are ambushed by Euron's fleet and are defeated; Missandei is taken captive. Daenerys decides to go to King's Landing to ask Cersei to surrender, but Cersei makes a tragic decision.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil The survivors mourn fallen heroes and burn piles of dead, then celebrate their victory. Daenerys legitimizes Gendry as a Baratheon, naming him Lord of Storm's End, yet Arya declines Gendry's subsequent marriage proposal. Stark heir Bran declines becoming Lord of Winterfell. Cersei's hired killer Bronn 'spares' Jaime and Tyrion in exchange for being promised Highgarden castle. To Thormund's envy, Jaime and Brienne become lovers, yet he returns to his pregnant Cersei. Daenerys asks Jon to conceal his true parentage to protect her claim to the throne, yet Jon reveals his true parentage to Sansa and Arya, swearing them to secrecy, but Sansa tells Tyrion, who informs Varys, both pondering which pretender would rule best. Arya and the Hound head for King's Landing, bent on revenge. The Wildlings return north , taking Ghost at Jon's request. Daenerys's fleet sails for King's Landing, but at Dragonstone, Euron's navy ambushes them, killing dragon Rhaegal with ship-mounted ballistas. Daenerys considers seizing King's Landing using dragon-fire. Jon leads the Northern army. Jaime leaves to return to Cersei, despite Brienne's pleas to stay. Cersei refuses Daenerys' demand to surrender, and has captive Missandei beheaded, enraging Daenerys and Grey Worm.—KGF Vissers The survivors mourn, burn the dead, and then celebrate their victory. During the somber feast, Daenerys uplifts the mood by legitimizing Gendry as a Baratheon, naming him Lord of Storm's End. Arya gently declines Gendry's subsequent marriage proposal while Jaime and Brienne become lovers. To protect her claim to the throne, Daenerys asks Jon to conceal his true parentage. Bronn arrives and threatens Jaime and Tyrion but spares them in exchange for being promised Highgarden castle. Jon reveals his true parentage to Sansa, Bran, and Arya, swearing them to secrecy. Wanting Jon as king, Sansa tells Tyrion, who informs Varys. Arya and the Hound head for King's Landing, separately bent on revenge. Tormund returns north with the Wildlings, taking Ghost at Jon's request. Daenerys and her fleet set sail for King's Landing, while Jon leads the Northern army. At Dragonstone, Euron's navy ambushes Daenerys' fleet, killing Rhaegal with ship-mounted ballistas. Missandei is taken hostage and Daenerys considers seizing King's Landing using dragonfire. Varys and Tyrion debate whether Jon would be a better ruler than Daenerys. Jaime leaves Winterfell to return to Cersei, despite Brienne's pleas to stay. Cersei rejects Daenerys' demand to surrender and has Missandei beheaded before an enraged Daenerys and Grey Worm.
