title: The Bells
synopsis:
["Varys urges Jon to advance his claim, but the latter refuses to betray Daenerys. Varys is afraid that Daenerys will go mad like her father, who was a brutal ruler and caused the death of millions. While he is very certain that Jon will be a wise and just rule, who brings the seven kingdoms together. Jon re-iterates that he does not want to be King.
After Tyrion reveals Varys' plot (Tyrion admits he made a mistake by telling Varys.. He says their intentions were the same as Daenerys, a better world for everyone), Daenerys executes Varys by dragon fire. Before being killed, Tyrion tells Varys that it was he who informed Daenerys about Varys's plot. Varys hopes he deserves his punishment and is wrong about Daenerys.Daenerys confronts Jon about informing Sansa and says that he blew the only chance he had to have lasting peace with the Starks. Daenerys says that Varys's death is a victory for Sansa as now the news will only spread about Jon being the true Targaryen. People in Westeros love Jon and fear Daenerys. Jon insists that Daenerys is his queen.
Despite Tyrion's protests, Daenerys orders the attack on King's Landing. Daenerys tells Tyrion that Cersei thinks her enemies mercy is their weakness and Daenerys will not let that happen. Tyrion still pleads to call off the attack if the city rings the bells to surrender. Daenerys tells Tyrion that Jaime had left Winterfell to join Cersei. She warns Tyrion that the next time he fails her would be his last.
Daenerys has captured Jaime has him under custody. But Tyrion releases him so he can persuade Cersei to surrender the city, then escape Westeros together to Penthos. Jaime is convinced that Cersei believes she has the upper hand. 2 of the 3 dragons are dead. The enemy army is substantially depleted. She has the Golden Compass. Tyrion tells Jaime to ring the city bells to signal the surrender of the city. Jaime understands that TYrion is willing to put his own life at risk to save the million innocent at King's Landing.
Jaime, Arya, and the Hound each infiltrate King's Landing, before Daenerys launches her attackDragon-borne Daenerys destroys the Iron Fleet (she skilfully avoids all the Ballista shots and destroys them first) and most of the city's defenses, allowing her army to enter. Cersei's forces are quickly overwhelmed and the city signals its surrender by ringing its bells, but an enraged Daenerys begins leveling the city, burning soldiers and civilians. Even Grey Worm starts killing the soldiers who had surrendered as this was his way of avenging Missandei. This convinces Jon and Tyrion that Daenerys has indeed gone mad.Sandor The allied army follows her lead, slaughtering anyone in their path, horrifying Tyrion and Jon. Jaime tries to enter the city from a secret passage carved into the rocks at the side of the beaches. He finds Euron, who had survived the destruction on his fleet and ended up on the beach. Euron claims he slept with Cersei. Jaime kills Euron but is himself mortally wounded.The Hound (Rory McCann) convinces Arya to abandon her longtime vendetta and save herself, then confronts Gregor the Mountain (Hafþór Júlíus Björnsson). The brothers ultimately perish after falling from a tower into flames. The flames from Drogon ignite the stocks of wildfire all over the city, and now they start exploding causing further havoc on the city.
Cersei and Jaime reunite but are killed as the Red Keep collapses atop them (their exit path from the castle has been blocked due to the falling debris). Jon calls for a retreat as frantic civilians flee the devastation. Arya barely survives."]
plot outline: Jon refuses to 'betray his queen' by rightfully claiming the throne Varys urges Jon would be a better ruler, but after Tyrion reveals Varys' plot, Daenerys executes Varys by dragon fire. Jaime was captured, but Tyrion releases him to try persuading Cersei to surrender the city and escape Westeros together. Drogon destroys the Iron Fleet and most of the city's defenses, allowing Daenerys's army to enter. Cersei deludes herself the Red Keep never falls, but the Westeros forces and Golden Company are quickly overwhelmed. The city signals its surrender by a bells signal Tyrion proposed, but an enraged Daenerys ignores it, leveling the city, burning all. Despite Jon's pacifying efforts, the allied army follows her lead under Grey Worm, slaughtering soldiers and civilians in their path, horrifying Tyrion and Davos as badly. Jaime kills Euron who dared him to a duel but is himself mortally wounded. The Hound convinces Arya to abandon her longtime vendetta against Cersei and save herself; then he confronts his brother the Mountain, who disregards Cersei's orders to help her escape for the fraternal battle to the death, ultimately by falling from a tower into flames. Cersei and Jaime reunite but are killed as the Red Keep collapses on them. Jon calls for a retreat as frantic civilians flee the devastated capital.
plot: Forces have arrived at King's Landing for the final battle. Jon refuses to 'betray his queen' by rightfully claiming the throne Varys urges Jon would be a better ruler, but after Tyrion reveals Varys' plot, Daenerys executes Varys by dragon fire. Jaime was captured, but Tyrion releases him to try persuading Cersei to surrender the city and escape Westeros together. Drogon destroys the Iron Fleet and most of the city's defenses, allowing Daenerys's army to enter. Cersei deludes herself the Red Keep never falls, but the Westeros forces and Golden Company are quickly overwhelmed. The city signals its surrender by a bells signal Tyrion proposed, but an enraged Daenerys ignores it, leveling the city, burning all. Despite Jon's pacifying efforts, the allied army follows her lead under Grey Worm, slaughtering soldiers and civilians in their path, horrifying Tyrion and Davos as badly. Jaime kills Euron who dared him to a duel but is himself mortally wounded. The Hound convinces Arya to abandon her longtime vendetta against Cersei and save herself; then he confronts his brother the Mountain, who disregards Cersei's orders to help her escape for the fraternal battle to the death, ultimately by falling from a tower into flames. Cersei and Jaime reunite but are killed as the Red Keep collapses on them. Jon calls for a retreat as frantic civilians flee the devastated capital.—KGF Vissers Varys urges Jon to advance his claim to the throne but Jon refuses to betray Daenerys. After Tyrion reveals Varys' plot, Daenerys executes Varys by dragon-fire. Jaime is captured but Tyrion releases him so Jaime can persuade Cersei to surrender the city and then escape Westeros together. Jaime, Arya and the Hound each infiltrate King's Landing. Riding Drogon, Daenerys destroys the Iron Fleet and most of the city's defenses, allowing her army to enter. Cersei's forces are quickly overwhelmed and the city signals its surrender. Giving in to rage and insanity, Daenerys levels the entire city, burning soldiers and civilians. The allied army follows her lead, slaughtering anyone in their path, horrifying Tyrion and Jon. Jaime kills Euron but is mortally wounded. The Hound convinces Arya to abandon her vendetta against Cersei and save herself; then he confronts the Mountain. The brothers, battling each other, ultimately perish after falling from a tower into flames. Cersei and Jaime reunite but are killed as the Red Keep collapses on them. Jon calls for a retreat as frantic civilians flee the devastation. Arya barely escapes alive.

title: The Iron Throne
synopsis:
["Following the battle, the Unsullied execute captured soldiers upon Daenerys' orders. Grey Worm over-rules Jons objections to execute the captured soldiers. He is determined to avenge Missandei's death. Daenerys has ordered to kill everyone who follows Cersei Lannister. Davos asks Jon to step back and talk to Daenerys directly.
Tyrion finds Jaime and Cersei dead in the ruins (they were trying to find their exit from the castle when the red keep collapsed on top of them). Daenerys rallies the Unsullied and Dothraki, declaring she will lead them to liberate the entire world. She names Grey Worm as the commander of all her forcesTyrion denounces her for slaughtering an entire city and resigns as Hand, then is imprisoned for treason to await execution. Arya and Tyrion separately warn Jon that Daenerys is a threat to him and House Stark. Arya maintains that Sansa will never accept Daenerys as her queen. Arya also says that Daenerys will never rest easy till Jon is not out of her way. Jon has the bigger claim on the throne. Arya calls her a killer.
Tyrion tells Jon that Varys was right. She is not done fighting and the fate of King's Landing awaits every city in the Seven Kingdoms, who doesn't bend to her will. She believes she is good and right and will kill anyone who stands in her way.
Deep down Jon is convinced that Daenerys should not have attacked the city once it surrendered. Tyrion tells Jon that Daenerys will continue on this path until all cities and dominions are under her control. Sansa and Arya would never bow before Daenerys and Tyrion is also convinced that Daenerys will never spare them.Jon confronts Daenerys (little children were burnt in the streets by the fire from her dragon). He wants her to forgive Tyrion, but she refuses. Unable to halt her destructive path, Jon kills her. Drogon melts the Iron Throne, then gently carries Daenerys' body away.
The Unsullied and Yara are angry that Jon killed Daenerys and want Jon punished for this crime. Jon killed a queen and that is a capital crime. Grey Worm refuses to release Jon Snow, while Sansa is willing to go to war unless Jon is released unharmed. Davos offers them lands in the realm to settle and for peace, but Grey Worm refuses.
Tyrion is freed and proposes that all future monarchs be chosen by Westerosi leaders, rather than through familial succession. Edmure proposes himself, but Sansa shuts him down. Samwell proposes Democracy, where the people decide who rules them, but this is too radical an idea. Tyrion proposes Bran. Everyone agrees.Bran Stark is proclaimed king, titled Bran the Broken (he cant father children, which makes him even more attractive as an option).
Sansa withholds her vote as North wants independence. He grants Sansa the North's secession as an independent kingdom, and appoints Tyrion as his Hand.
Jon is sentenced to the Night's Watch to appease the Unsullied, who then set sail for Naath, Missandei's homeland.Tyrion reorganizes the Small Council - Brienne, Bronn, Davos, and Sam - to rebuild King's Landing. Podrick is knighted.
Sansa is crowned Queen in the North. Arya sets sail to explore west of Westeros.
Jon rejoins Tormund and Ghost at Castle Black, leading the Wildlings north of the Wall."]
plot outline: Jon is appalled when the Unsullied execute captured soldiers upon Daenerys' orders. Tyrion finds Jaime and Cersei dead in the ruins. Daenerys rallies the Unsullied and Dothraki, proclaiming she will lead them to "liberate" the entire world. Tyrion resigns as Hand of the Queen and is imprisoned for treason. Arya and Tyrion separately warn Jon that Daenerys is a threat to him, House Stark and the people. Jon confronts Daenerys. Unable to halt her destructive path, an agonized Jon kills her. Drogon, enraged, melts the Iron Throne, then carries away Daenerys' body. Later, Tyrion proposes that all future monarchs be chosen by Westerosi leaders, rather than familial succession. Bran Stark is proclaimed King Bran the Broken. He grants the North independence as a kingdom and appoints Tyrion his Hand. Jon is sentenced to the Night's Watch to appease the Unsullied, who set sail for Naath, Missandei's homeland. Tyrion reorganizes the Small Council (Brienne, Bronn, Davos and Sam) to rebuild King's Landing. Podrick is knighted. Sansa is crowned Queen in the North. Arya sets sail to explore unknown lands west of Westeros. Jon rejoins Tormund and Ghost at Castle Black, leading the Wildlings north of the Wall.
plot: In the aftermath of the devastating attack on King's Landing, Daenerys must face the survivors. Jon is appalled when the Unsullied execute captured soldiers upon Daenerys' orders. Tyrion finds Jaime and Cersei dead in the ruins. Daenerys rallies the Unsullied and Dothraki, proclaiming she will lead them to "liberate" the entire world. Tyrion resigns as Hand of the Queen and is imprisoned for treason. Arya and Tyrion separately warn Jon that Daenerys is a threat to him, House Stark and the people. Jon confronts Daenerys. Unable to halt her destructive path, an agonized Jon kills her. Drogon, enraged, melts the Iron Throne, then carries away Daenerys' body. Later, Tyrion proposes that all future monarchs be chosen by Westerosi leaders, rather than familial succession. Bran Stark is proclaimed King Bran the Broken. He grants the North independence as a kingdom and appoints Tyrion his Hand. Jon is sentenced to the Night's Watch to appease the Unsullied, who set sail for Naath, Missandei's homeland. Tyrion reorganizes the Small Council (Brienne, Bronn, Davos and Sam) to rebuild King's Landing. Podrick is knighted. Sansa is crowned Queen in the North. Arya sets sail to explore unknown lands west of Westeros. Jon rejoins Tormund and Ghost at Castle Black, leading the Wildlings north of the Wall.
